[From.GetSheHe] says [From.GetSheHe] cannot stay long, but these men should help keep [FromFromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] in line.
Oh, happy day!

I only stayed in [From.Capital.GetName] for a little while. However, I left a behind a few advisors and hardened retainers to keep an eye on [From.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] in my absence. My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetFirstName], said she feels much more secure and thanked me profusely. Hopefully this will be enough to prevent further trouble.
We shall see...

An obstacle to my plans has arisen: [FromFrom.GetTitledName] recently visited [From.GetFirstName], leaving behind a group of faithful retainers and advisors—all more capable than [From.GetFirstName], and clearly instructed to stymy my efforts. Unless I deal with them, I will not be able to take [From.GetFirstName]'s titles.
There is nothing I can do...
I will kill them all, if I must
Clever subversion is called for
I will win them over with my charm

It has been a week since [FromFromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s retainers came to [Root.Capital.GetName], and since then I have seen little of [From.GetFirstName]. He sulks, frustrated, but there is little he can do. It seems my rule is safe, at least for the moment.
This is a great relief

You endured the swaggering and arrogance of your wife's new allies for a few days. Then, one day while they were out hunting, you tracked them down with a dozen of your most vicious hired swords. The fighting was murderously brutal, yet surprise was complete, and the victor was never in doubt. Now nothing can stop you.

You endured the swaggering and arrogance of your wife's new allies for a few days. Then, one day while they were out hunting, you tracked them down with a dozen hired swords. Unfortunately, they had somehow learned of your intentions, and were ready and waiting. The fighting was murderous, but never truly in doubt. Thankfully, you escaped with your life. Another attempt will not be possible.

Your wife's new allies have no true loyalty to her, that much is obvious. Clever as they are, they are still subject to the weaknesses of most men. A few bribes, some well-timed blackmail, and some subtle threats from your hirelings is all it takes to make them bend to your will. Now there is nothing to stop you.

Try as you might, you just can't seem to find a weakness among your wife's new allies. The few you can bribe are quickly dismissed, and the others catch onto your scheme far faster than you would like. Before long, any interaction with you becomes hostile. There will be no getting around them, now. Your plan is done.

Although your wife's new allies were initially suspicious towards you, your charm and chivalrous nature won them over. Before long, you were laughing and drinking with them in the [FromFrom.Capital.GetName] brothel, and they were openly questioning the purpose of their mission. Perhaps [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] would be better off with you in charge? Now there is nothing to stop you.

You were determined to show [FromFromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s retainers that you were a superior ruler, in whose hands your wife's dominions would truly be best served. Unfortunately, what you assumed to be a lordly bearing came across to them as laughably arrogant. Soon, they were sniggering behind your back and swaggering about in ridiculing imitation. Your plan is done.

I don't know how he did it, but somehow [From.GetFirstName] has managed to circumvent the new retainers. They are nowhere to be seen, and he is swaggering around my castle in [Root.Capital.GetName] as if he already owns it. Perhaps I should resign myself to the fact that he does.
That sneaky bastard!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] responded to your letter quickly, arriving at [Root.Capital.GetName] alone and listening intently to your tale of woe. [From.GetSheHeCap] frowned at your mention of [FromFromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s behavior, and came up with a plan to...
...find and intimidate anyone supporting him
...use bribery to eliminate his supporters
...drum up popular support among your vassals

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] recently visited [From.GetFirstName], and [FromFrom.GetSheHe] is clearly the one responsible for the campaign of intimidation that is making your supporters drop like flies. [From.GetFirstName] would never have the gumption to do this. Regardless, the tactic is successful...and very soon your plans are in tatters.

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] recently visited [From.GetFirstName], and [FromFrom.GetSheHe] is clearly the one responsible for the campaign of intimidation against your supporters. As clever as the tactic might be, it's not enough. The outrage actually gains you MORE supporters, and before long they have to abandon their plan completely.

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] recently visited [From.GetFirstName], and not long after your supporters began to waver. Too late you learn that [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] is bribing and blackmailing many of them, causing others to run for the hills. You try to salvage the situation, but it's no use. [From.GetFirstName] has won.

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] recently visited [From.GetFirstName], and not long after you learned that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] was attempting to bribe away your supporters. Thankfully, you acted quickly enough, and stoked their outrage to the point that now you have even more supporters that before. [From.GetFirstName] is finished.[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] recently visited [From.GetFirstName], and not long after you learned that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] was attempting to bribe away your supporters. Thankfully, you acted quickly enough, and stoked their outrage to the point that now you have even more supporters that before. [From.GetFirstName] is finished.

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] recently visited [From.GetFirstName], and not long after you learned [FromFrom.GetSheHe] was touring the countryside, visiting vassals and drumming up support for [From.GetFirstName]. You attempted to intervene, but it was too late. [From.GetFirstName] has too much support for her cause now. Your plan is done.

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] recently visited [From.GetFirstName], and not long after you learned [FromFrom.GetSheHe] was touring the countryside, visiting vassals and drumming up support for [From.GetFirstName]. Whatever they thought to do, it failed. Many of the vassals are laughing at her expense, and you're laughing along with them. It was a nice try, feeble as it was.

[FromFromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s plan worked. Already [From.GetFirstName] is seen far less around [Root.Capital.GetName], and when he is it is spent sulking. You have no illusions that he might not try again someday, but for now [From.GetFirstName]'s ambitions have been ended.
What a relief!

It worked. You went to [FromFrom.Capital.GetName] and came up with a plan to stop [From.GetTitledFirstName] from taking over [FromFrom.GetFirstName]'s lands, and while your efforts won't win you any favor with the man they did stop his ambitions cold. [FromFrom.GetFirstName] was incredibly grateful.

It was not enough. [FromFromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] did what [FromFromFrom.GetSheHe] could, but [From.GetFirstName] caught wind of the plan too quickly and was able to counter it. Indeed, he stoked enough outrage that now he has even more support than before. Alas, there is nothing to be done now but give in to his demands.
That bastard!

You went to [FromFrom.Capital.GetName] and came up with a plan to stop [From.GetTitledFirstName] from taking over [FromFrom.GetFirstName]'s lands, but in the end it was not enough. [From.GetFirstName] caught wind of the effort and intervened, stoking enough outrage so that now he has even more support than before. [FromFrom.GetFirstName] is left with no recourse but to give in.
I'm sorry, [FromFrom.GetFirstName], I did what I could

You can tell that [From.GetFirstName] is not pleased, but there is nothing more she can do. No-one else can help her, and the laws of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are clearly on your side. By the right of Jure Uxoris, her titles are yours.
It is done

The principle of Jure Uxoris states that a husband owns the titles of his wife by right, and the laws of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] support it. Thus [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] has stepped forward and demanded [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s titles become his—and he cannot be denied. As of today, he has officially usurped his wife's lands.
What? This is an outrage!
If that is how it must be, I will not oppose it

You begin exerting more and more influence in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. You supercede [From.GetFirstName]'s commands, and give orders to the guardsmen...and you can tell they are almost relieved that a man is doing so. The council reports to you almost before they report to [From.GetFirstName]. Either she acts soon or she will have no hope of stopping you from usurping her titles.
Let's see what she does...

For quite some time now you have watched the steady decline of the [Root.Religion.GetName] religion. You listen to the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s as they read from the [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], and you can't help but wonder if they haven't lost their way. Perhaps the time has come to return to the ways of your [Root.Culture.GetName] ancestors?
Adopting the Old Ways
Zoroaster will lead us to enlightenment!
It's time to visit the elder druids
To the gods of old!
Valhalla awaits!
To the gods of old!
God will not lead us astray
Let us look to the pantheon for guidance
We will follow the teachings of Mani
Maybe give them one more chance...
In Search of Ancient Knowledge

As you delve into the realm of manuscripts and dusty tomes, it comes to your attention that there is a great deal of knowledge to be found in the past -- knowledge that [Root.Religion.GetName] scholars might consider forbidden even though it is the legacy of your ancestors.
I will pursue such knowledge, no matter the cost
I am not interested in that kind of trouble

You are informed that a strange mystic has shown up at [Root.Location.GetName], asking to be admitted into your court. He claims to have heard of your studies of the arcane, and says that if he is allowed to stay he would aid your efforts. Several councillors tell you such a heretic should be sent away at once.
Let him stay
Send him away--I have no interest in his ramblings

You are approached by [target_pagan_advisor.GetBestName] while in your library: 'I know what it is you seek. There are teachings in the ancient [target_pagan_advisor.Religion.GetName] ways, things your [Root.Religion.GetName] faith has never dreamed of. I could tell you of them, if you are willing to listen.'
Tell me more...
Enough! This has gone too far!

[target_concerned_priest.GetTitledName] approaches you out of concern: 'My [Root.GetLordLady], I have heard of your strange studies, and they are dangerous and heretical! Are you or are you not a devout follower of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and a member of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith? You must desist at once!'
I am not one of your faithful!
Perhaps you are right...
If I am to turn [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] from [From.GetHerHis] heathen ways into a true [Root.Religion.GetName], I must consider my approach carefully.
Convince [From.GetHerHim] to convert
Engage [From.GetHerHim] in a religious debate
Threaten [From.GetHerHim] with imprisonment
[From.GetSheHeCap] may go free if [From.GetSheHe] converts
Perhaps this isn't the time

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] summons you to [From.GetHerHis] court, and it is there you realize [From.GetSheHe] intends to convert you to [From.GetHerHis] [From.Religion.GetName] beliefs. 'I intend you no harm,' [From.GetSheHe] assures you, 'only the salvation of your immortal soul.'
Agree to convert
Perhaps [From.GetHerHis] words have some merit...
[From.GetSheHeCap] will not dissuade me!

You summon [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] to your court, and there you use reason and diplomacy to urge [From.GetHerHim] to see the light. Thankfully, it is not long before your words take root, and [From.GetSheHe] agrees to convert to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith as you've requested.

You summon [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] to your court, and there you use reason and diplomacy to urge [From.GetHerHim] to see the light. [From.GetSheHeCap] listens intently, and you can tell that [From.GetSheHe] has been moved to sympathy for the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith, but, in the end, [From.GetSheHe] still refuses to convert.
This will have to do, for now

You summon [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] to your court, and there you use reason and diplomacy to urge [From.GetHerHim] to see the light. It is not long, however, before you realize [From.GetSheHe] has stopped listening. 'I am a [From.Religion.GetName] [From.GetManWoman], my liege,' [From.GetSheHe] states, 'and that I shall remain.'

You summon [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] to your court, with the intent to engage [From.GetHerHim] in theological debate...but [From.GetSheHe] outright refuses. 'You are my liege,' [From.GetSheHe] states, 'but I will not presume to discuss [From.Religion.GetName] with a [Root.Religion.GetName]. This is not a matter for debate, and I remain faithful to [From.Religion.GetHighGodName].'

You summon [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] to your court, and there the two of you begin a long debate over the differences between your faiths. No matter what point you make, however, [From.GetSheHe] refuses to be moved. 'You speak well, my liege,' [From.GetSheHe] states, 'but I am a [From.Religion.GetName] [From.GetManWoman], and that I shall remain.'
I must accept [From.GetHerHis] decision
Imprison [From.GetHerHim] at once!

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] summons you to [From.GetHerHis] court, and it is there you realize [From.GetSheHe] intends to convert you to [From.GetHerHis] [From.Religion.GetName] beliefs. 'Debate me,' [From.GetSheHe] offers. 'Let us use facts and theology to determine which of our faiths is more worthy of your devotion.'
Agree to the debate
My faith is not a matter of debate!

After long hours of theological debate with [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], you are forced to admit that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] is right. The [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] faith is the true faith, and you can no longer hold onto the [Root.Religion.GetName] ways you have always known.
Glory be to [FromFrom.Religion.GetHighGodName]!

After long hours of theological debate with [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], [From.GetSheHe] is forced to admit that you are right. The [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] faith is the true faith, and [From.GetSheHe] can no longer hold onto the [From.Religion.GetName] ways [From.GetSheHe] has always known.
Glory be to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!

After long hours of theological debate with [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], you are forced to admit that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has a point. You will not be swayed from your [Root.Religion.GetName] beliefs, but even you have begun to question whether they are the entire truth. The [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] faith has gained your sympathy, if not your devotion.
[FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] was very convincing

After long hours of theological debate with [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], [From.GetSheHe] is forced to admit that you have a point. [From.GetSheHeCap] will not be swayed from [From.GetHerHis] [From.Religion.GetName] beliefs, but even [From.GetSheHe] has begun to question whether they are the entire truth. The [Root.Religion.GetName] faith has gained [From.GetHerHis] sympathy, if not [From.GetHerHis] devotion.
It is a start!

After long hours of theological debate with [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], [FromFrom.GetSheHe] is forced to admit that you have a point. Unsurprisingly, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] will not be swayed from [FromFrom.GetHerHis] [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] beliefs, but even [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has begun to question whether they are the entire truth. The [Root.Religion.GetName] faith has gained [FromFrom.GetHerHis] sympathy.

After many long hours of theological debate with [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], you are forced to admit that [From.GetSheHe] has a point. You will not, of course, be swayed from your [Root.Religion.GetName] beliefs, but even you have begun to question whether they are the entire truth. The [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] faith has gained your sympathy.
I was not expecting that...

After many long hours of theological debate with [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], [FromFrom.GetSheHe] is forced to concede defeat. The back and forth arguments regarding [Root.Religion.GetName] and [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] views seems to go nowhere, and in the end you are unmoved...and you tell [FromFrom.GetHerHim] exactly that.
In truth, I expected no less

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] summons you to [From.GetHerHis] court, and it is there you realize you are in trouble. 'I cannot have a member of my court spreading these false beliefs,' [From.GetSheHe] tells you sternly. 'I must demand that you convert to the [From.Religion.GetName] faith, or it is prison for you.'
[From.GetSheHeCap] leaves me no choice...
I will not bow to a [From.Religion.GetName] tyrant!

You summon [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] to your court, and there you explain the reality of [From.GetHerHis] situation: as [From.GetHerHis] liege, you cannot have [From.GetHerHim] spreading a false faith among your other subjects. Facing imprisonment, [From.GetSheHe] reluctantly agrees to convert.

You summon [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] to your court, and there you explain the reality of [From.GetHerHis] situation: as [From.GetHerHis] liege, you cannot have [From.GetHerHim] spreading a false faith among your other subjects. Even with the threat of prison, however, [From.GetSheHe] remains adamant: 'I will not bow to a [Root.Religion.GetName] tyrant'.
I will let it slide...this time
I do not make idle threats!

Your time in [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s prison soon draws to an end, as the jailors come to you with an ultimatum: convert to the [From.Religion.GetName] faith, and you shall be free. Refuse, and you will die. You reluctantly agree, though in your heart you scarcely believe the words even as you utter them.
I will never forgive [From.GetHerHim] for this!

[zealous_courtier.GetTitledName] recently confronted you in [Root.Location.GetName]: 'I have listened when you speak of these other religions and how you sympathize with their beliefs, and I begin to wonder if you are even truly [Root.Religion.GetName]. What would [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] think of such heresy?'
I do not know [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s mind any more than you
Sometimes I wonder if [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] even exists
Perhaps you are right...
Your piety has been rewarded. [Root.RelHead.GetTitledName] has granted you the title of Apostle, and anointed you as one of the electors who shall choose [Root.RelHead.GetHerHis] successor.
Your piety has been rewarded. You have been chosen to ascend into the ranks of the Circle of Druids, and are now one of the electors to choose [Root.RelHead.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s successor.
Your piety has been rewarded. [Root.RelHead.GetTitledName] has granted you the title of Pontiff, and anointed you as one of the electors who shall choose [Root.RelHead.GetHerHis] successor.
Your piety has been rewarded. [Root.RelHead.GetTitledName] has granted you the title of Deacon, and anointed you as one of the electors who shall choose [Root.RelHead.GetHerHis] successor.
Your piety has been rewarded. [Root.RelHead.GetTitledName] has granted you the title of Stroinik, and anointed you as one of the electors who shall choose [Root.RelHead.GetHerHis] successor.
Your vassal [From.GetFirstName] was given a seat on the Council of Apostles.
Your vassal [From.GetFirstName] has become a member of the Circle of Druids.
Your vassal [From.GetFirstName] was given a seat on the College of Pontiffs.
Your vassal [From.GetFirstName] was given a seat on the Council of Perfecti.
Your vassal [From.GetFirstName] was given a seat on the Council of Advisors.
[From.GetFirstName] was given a seat on the Council of Apostles.
[From.GetFirstName] has become a member of the Circle of Druids.
[From.GetFirstName] was given a seat on the College of Pontiffs.
[From.GetFirstName] was given a seat on the Council of Perfecti.
[From.GetFirstName] was given a seat on the Council of Advisors.

You find yourself touring an impoverished province, when word reaches you of a band of ruffians terrorizing local farmers. You remember Zarathustra preaching not only to live righteously but to actively fight evil whenever one can.
Hunt them down yourself
Send a squad of your guards
Let the locals handle it themselves

A petition came today from your Muslim vassals to help them rebuild their mosque destroyed in a recent fire. Will you choose the path of tolerance chosen by many of the famous Zoroastrian Shahs of old, or will you ignore those not following the teachings of Zarathustra?
Help them
Ignore their plight
Today I partake in Sedreh Pushi, an ancient initiation ritual. From this day on I will be a proud member of the Zoroastrian flock
Ask my father for advice

Today your child, [From.GetTitledFirstName], partakes in a Sedreh Pushi, an initiation ceremony. [From.GetSheHeCap] will don a shirt (Sudreh), girdle (Kushti), and a covering for the head and begin a new life as a member of the Zoroastrian flock. You can use this opportunity to teach [From.GetHerHim] something about your faith.
Talk to [From.GetHerHim] about Asha, righteousness
Talk to [From.GetHerHim] about Khshatr, divine power
Talk to [From.GetHerHim] about Armaiti, devotion
Talk to [From.GetHerHim] about Vohu Manah, holy spirit
I have nothing to teach [From.GetHerHim]

You have decided to rebuild the capital of the ancient Persian empire, albeit in a slightly new location. You commission quarries to deliver large amounts of marble and gather masons from around the realm to build it. How ambitious should this project be?
Make it even greater than it was!
Persepolis Rebuilt!

The new city is almost complete. What do you want to work on as a great project to complete the city? You can rebuild the ancient library to further our scholars' work, you can reconstruct the irrigation system to allow you to support more troops, or you can rebuild the Gate of all nations to dazzle the emmisaries from the poeples you subjugated.
Rebuild the library.
Reconstruct the irrigation system.
Rebuild the Gate of All Nations.
New Persepolis
The task is complete. New Persepolis has been erected.
Our Empire will never fall again and the world will bathe in our splendor.
Persepolis is restored!

The splendor of Persepolis has been restored many centuries after the destruction of the original in around 330 BC by Alexander the Great. In a new location, New Persepolis seeks to be the beacon of renewed hope at the heart of a new Persian Empire. Already many Persians are seeking to expand the borders of their reborn realm even further.
Worrisome...
Immortal Once More

With the formation of the Persian kingdom, an old terror returns to the world. The Zhayedan (or, as they are more commonly known, Immortals) seek once again to strike fear into the hearts of the enemies of the Persians, as they did in centuries past when they numbered ten thousand strong. These elite units are comparable to the Greek cataphracts of their time and are equipped with only the finest of equipment and horses. Truly they are a force worthy of the world’s attention.
A New Persian Empire

With the reformation of the Persian Empire and the growing of its borders, the Shahanshah has decided that a second force of Zhayedan elites will be required. It would be a grave mistake to underestimate the power of this resurgent Persian Empire, as no one can doubt their legitimacy at this point. But in what direction will their ambitions drive them?
The Great Sacrifice

You feel the time is right to make a great sacrifice to one of the divinities of Zoroastrianism. As you begin to plan the event, you realize that you haven’t even decided on which divinity to sacrifice to. After some deliberation you decide to make a great sacrifice…
... to Mithra, a divinity associated with war.
... to Parendi, a divinity associated with riches.
... to Chisti, a divinity associated with wisdom.
... to none of them. It was a silly idea after all.
The Cleansing Ritual

You approach a set of 6 holes about two feet deep for the ritual. The closest three are filled with gomez (consecrated bull’s urine, an effective ancient sanitizer). The furthest three are filled with water. There is a holy fire on the far end and you come to the realization that the priests are waiting for you to begin the ritual. As you recite Yasna 49 with the priests and approach the first gomez filled hole.
I praise Thee, O Mazda Ahura, in my hymns and expect enjoying what Thou deemest the best.
Choosing the Shekhinah

The Manichaeans believed there were five 'Shekhinah', which are the elements where the Divine dwells. Each Manichaean can choose an element upon which to focus, and once chosen that focus cannot be changed.
I will focus upon Haunâ, or Reason
I will focus upon Madde'â, or Mind
I will focus upon Reyana, or Intelligence
There are other Shekhinah to consider...
I will focus upon Mahíabtâ, or Thought
I will focus upon Tar'îtâ, or Understanding
The New Archegos

After the Manichean Archegos was murdered by the Caliph in Baghdad, many thought that was the end of the religion as an organized church. But like a phoenix rising from its ashes, [new_manichean_leader.GetTitledName] has been proclaimed the new Archegos by [Root.GetTitledName], with the Manichean faith having enough power now to make him no mere charlatan.
A glorious day!
And so the heresy grows more powerful...
The Army of Light

The growing power of the Manichaeans can no longer be denied. With the aid of [Root.GetTitledName], a group of fanatics, peasants, and madmen have now banded together to create their own army, to smite heathens and infidels and to protect the righteous. They call themselves the Army of Light, and their holy mission is to fight for the cause of good -- in the eyes of the Manichaeans -- and drive darkness out of the world.
A glorious day!

My [Root.GetLordLady], this extremely generous donation will not be forgotten. You have my friendship, as well as that of the Manichean Church. Rest assured that you will be rewarded in the afterlife, if not on Earth!
Yours in faith,

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

My [Root.GetLordLady], this antagonism is completely unwarranted! The Army of Light serves [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], but, one has to wonder, do you?

With anger and sadness,

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

Religious leaders from the province of Baghdad are complaining about the prevelance of Manichaean worshippers. 'It is horrible that you can not walk down a street in Baghdad without tripping over half a dozen Manicheans. Why should we let these infidels continue to live while they tempt others away from the true faith?' They are asking that something be done, lest this become an even greater problem in the years to come.
We shall crush the Archegos and his followers
No, I will not attack the innocent
Manichaeans Slaughtered

The province of Baghdad was once the center of the Manichaean faith, home to [manichean_leader.GetTitledName] who is their leader. After complaints by [Root.Religion.GetName] worshippers, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has begun a slaughter of all Manichaeans in the region -- beginning with [manichean_leader.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] and so ravaging the population that the scholar Ibn al-Nadim reports only finding five remaining in the entire city after the pogrom was finished. The Manicheaean position of Archegos now lies empty, and looks to remain so.
An outrage!
So must it be
After the battle is over, your soldiers hail the victory as a great triumph of the Army of Light over your foes, in service to the Army of Darkness.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] watches over us!
After the battle is over, your soldiers curse the defeat as a great triumph of the Army of Darkness over the Army of Light, and shiver in their sleep.
It is the work of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]!

You have begun preparations for the Bema Feast, to celebrate the life and death of the Prophet Mani. You send out messengers with invitations to your vassals, expecting all to come and honor [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
This year it will be very special!

Dear vassal,
I hereby invite you to attend the celebration of the Bema Feast at [From.Capital.GetName].

Your Liege,
[From.GetTitledName]
Of course I will go!
No, I will not attend

My [Root.GetLordLady],
Alas, I will not be able to attend the Bema Feast. I will offer thanks to Mani in a much more humble affair at [From.Capital.GetName], but I do appreciate your invitation.

With sincerity,
[From.GetTitledName]
The nerve!
Guests have arrived from villages throughout the realm, to celebrate the Bema Feast in [Root.Capital.GetName]. The festivities are almost ready to begin!

Guests have arrived from villages throughout [Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName], to celebrate the Bema Feast in [Liege.Capital.GetName]. [Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] greets you at the entrance to [Liege.GetHerHis] estate, and it seems the festivities are almost ready to begin!
The Bema Feast is over for now. Another celebration of Light to drive back the Darkness.
It is customary to fast in religious reflection before the start of the Bema Feast. Will you take part in this tradition?
I will fast for a week
I will fast for the next three days
Go without food? Perish the thought!
The Singing of Hymns

The Bema Feast starts with the singing of various hymns that celebrate the return of spring, the life and death of the Prophet Mani, and the battles the Forces of Light have won over the Armies of Darkness. All those gathered raise their voices to the gods, a chorus of faith and beauty that touches the soul.
This is my favorite part
The Feast of the Elect

Only the Elect -- those who are devoted to the Manichaean faith -- are invited to take part in a ritual meal, which both symbolizes the life of Mani and the theology of the Manicheans. To take part is a great honor.
Honor and Glory!
The Presentation of the Arzhang

The Arzhang, or Picture Book, is a work painted by Mani himself, which depicts the Manichean theology in simple terms, so that even the uneducated can read and understand the faith. The book rests on the bema until the feast is over, after which a priest recites sermons from it and absolves the sins of those attending.
Praise be to [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
The Persian Uprising

It is said that the Abbasids would never have been able to seize the caliphate without the aid of the great Persian general, Abu Muslim, who in the end was rewarded for his service with death -- executed on the order of Caliph Al-Mansur. Resentment for this perceived betrayal has long simmered as resentment among the Persian people, resentment which has now broken out in open rebellion. A peasant leader by the name of Babak, aided by his capable wife Banu, an effective general and archer in her own right, has risen up to free his nation from the unjust rule of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]...and has already attracted a massive following, enough to present a real threat to the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].
This is an outrage!
It's about time!
The Mazdaki Priesthood

Although the Prophet Mazdak always railed against the corruption of the Zoroastrian Priesthood, and his followers have never had an official structure to speak of, now that the faith has risen to such prominence under [Root.GetTitledName] it seems the time has come to give it to them. With [new_mazdaki_leader.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] chosen as the new [new_mazdaki_leader.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of the [new_mazdaki_leader.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], the Mazdaki faith has entered a new era, with a priesthood rivalling that of the Zoroastrians from which they once stemmed...and have, perhaps, now exceeded.
A glorious day!

The Mazdaki teach there are four Powers that bring Light into the World: Discernment, Understanding, Preservation, and Joy. Any adult member of the faith may embrace one of these Powers. in an attempt to achieve eventual perfection.
I choose the Power of Discernment
I choose the Power of Understanding
I choose the Power of Preservation
I choose the Power of Joy

You have begun preparations for the Tawûsgeran festival, also known as the 'Circulation of the Peacock'. You send out messengers with invitations to your Yazidi vassals, expecting all to come and honor Melek Taus, greatest among the seven angels.
I've been looking forward to this

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],

The time has come once again for us all to celebrate the Tawûsgeran, a time to honor Melek Taus - He who is most holy amongst the seven angels. The festival will take place in [From.Capital.GetName], and you are hereby formally invited to attend.
Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

The Tawûsgeran festival is well under way when you finally arrive in [FromFrom.Capital.GetName]. Priests walk throughout the crowds, giving out vials of holy water to the faithful. You can hear the holy rites to the Seven being chanted at shrines everywhere you walk, though the name of Melek Taus is most prominent amongst them.
An excellent time, to be sure

Peasants are streaming into [Root.Capital.GetName] from all over [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] for the beginning of the Tawûsgeran festival, and already your vassals are arriving. The chanting of rites to Melek Taus can be heard from the many shrines at your window, and soon the true celebrations will begin.
The Circulation of the Peacock

The Circulation of the Peacock is about to start! In accordance with tradition, priests and pious men carry the senjaq, statues of the Seven Archangels, in circles around the city as they distribute blessings. To carry one of the statues is an honor reserved for only those of great wisdom and piety, as well as an event requiring considerable strength and willpower.
I wish to carry one of the statues!
I am content to watch the proceedings

As you carry the heavy senjaq around, you discover that it is rather heavier than you expected. The unaccustomed weight causes you to stumble, and the idol slips out of your hands and crashes down to the ground and is damaged. Everyone stares in horror as you quickly pick it back up.
Only a few people saw that...right?

As you carry the heavy senjaq around, the weight and the heat begin to take their toll upon you. As if in a dream, you begin to hear the voices of the Seven Archangels talking, telling you secrets and mysteries...
They have visited me! I am blessed!
With each step of the Circulation, more and more of the truth of your faith is reveled to you. Of course this is the proper path. How could any man doubt such a truth?
For the glory of Menek Taus!

Perhaps it is the power of faith that fills you, but what once seemed so heavy at the beginning now feels as light as feather. Why, you could carry this senjaq around all day if the priests would let you!
Strength comes from faith
Veneration of the Senjaq

After the senjaq have been paraded around the city, the populace of the city comes forward to present their sacrifices and tributes. You visit each senjaq in turn, praying for the wisdom of the Seven Archangels, venerating them with holy incense.
For Wisdom and Honor
Gifts From the Pious

The final stage of the Tawûsgeran festival is the collection of alms from the pious. Every man and woman is expected to give, a contribution to the greater faith and in support of those in need. While most give only a few coins, those who are able are expected to give much more.
I am a pious [Root.GetManWoman]
I will give what I must, no more
Ignore this nonsense

The final ceremony is a grand sermon of thanksgiving to God and his servants. It was a rousing sermon as always, and the crowd begins the feast with great abandon. Another glorious celebration of the Seven Archangels has been completed!
Praise the Seven!
The Tawûsgeran is over for now, and already the many decorations are being taken down. Melek Taus has been properly honored, and the realm is looking forward to a bright future under His wisdom.
Until next time!
Sadly, the death of [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] means the Circulation of the Peacock must be canceled.
Such is how it is
A Koasasa is Discovered

The concept of metempsychosis, or rebirth, is central to the Yazidi faith. Indeed, they believe it is possible for the Seven Archangels to be reborn among the faithful as 'koasasa'. Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Peacock Angel himself, Melek Taus. Yazidi throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.

The concept of metempsychosis, or rebirth, is central to the Yazidi faith. Indeed, they believe it is possible for the Seven Archangels to be reborn among the faithful as 'koasasa'. Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Burning Angel of the Trumpet, Melek Israfel. Yazidi throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.

The concept of metempsychosis, or rebirth, is central to the Yazidi faith. Indeed, they believe it is possible for the Seven Archangels to be reborn among the faithful as 'koasasa'. Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Angel of Death, Melek Azrael. Yazidi throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.

The concept of metempsychosis, or rebirth, is central to the Yazidi faith. Indeed, they believe it is possible for the Seven Archangels to be reborn among the faithful as 'koasasa'. Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Commander of the Armies of God, Melek Mihael. Yazidi throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.

The concept of metempsychosis, or rebirth, is central to the Yazidi faith. Indeed, they believe it is possible for the Seven Archangels to be reborn among the faithful as 'koasasa'. Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Great Angel, Melek Dardael. Yazidi throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.

The concept of metempsychosis, or rebirth, is central to the Yazidi faith. Indeed, they believe it is possible for the Seven Archangels to be reborn among the faithful as 'koasasa'. Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Accuser and Destroyer, Melek Samael. Yazidi throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.

The concept of metempsychosis, or rebirth, is central to the Yazidi faith. Indeed, they believe it is possible for the Seven Archangels to be reborn among the faithful as 'koasasa'. Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Great Angel, Melek Nurael. Yazidi throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.
I will do my best to live up to this honor
A glorious day for us all

The pilgrimage to Lalish, a site just outside of the bustling city of Mosul, is one of the most important journeys a Yazidi can undertake. There one attends the Feast of the Assembly, and returns filled with the spirit and strength of the Seven Archangels...or so the story goes.

The day has come. Your belongings are packed, arrangements have been made for matters in [Root.Capital.GetName] to be attended to while you are away, and your departure has been kept quiet to prevent the unsavory from taking advantage of your solitary journey. Now you must begin your journey to Lalish.
Arrival at Lalish

You arrive in the bustling city of holy Mosul, and it is not long before you make your way to Lalish, a mountain valley village not far to the north. This sleepy place is where the Yazidi faith truly began, and as the Feast of the Assembly unfolds, prayers offered to the Seven Archangels up in the heavens, you marvel at the conical roofs of Sheikh Adi ibn Musafir's tomb. The rest of your stay will be spent in Mosul, but you cannot help but feel overcome at having taken a path so many have walked before you.
Now, what to do next?
The Yazidi Faith

There are many who claim the Yazidi to be devil-worshippers, due to their veneration of the Peacock Angel they call Melek Taus or Shaytan. This has led the Yazidi to be considered Muslim heretics for countless generations, even though their religion incorporates syncretic elements of not only the Muslim faith but also Gnosticism and Zoroastrianism. Now, with [Root.GetTitledName] having risen to such power, [Root.GetSheHe] has declared the Yazidi to be their own faith and no heresy -- and [Root.GetSheHe] has the prestige to be listened to. In the end, it may change nothing save to the Yazidi themselves, but even so it is a sign as to just how far they have come since the ancient days of worshipping at hidden temples in the Kurdish foothills.
Praise to Melek Taus!
They are still devil-worshippers

A leader of a minor clan by the name of [minor_clan_leader.GetFullName] has recently arisen in [Root.GetName], and has proven charismatic enough to attract a large number of followers. He is demanding the recognition of his clan, and that [Root.GetName] be granted as their rightful grazing lands.
Give him the land
Never! He will have to fight for it!
The Province of Cyrenaica et Creta

The citizens of Cyrenaica et Creta can rejoice, as Roman law is once more upheld in this barren land. Yet another ancient Roman province has been returned to the bosom of the mightiest empire the civilised world has ever seen. May it never suffer the cruel touch of barbarians again.
The Province of Asia
The ancient region of Asia is the latest addition to the ever-expanding domains of the Roman Empire.
The Province of Macedonia
The ancient region of Macedonia is the latest addition to the ever-expanding domains of the Roman Empire.
The Province of Pontus
The ancient region of Pontus is the latest addition to the ever-expanding domains of the Roman Empire.
The Province of Thracia
The ancient region of Thracia is the latest addition to the ever-expanding domains of the Roman Empire.

With the city under [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] control, the Patriarchate of Antioch has been properly restored as one of the episcopal sees of the Pentarchy in the [Root.Religion.GetName] Church. It was originally founded by Saint Peter the Apostle, who is regarded as the first Pope by the Western Catholic Church.

With the city under [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] control, the Patriarchate of Jerusalem has been properly restored as one of the episcopal sees of the Pentarchy in the [Root.Religion.GetName] Church. It was originally founded by Saint James the Just, who was made head of the Church in Jerusalem soon after the death of Jesus.

With the city under [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] control, the Patriarchate of Alexandria has been properly restored as one of the episcopal sees of the Pentarchy in the [Root.Religion.GetName] Church. It was originally founded by Saint Mark the Evangelist, who became Alexandria's first patriarch.

With the city under [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] control, the Patriarchate of Rome has been properly restored as one of the episcopal sees of the Pentarchy in the [Root.Religion.GetName] Church. If all five historical patriarchates are returned to the Pentarchy, it will be perhaps be possible for the Great Schism which has divided eastern and western Christianity to finally be mended.

With the city now under [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] control, the Patriarchate of Constantinople has been properly restored as one of the episcopal sees of the Pentarchy in the [Root.Religion.GetName] Church. If all five historical patriarchates are returned to the Pentarchy, it will be perhaps be possible for the Great Schism which has divided eastern and western Christianity to finally be mended.
The Province of Sicilia
Imperial rule over Sicilia, one of the last western outposts of the Empire to be lost to barbarian rule, has been reinstated yet again - this time hopefully for good.
The Province of Corsica et Sardinia

The islands of Corsica and Sardinia, originally incorporated in the empire after the First Punic War, are yet again under imperial rule. The conquest of this strategic location in the Mediterranian heralds a glorious westward expansion of the Empire.
The Province of Viennensis

Viennensis, named after the town Vienne in southeastern Gaul, has long been lost to Roman rule, but has now been incorporated back into the Empire. It was originally formed as a merger of the provinces Gallia Aquitania and Gallia Narbonensis created by Caesar after his campaigns had expanded the old province of Gaul too far to be administered as a single province.
The Province of Pannonia-Dacia
At the Empire's greatest extent, during the rule of Emperor Trajan, both Pannonia and Dacia were under Roman rule. Now, once again, these lands are back in the Empire, where they belong.
The Province of Armenia
At the Empire's greatest extent, during the rule of Emperor Trajan, Armenia was under Roman rule. Now, once again, this land is back in the Empire, where it belongs.
I have decided to pardon [From.GetTitledName] of all [From.GetHerHis] crimes.
Mercy is a virtue
Eh, never mind
I have decided to grant estates and land to [From.GetFullName], but how much land will [From.GetSheHe] receive?
A minor estate
A moderate estate
A large estate
None at all!
Today, my [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] asked me for landed estates to live off...
I gave [From.GetHerHim] what [From.GetSheHe] wanted
I told [From.GetHerHim] I could not afford it...
I have arranged for the sale of my old estates so that I can concentrate my wealth to the lands that I now hold.
A claim on a title has been discovered!
I have learned that [From.GetTitledName] has laid claim to one of my titles on the grounds of ancestral inheritance.
[From.GetSheHeCap] better not try anything!
I have ruled long enough, and my health is no longer what it once was. Perhaps the time has come to pass my titles onto my heir?
Yes, it is time
No, not just yet
[From.GetTitledName] has decided to voluntarily abdicate [From.GetHerHis] rule, citing poor health and other concerns. [From.GetHerHisCap] titles have been passed onto me.
[From.GetSheHeCap] will surely be missed

Even though you have been trying to conceive a child with your husband, it simply hasn't happened... and you are beginning to suspect you might be barren. Some of the maids have whispered that there are things which can be done to remedy this, although they are not entirely without risk.
I don't care about the risk! I want a child!
I will put my faith in [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]
[Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] will get no child from me

For some time now, your councilors have made their suspicions known that [barren_wife.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is, in fact, barren. You've denied it, certain that the two of you would have a child before long... but perhaps they are right? Worse, you believe she knows the truth and has said nothing.
How could this have happened?

The [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] is not a realm where all power is rooted in the [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], and thus it does not seem right that [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] should hold so many crowns. Perhaps the [Root.Capital.Kingdom.GetFullName] needs a new ruler?
Demand [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] grant [Root.Capital.Kingdom.GetName] to me
[Root.Liege.GetSheHeCap] has enough problems, I'm certain

The [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] is not a realm where all power resides in the hands of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], and the consensus appears to be that I hold too many titles myself. Thus it is no surprise that [From.GetTitledFirstName] has demanded the crown of [From.Capital.Kingdom.GetName] be granted to [From.GetHerHim].
Give [From.GetHerHim] the crown
I will give it to one of my children instead
The crown will go to someone in line for the title
I will give it to someone with a claim
How dare [From.GetSheHe] even ask! The crown is mine!

Dear [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
Know that I consider you even asking me to surrender the crown of [Root.Capital.Kingdom.GetName] to be impertinent. My titles are mine to keep, and I will kindly ask you to remember your place.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Impertinent? How dare [From.GetSheHe]!

Dear [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
While your argument regarding the need for the crown of [Root.Capital.Kingdom.GetName] to not rest in my hands seems valid, know that I have decided to give it to another. I trust you will show them the same loyalty and consideration you have always shown me.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
The crown should have been mine

[Root.Liege.GetTitledName] has declared an Antipope, [Root.RelHead.GetTitledName], in opposition to the true Pope. As a good [Root.Religion.GetName], I should consider whether I support [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] in [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] actions, or whether I believe [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] has done nothing more than undermine the authority of the [Root.Religion.GetName] Church.
I support [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]
I support the true Pope
I don't care who the Pope is, to be perfectly frank
[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has decided to set you aside. As of this moment, by the laws of the [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] faith, you are no longer married.
That bitch! How dare she!
That bastard! How dare he!

News has reached you that [FromFromFrom.GetTitledName] has decided to set aside your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]. According to the laws of the [FromFromFrom.Religion.GetName] faith, the two are no longer married.

Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], has decided to establish a cadet branch of the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty. From now on, he and all his descendants will be known as the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty.

Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], has decided to establish a cadet branch of the [old_dynasty_head.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty. From now on, he and all his descendants will be known as the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty.

It is no longer enough for me to be a member of the [old_dynasty_head.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty. That legacy belongs to my elder brother, while I was expected for lesser things. Now that I am the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], it is time to establish a legacy in my own name. From now on, my descendants and I will be known as the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty!
My accomplishments will be my own

The [old_dynasty_head.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], the [old_dynasty_head.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty has become decadent, and Allah would not look favorably upon it. From now on, my descendants and I will be known as the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty, and we shall establish a new chapter in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]!

The time has come to break away from my relatives in the [old_dynasty_head.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty. As the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], I hereby declare that my descendants shall be part of the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty!

Finally, an opportunity has arisen to abduct [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] when [Root.PlotTarget.GetSheHe] takes a planned journey from [Root.PlotTarget.Location.GetName] to a nearby town. Shall I tell my co-conspirators to begin their preparations?

Finally, an opportunity to abduct [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] has arisen. One of the [Root.PlotTarget.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]'s personal guard has proven amenable to bribery, allowing for the opportunity to take [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHim] while [Root.PlotTarget.GetSheHe] sleeps. Shall I tell my co-conspirators to begin their preparations?

Finally, an opportunity has arisen to abduct [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] when [Root.PlotTarget.GetSheHe] goes on a planned hunting trip over a week from now. The perfect chance to catch [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHim] away from court! Shall I tell my co-conspirators to begin their preparations?

Finally, an opportunity to abduct [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] has arisen. The [Root.PlotTarget.GetManWoman]'s amourous nature has betrayed [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHim]--a planned trip to a brothel in [Root.PlotTarget.Location.GetName] will prove the perfect chance, if we move quickly. Shall I tell my co-conspirators to begin their preparations?
We must proceed with the plan!
Not yet, this is too risky
At last, after having watched our target here in [Root.Location.GetName] for so long, an opportunity for abduction has arisen. I must tell the others at once!
With luck, this will be over soon

My dear [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],
It seems the opportunity to abduct [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is finally upon us. I ask that you stand ready to make your move. If we fail this chance, it will not come again quickly.

My thanks,
[From.GetTitledName]

My co-conspirators send word that they have prepared everything we need to discredit [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName]. Documents of [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] corruption have been prepared, and courtiers have been bribed to whisper to [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] of [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis]'s incompetence. With [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] reputation in tatters, [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName] will find it impossible to hold on to [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] position on the council.
That position will be mine!

I have found myself the target of a vicious campaign of slander at court. Rumors of incompetence and corruption have undermined the authority of my position, and it seems that even [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] have come to believe them as I have been removed from my position at the council.
I am ruined!

The attempt to discredit [From.GetTitledFirstName] was a success! [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] has dismissed [From.GetHerHim] from the council and [From.GetHerHis] position is now vacant and ready for me to occupy.
Excellent!

Lately it seems that I have heard nothing but bad of [From.GetTitledFirstName], from whispers of incompetence at court to documents proving [From.GetHerHis] corruption slipped under my bedroom door at night. I refused to believe it at first, but in the end I could not deny the weight of the evidence and was forced to remove [From.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetHerHis] position at court.
It had to be done

I have found myself the target of a vicious campaign of slander at court. Whispers of incompetence and accusations of corruption have been directed at me, but fortunately [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] have refused to give them credence and ordered an investigation into the source of the rumors. Although the investigation turned up nothing, my position at court is secure.
Who could have instigated such an underhanded scheme?

Despite the rumors and accusations directed at [From.GetTitledFirstName], [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] refused to dismiss [From.GetHerHim] from the council and has ordered an investigation into the source of the rumors. Fortunately, the investigation turned up no evidence of my involvement.
It could have been worse...

Lately it seems that I have heard nothing but bad of [From.GetTitledFirstName], from whispers of incompetence at court to documents proving [From.GetHerHis] corruption slipped under my bedroom door at night. I refused to believe the accusations, and ordered an investigation into the source of the rumors. A thorough questioning of the court turned up nothing, but has at least put a stop to the slanderous accusations.

I have found myself the target of a vicious campaign of slander at court. Whispers of incompetence and accusations of corruption have been directed at me, but fortunately [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] have refused to give them credence and ordered an investigation into their source which revealed the involvement [From.GetTitledName]...
[From.GetTitledFirstName] will pay for this!

Despite the rumors and accusations directed at [From.GetTitledFirstName], [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] refused to dismiss [From.GetHerHim] from the council. Even worse, [Root.Liege.GetFirstName] ordered an investigation into the source of the rumors, which turned up evidence of my involvement...
[Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] is not pleased...

Lately it seems that I have heard nothing but bad of [From.GetTitledFirstName], from whispers of incompetence at court to documents proving [From.GetHerHis] corruption slipped under my bedroom door at night. I refused to believe the accusations and ordered an investigation of their source which revealed the involvement of [FromFrom.GetTitledName]
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] will pay for this!

The tithes and taxes for [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] are on their way to [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] castle and my co-conspirators have bribed the guards not to notice if a chest or two should go 'missing'. Everything is ready for the robbery to proceed.
We'll all be rich!

The taxes and tithes due to me arrived at the castle today and were placed in the treasury. As I was inspecting the chests full of gold, it struck me that there seemed to be fewer of them than what had arrived earlier. A quick check of the treasurer's accounts revealed my worst fears...
I have been robbed!

As the taxes were being hauled into the treasury, several large chests full of gold made their way onto the back of a wagon which left the castle unnoticed. The gold is now safely locked away in my treasury and my co-conspirators have all received their share.
Everything went as planned!
I have received my share of the money embezzled by [From.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.Liege.GetTitledFirstName].

The taxes and tithes due to me arrived at the castle today. As I was watching the money being carried into the treasury, I noticed some shadowy figures trying to make off with several chests full of gold. I had my guards seize them, and under questioning they revealed themselves to be in the employ of [From.GetTitledFirstName]. What shall be done with my thieving vassal?
Throw [From.GetTitledFirstName] in irons!
Off with [From.GetHerHis] head!
Forgive [From.GetHerHim]

As the taxes were being hauled into the treasury, my men tried to make off with several chests of gold but were spotted by [From.GetTitledFirstName], who had come out to inspect the process [From.GetHerHim]self. Under questioning they revealed to myself to be in my employ, and now [From.GetTitledFirstName] knows that I attempted to rob [From.GetHerHim].
Retribution is sure to come...

My co-conspirators have fabricated evidence that [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName] is planning a revolt against [Root.PlotTarget.Liege.GetHerHis] liege. The evidence will discreetly find its way into the hands of [Root.PlotTarget.Liege.GetTitledFirstName], who cannot fail to act on it.
I will see [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHim] disgraced!
Word has reached me that [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] has publicly accused me of treason based on evidence found in some documents that were slipped under [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] bedroom door.
This must be a scheme to see me arrested!
[From.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] was completely fooled by the fabricated evidence of [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s treason. It can only be a matter of time before [From.GetSheHe] is arrested.

As I rose from bed, I found a small bundle of documents that had been slipped beneath my bedroom door. The documents contained evidence of [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s plans to depose me and seize the throne.
I must have [From.GetHerHim] arrested!

As I rose from bed, I found a small bundle of documents that had been slipped beneath my bedroom door. The documents contained evidence of [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s plans to depose me and seize the throne.
I wonder who sent it...
[From.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] refused to believe the fabricated evidence of [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s treason. Although the scheme has failed, at least there is no evidence of my involvement.

As I rose from bed, I found a small bundle of documents that had been slipped beneath my bedroom door. The documents contained evidence of [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s plans to depose me and seize the throne.
Nothing but lies and slander

[From.GetTitledFirstName] tried to have me arrested for treason by slipping fabricated 'evidence' under [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s bedroom door, but fortunately [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] caught [From.GetHerHis] agent in the act and now it is [From.GetTitledFirstName] that stands accused of treason.
How dare [From.GetSheHe]!

My agent was caught in the act of slipping the fabricated evidence under [From.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s bedroom door. Even worse, my involvement was revealed during questioning and now I am the one that stands accused of treason.
This is bad!

As I was getting ready to sleep, I heard a scuffle from outside my bedroom door. Rushing outside, I found that my guards had seized a cloaked man as he was attempting to slip some documents into the room. Under questioning, he revealed that he was working for [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] and that the documents were fabricated evidence intended to turn me against my vassal [From.GetTitledFirstName].
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] is the true traitor!

My co-conspirators have fabricated evidence of [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName]'s blasphemous conduct and sheltering of heretics. The letter will be sent to [Root.PlotTarget.RelHead.GetTitledFirstName] who will be forced to excommunicate [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHim].
God will be my judge!
Word has reached me that [Root.RelHead.GetTitledFirstName] has had me excommunicated based on fabricated 'evidence' of blasphemy and heresy sent to [Root.RelHead.GetHerHim] in an anonymous letter.
God preserve me from these lies!

[From.RelHead.GetTitledFirstName] was completely fooled by the fabricated evidence of [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s heresy. [From.GetTitledFirstName] has been excommunicated and interdict has been placed on [From.GetHerHis] lands.
It was the will of God!

Word has reached me that [Root.RelHead.GetTitledFirstName] has received fabricated 'evidence' of blasphemy and heresy sent to [Root.RelHead.GetHerHim] in an anonymous letter. Fortunately, [Root.RelHead.GetSheHe] dismissed it as the slanderous lie it is.
God looks after the faithful
[From.RelHead.GetTitledFirstName] refused to believe the fabricated evidence of [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s heresy. Although the scheme has failed, at least there is no evidence of my involvement.

Word has reached me that [Root.RelHead.GetTitledFirstName] has received fabricated 'evidence' of blasphemy and heresy sent to [Root.RelHead.GetHerHim] in an anonymous letter. However, [Root.RelHead.GetSheHe] not only refused to believe it, but had the messenger questioned until he revealed the sender of the letter.
It was sent by [From.GetTitledFirstName]!

[From.RelHead.GetTitledFirstName] refused to believe the fabricated evidence of [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s heresy. What's worse, [From.RelHead.GetSheHe] had the messenger questioned and found out that I sent it! I have been censured for my 'unseemly scheming' and [From.GetTitledFirstName] knows that I tried to have [From.GetHerHim] excommunicated.
This will not help my reputation...

My co-conspirators have fabricated evidence that [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName] is planning a revolt against me. I will circulate the evidence among my vassals so that they will support my actions against the 'traitor'.

Word has reached me that documents indicting me in a plan to revolt against [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] have been circulating through the realm. Though the evidence is obviously a forgery, it seems almost everyone in the realm has been fooled by it, and I fear I am about to be arrested.
Who could have done such a thing?!
My vassals were completely fooled by the fabricated evidence of [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s treason. I am now free to act against [From.GetHerHim].

Word has reached me that documents indicting me in a plan to revolt against [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] have been circulating through the realm. Fortunately most of the lords of the realm have dismissed it as the forgery it is.
I wonder who was behind it...
My vassals refused to believe the fabricated evidence of [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s treason. Although the scheme has failed, at least there is no evidence of my involvement.

Word has reached me that documents indicting me in a plan to revolt against [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] have been circulating through the realm. One of the forger's agents was caught while handing out the forgeries on my lands, and questioning revealed him to be working for [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName].

My vassals refused to believe the fabricated evidence of [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s treason. What's worse, one of my agents was caught and questioned while circulating the forgeries, and my involvement has been revealed to all my vassals.
My reputation is ruined!

Success! [kidnap_victim.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has been delivered in a sack to an abandoned keep near [kidnap_victim.Location.GetName]. There [kidnap_victim.GetSheHe] is at my mercy, and no-one can hear [kidnap_victim.GetHerHis] screams. All that remains is to decide what to do with [kidnap_victim.GetHerHim].
[kidnap_victim.GetSheHeCap] will give me the [demanded_title.GetFullName], or else!
[kidnap_victim.GetSheHeCap] will name [demanded_vassal.GetTitledName] my vassal, or else!
Bring [kidnap_victim.GetHerHim] to my dungeon--I will decide later
Now [kidnap_victim.GetSheHe] dies--quietly

You are sleeping quite soundly in your bed when you are suddenly rudely awoken by a bag being thrust over your head! You struggle, but it is no use--your captors are strong, and it is not long before you find yourself in the dungeons of [From.GetTitledName]. There, [From.GetSheHe] informs you, you shall remain until [From.GetSheHe] decides otherwise.
[From.GetSheHeCap] will pay for this outrage!

[From.GetTitledName] recently went missing, and after a frantic search by [From.GetHerHis] guards, it seemed as if [From.GetSheHe] had simply vanished into thin air! Not so, apparently. It turns out [From.GetSheHe] was forcibly abducted by agents of [FromFrom.GetTitledName], who intends to keep [From.GetHerHim] in [FromFrom.GetHerHis] dungeons until [FromFrom.GetSheHe] decides otherwise.

You are sleeping quite soundly in your bed when you are suddenly rudely awoken by a bag being thrust over your head! You struggle, but it is no use--your captors are strong, and it is not long before you find yourself in a dungeon. There, [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] reveals [From.GetHerHim]self as your captor, and states you have only to hand over the [demanded_title.GetFullName] to achieve your freedom.
Take it! Just let me go!
[From.GetSheHeCap] will get nothing from me!

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] clearly didn't like it, but then again you left [From.GetHerHim] little choice. The [demanded_title.GetFullName] is yours. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has not told anyone exactly how you got the title, of course, but there are whispers. Even so, what does it matter now?

While [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] earlier seemed to have no intention of granting the [demanded_title.GetFullName] to anyone, suddenly [From.GetSheHe] changed [From.GetHerHis] mind and granted it to [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]. Could this have something to do with [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s recent unexplained absence from [From.Location.GetName]? No-one appears to know for certain.

'You will get nothing from me! Do your worst!' [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] spits in your face, refusing to give into your demands...though you can clearly see the fear in [From.GetHerHis] face. The [From.GetManWoman] is brave, evidently. So now what?
Now [From.GetSheHe] rots in my dungeon
Now [From.GetSheHe] dies--quietly
I'm not going to kill [From.GetHerHim]! Just...let [From.GetHerHim] go

'Then you will remain a guest in my dungeon until I decide just what to do with you,' [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] says with a shrug. With that, [From.GetSheHe] leaves, and you are left in the dark and the cold to wonder whether that was the wisest choice...

After recently vanishing without a trace from [FromFrom.GetHerHis] court, [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s lifeless corpse was discovered soon afterwards on the bank of a nearby river. People throughout [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are shocked by the scandal, which gets worse when it is revealed that [From.GetTitledName] was behind the deed!

While [From.GetSheHe] appears torn, it turns out that [From.GetSheHe] cannot, in fact, order your death. [From.GetSheHe] turns and walks out, swearing, and some time later you are discovered by a passing peasant and released. You are unharmed!
A relief, but still...

You are sleeping quite soundly in your bed when you are suddenly rudely awoken by a bag being thrust over your head! You struggle, but it is no use--your captors are strong, and it is not long before you find yourself in a dungeon. There, [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] reveals [From.GetHerHim]self as your captor, and states you have only to make [demanded_vassal.GetTitledName] [From.GetHerHis] vassal to achieve your freedom.
Take the vassal, just let me go!

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],
I cannot tell you the reasons behind my decision. Simply trust that they exist. With that in mind, I have elected to transfer your vassalage to [FromFrom.GetTitledName], effective immediately. May [From.Religion.GetHighGodName] have mercy upon us all.

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] clearly didn't like it, but then again you left [From.GetHerHim] little choice. [demanded_vassal.GetTitledName] is now your vassal. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has not told anyone exactly how this arrangement came to be, of course, but there are whispers. Even so, what does it matter now?

While [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] earlier seemed to have no intention of surrendering any of [From.GetHerHis] vassals to [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], suddenly [From.GetSheHe] changed [From.GetHerHis] mind and granted [FromFrom.GetHerHim] lordship over [demanded_vassal.GetTitledName]. Could this have something to do with [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s recent unexplained absence from [From.Location.GetName]? No-one appears to know for certain.

Alas, [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] surprised the kidnappers with the ferocity of [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] struggle, and they were forced to flee when [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] guards came running. While an investigation is underway, currently no-one is aware that you were behind the assault.

You are sleeping quite soundly in your bed when you are suddenly rudely awoken by a bag being thrust over your head! Outraged, you struggle--well enough that guards come running, and your kidnappers are forced to flee. Sadly, they escaped...meaning you have no idea who was behind this assault on your person.
Surely SOMEONE must know the truth?!

Disaster! [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] surprised the kidnappers with the ferocity of [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] struggle, and while they fled when guards came running, they were quickly caught. Even worse, the men gave up your name as their employer! You've denied it, naturally, but [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] clearly does not believe you.

You are sleeping quite soundly in your bed when you are suddenly rudely awoken by a bag being thrust over your head! Outraged, you struggle--well enough that guards come running, and your kidnappers are forced to flee. They are quickly caught, and upon questioning give up [From.GetTitledName] as their employer. [From.GetSheHeCap] tried to have you abducted!

Tonight may be the night. I spotted [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] going up to [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] rooms alone after an eve of drinking. I doubt [Root.PlotTarget.GetSheHe] is in a condition to resist my charms, if I choose to follow.
It's now or never!
I lack the courage...
I've observed the comings and going of the target of a particularly romantic plot, and think I can faciliate a private meeting for the two of them.
Send a message to the plotter.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has contacted me, saying [From.GetSheHe] believes that [From.GetSheHe] can help me meet [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName] privately, and in a condition where [Root.PlotTarget.GetSheHe] will almost certainly be unable to resist my charms...

The plan was successful. I crept into [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName]'s bed, and before [Root.PlotTarget.GetSheHe] could react, I showed [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHim] what a night with a real [Root.GetManWoman] looks like. [Root.PlotTarget.GetSheHeCap] did not ask me to leave.

It happened rather suddenly. One moment I was alone in my bed, and then the next [From.GetTitledFirstName] was there with me. I was about to cry for the guards, but the things [From.GetSheHe] he did... I did not want them to stop, and I have not wanted to since the night it happened. I cannot stop thinking about [From.GetHerHim].
How did that happen? Was I drinking?

My attempts at seduction have failed! [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName] not only threw me out of his room, but threatened to have the guards throw me out of the castle as well. [Root.PlotTarget.GetSheHeCap] is not pleased with me, and [Root.PlotTarget.GetSheHe] is not the only one.

It happened so quickly. One minute I was alone in my bed, and the next I woke to discover [From.GetTitledFirstName] attempting to seduce me. I threw [From.GetHerHim] out in a rage, and threatened to call the guards if [From.GetSheHe] tried anything so outrageous again. The nerve of the [From.GetManWoman]!
Denied!

Your shameful adherence to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith is an affront to myself and my supporters, and it must come to an end. I hereby demand that you convert to the [From.Religion.GetName], faithfully and in the sight of [From.Religion.GetHighGodName], or we will resort to force of arms to see you dethroned.

SIgned,
[From.GetTitledName]
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] forgive me, I have no choice
Never!

Rather than risking civil war tearing the realm apart, I have decided to give in to your demand and convert to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. But this treacherous act of blackmail will not be forgotten...

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

Rather than letting civil war tear the realm apart, [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has agreed to convert to the [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] faith. Your valuable support in this conflict will not be forgotten, not by myself and not by [FromFrom.Religion.GetHighGodName].

Sincerely,
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
Under pressure from [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and [FromFrom.GetHerHis] supporters, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has agreed to convert to the [FromFrom.Religion.GetName] faith.

Your shameful attempt at blackmail has not succeeded. No matter how many corrupted souls you have enticed to help carry out your plan, I will not give in without a fight. I'd rather die in the name of the true [From.Religion.GetName] faith and defending what is rightfully mine!

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],
I have gathered enough supporters to finally take a stand against [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]. Either [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] convert to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith, or we will rise up against [Root.Liege.GetHerHim] and install a properly [Root.Religion.GetName] [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] in [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] stead. I ask that you either join us now, or stand aside should the matter come to a civil war.

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

Unsettling news—while you currently have no proof of it, you are all but certain that [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is conspiring with unknown parties to wrest the regency from your grasp. Unless you act soon, [From.GetSheHe] may very well soon succeed.

Unsettling news—while you currently have no proof of it, you are all but certain that [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is conspiring with unknown parties to wrest the regency from [Root.Liege.Regent.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]. just as you are. If you do not act to stop [From.GetHerHim] now, [From.GetSheHe] may very well beat you to it.
I will stop [From.GetHerHim], if I can
I must wait for proof, and not make things worse

Your scheming to replace [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] as [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s regent apparently came to [From.GetHerHis] notice, as suddenly you find yourself without access to [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] at all. Worse, any efforts to bring the matter before the court have evaporated. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has outmaneuvered you.

Your scheming to replace [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] as [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s regent apparently came to the notice of [From.GetTitledName], as [From.GetSheHe] has somehow not only blocked your access to [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] but also to the court. You have been outmaneuvered!

You acted quickly to block [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s access to [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], and to ensure [FromFrom.GetSheHe] would have no chance to bring the matter before the court...and you were successful. [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] has been outmaneuvered!

While you tried to block [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s access to [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], [FromFrom.GetSheHe] somehow managed to get around your efforts even so. If [FromFrom.GetSheHe] is truly scheming against you, [FromFrom.GetHerHis] efforts continue as before, unhindered.

At first it seems like [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has become aware of your scheme to take the regency, but [From.GetHerHis] bungling has only infuriated some of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s courtiers and made it more likely that your efforts will come to fruition far sooner.

While you tried to block [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s access to [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], [FromFrom.GetSheHe] somehow managed to get around your efforts even so. Worse, you managed to infuriate some of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s courtiers and made [FromFrom.GetHerHis] scheming far easier.

You're uncertain what's going on in the court, exactly, but you know something is. [FromFrom.GetTitledName] is no longer allowed to see you, and you don't know why...only that [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] says it's for the best. Maybe it is?

Something is amiss in your court, but you don't understand exactly what.
