[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] came to visit you recently and said that your regent, [From.GetTitledName], is bungling things badly. With any luck, that will soon change and then [FromFrom.GetSheHe] will be around far more. Wouldn't that be grand?

As both [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s regent and heir, it has not been a difficult matter to get agreement on the idea that perhaps it is time I take over rule of [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] in truth. It is not as if [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] is going to get better, after all...

With [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] unable to rule, it has fallen to you to ensure things in [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] continue to run smoothly. As such close family to [Root.Liege.GetHerHim], there are many who are willing to see [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] regent become the ruler in truth...

As [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s regent, it has not been overly difficult to arrange a conspiracy to see you take over rule of [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] in truth. The time for the attempt to be made appears to now be at hand...
Let us make the attempt
No, I should abandon this now

While you have slowly assumed more and more of the duties of rulership in [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName], it seems you were unable to convince [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s councillors and lords to take that final step. They have not restricted your powers, but it's clear they'll resist any attempts for you to take control...for now.

It seems your efforts to take the rule of [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] into your own hands were noticed too soon. Several of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s vassals took serious exception to the idea and raised a great furor, and now your attempt is being called both treachery and usurpation!

You're not quite sure what all the fuss is, but a bunch of soldiers came in and arrested [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]. They said [From.GetSheHe] was trying to take away your throne! What an odd thing to do. It's so large! Where would [From.GetSheHe] put it?
I suppose they'll find me another regent, now?

Dangerous business is afoot in [Root.Liege.Capital.GetName]: [From.GetTitledName] attempted to usurp [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s titles, and as [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] regent [From.GetSheHe] very well almost got away with it! [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has been arrested, and another regent shall be found for [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] shortly.

Success! Your duties as regent have been expanded to the point where the difference between you and [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is a mere formality...a formality which has now been dispensed with entirely.

Perhaps it was time. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] came to tell you that [From.GetSheHe] would be taking over rule of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] formally, and thus would no longer be my regent. [From.GetSheHeCap] was my heir, so...that's good, right?

Dear [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] came to tell you that [From.GetSheHe] would be taking over rule of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] formally, and thus would no longer be my regent. [From.GetSheHeCap] said it was for my own good, and for the good of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]...and you're hardly in a position to disagree.

Everyone's making such a fuss. You can barely understand it, but it seems [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] rules in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] now, and not you. But that doesn't seem right, does it? [From.GetSheHeCap]'s your regent, not the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]! Yet everyone keeps saying it, so it must be true.
I hope being [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] makes [From.GetHerHim] happy

With [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] no longer able to rule, [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has stepped up from being simply [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] regent and heir to ruling [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] in truth. Many consider the move for the best.

With [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] no longer able to rule, [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has slowly transformed from being simply [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] regent to ruling [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] in truth. Despite [From.GetHerHis] close relation to [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], some are calling this an usurpation.

Dangerous business is afoot in [Root.Liege.Capital.GetName]: [From.GetTitledName] has slowly expanded [From.GetHerHis] duties as [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s regent until the distinction between them was a mere formality...and now that formality has been dispensed with entirely. [From.GetSheHeCap] has usurped the rule of [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName]!

After many months of effort, you have found several [Root.Culture.GetName] lords in [Root.Capital.County.GetName] who quietly seethe at the rule of [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]...and with some subtle pushes, they could become much less quiet. Of course, this will also give [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s spymaster the best chance to catch you in the act.
Let us proceed with this
It's too risky

Success! The [Root.Culture.GetName] lords have no idea you were the person behind their 'donations'...nor the incidents which have made their rage against [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] all the greater. Now it simply remains to see if this leads to anything.

Alas, the [Root.Culture.GetName] lords are either too cowardly to speak openly against [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] or their words fall on too many deaf ears. Nothing has come of your efforts in [Root.Capital.County.GetName], but thankfully no-one is aware of your involvement. We will have to wait for another chance.

Disaster! One of the [Root.Culture.GetName] lords recognized your agent, and evidently believed that you were trying to trick him. He has been complaining loudly in [Root.Capital.GetName], loudly enough that agents of [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] overheard and have pieced together what really happened.

My [Root.GetLordLady], we have word from an agent in [From.Capital.County.GetName] that [From.GetTitledName] was attempting to incite rebellion amongst the [From.Culture.GetName] peasants--a rebellion that almost certainly would have been directed against your rule. [From.GetHerHisCap] efforts thankfully failed, and we have proof of [From.GetHerHis] deeds.
Has [From.GetSheHe] gone mad?

My [Root.GetLordLady],
It has recently come to my attention that [From.GetBestName] plots against you, and thus I felt it best if you were to be aware of that fact. I trust you will take whatever steps required to protect yourself.

With respect,
[FromFrom.GetBestName]
[FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] is [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s liege -- [FromFrom.GetSheHe] should do something!
This is good to know!

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I truly appreciate your assistance in alerting me to [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s scheme, though as [FromFrom.GetHerHis] liege, I truly hope you will also take steps to deal with [FromFrom.GetHerHis] criminal behavior.

With gratitude,
[From.GetTitledName]

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I truly appreciate your assistance in alerting me to [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s scheme. It seems I will have to deal with [FromFrom.GetHerHim], and quickly.

With gratitude,
[From.GetTitledName]

Unfortunately, it appears that [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledName] has become aware of your plot against [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHim]. You strongly suspect that [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s spymaster learned of the plot and [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] then revealed it to [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal].
Some guards have been convinced to be 'pre-occupied' for a while. This could be the perfect opportunity to elope.
We will elope!
Thanks to the guards being distracted tonight you were easily able to slip out to your lover.
Finally we are together
After much anxious waiting you finally see your lover approach the meeting spot.
Finally we shall be married
It would seem [From.GetFirstName] has vanished from your court. There are whispers that [From.GetSheHe] has eloped.
How dare [From.GetSheHe]!
Despite your best attempts your liege was sticking unusually close to you tonight and you could not avoid [Root.Liege.GetHerHim].
It's almost like they knew...
After waiting for hours at the meeting spot you begin to realize that something is amiss. A discreet messenger arrives from your lover telling you that she could not safely leave to meet you.
We'll just have to try again
You decided to stay out and about more than usual tonight. A strange air lingers around [From.GetFirstName] and the guards were acting a bit off.
Perhaps I am being paranoid...

The sharp decline of my power and territories have not gone unnoticed by other rulers. While I continue to insist on my claims to Imperial dignity, it is clear that my peers no longer take them seriously.
But I *am* the [Root.GetTitle]!
The change in crown authority has forced me to change some of my demesne laws.
My changes to the crown authority of the Empire have now been fully implemented across the realm.
This was not a just act!
Oh well
I have reclaimed the Byzantine Empire for the Orthodox faith. The title of Augustus is rightfully mine.
Glorious day!
Following a faith completely different from Catholicism, I cannot legitimately claim to be Latin Emperor.
Following a faith completely different from Orthodoxy, I cannot legitimately claim to be Byzantine Emperor.

The province of [converted_province.GetName] has finally seen the light, with the majority of its inhabitants at last accepting your culture. This should make your realm easier to manage and better unify your people.
Those who have gone into hiding have been sent a message to return.
Following a faith completely different from Catholicism, I cannot legitimately claim to be Holy Roman Emperor.
As I move to re-assume power in [FromFrom.GetBaseName], I am approached by a cabal of local lords insisting I step down in favour of my heir, lest they rebel again and force the issue...
One of the startup flags has gone missing!
The Crusade was a great success, but to whom shall I grant the lands I have gained?
To my son
To a capable relative
To myself
To my brother
To a valiant retainer
The Crusade was a great success and now I must decide whether to request a fief in the captured lands for one of my relatives.
Request a fief for my son
Request a fief for my brother
Request a fief for a relative
No, our victory belongs to God
I have distributed fiefs in my new lands among the relatives of the Crusading lords.

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] owed tribute to [current_suzerain.GetTitledName], but that arrangement doesn't necessarily apply to you, [From.GetHerHis] heir. Of course, [current_suzerain.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] might not agree with that idea...
I will pay tribute to [current_suzerain.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]
[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is no-one's tribute

Shortly following the death of [FromFrom.GetTitledName], an emissary has arrived in [Root.Capital.GetName] from [FromFrom.GetHerHis] heir, offering to renew the tribute from [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] towards the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. Turn the emissary away, and [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] will be free of our control...and our protection.
Naturally we will accept their tribute
[From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is more trouble than it's worth

Your emissary has returned from [From.Capital.GetName], explaining that [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] cheerfully accepted [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]'s continued tribute towards the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].

Your emissary has returned from [From.Capital.GetName] with dire news: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has refused the offer of tribute, declaring that [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is 'more trouble than it's worth'. You are freed from [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]'s control, but also its protection.
Does [From.GetSheHe] mean to attack us?

Shortly following the death of [FromFrom.GetTitledName], an emissary has arrived in [Root.Capital.GetName] from [FromFrom.GetHerHis] heir, declaring that [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] shall no longer be subject to the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] nor shall it offer any further tribute.
Let [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] go
Is that so? We'll see about that!

The recent death of [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] leaves us with a decision to make: does [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] offer tribute to [From.GetHerHis] heir, [new_suzerain.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], or does it declare itself free of both [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]'s control and protection?
We will offer tribute to [new_suzerain.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]
We will be tributes to [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] no longer!

An emissary has arrived in [Root.Capital.GetName] from [From.GetTitledName], offering to extend the arrangement of tribute between [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] to yourself.
Of course we shall accept
No, [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is more trouble than it's worth

An emissary has arrived in [Root.Capital.GetName] from [From.GetTitledName], declaring that, with the death of [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] shall no longer be subject to the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] nor shall it offer any further tribute.
Little [From.GetFirstName] is the spitting image of [From.GetHerHis] father, [From.Father.GetTitledFirstName]. We are unmarried, of course, but I can hardly deny the child is mine.
I love [From.GetHerHim], anyway

Recent events have brought to rise the question: is the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] truly part of the [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]? If not, this is your chance to declare independence from the [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] -- but beware, as [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] will have a claim to come after [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] later, if [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] can.
Declare independence!
No, I remain faithful to [Root.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName]

It seems that [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] does not consider [From.GetHerHim]self a part of your realm, and has declared the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]'s independence from [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] rule.
Oh no!

You spend an evening with [debater.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] as [debater.GetSheHe] goes on at length about the importance of [debater.Religion.GetName] virtues. It turns into a lively debate, and one [debater.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] seems insistent on winning!
Win a debate? Against me? Hah!
I'll skillfully steer us onto another topic
[debater.GetSheHeCap] can't win--I cheat
I'll let [debater.GetHerHim] win--this time
We started early, the sun had barely risen above the horizon. There was plenty of prey, the dogs caught many rabbits and I slayed one great boar before he killed my horse and myself.
I'm a hunter
That lifestyle is not for me
The new bird is almost too perfect. I enjoy every hunt with her, and the cook has trouble finding new recipes for rabbit.
I'm a falconer
I'm never happier than when I'm in my study, poring over some newly imported volume. Books are truly God's greatest gift to man.
I'm a scholar

I found the strange book collecting dust in a forgotten corner of the castle library. It took me several weeks of intense study before its mystery revealed itself to me. The gibberish parts was encoded and after many hours trying to decipher I managed to break it and construct a key to make it easier for me to read. Its mystery is still not solved...
I'm a mystic
My regular excursions into the dungeon have only served to whet my appetite. I have sent for a skilled torturer who will teach me more about the arts of pain.
I'm an impaler
My garden is the apple of my eye, my pride and joy. I distrust my gardener and would spend every hour of the day in my garden if I could.
I'm a gardener
My modest attempts to write poetry were never meant to be published in any way, but wherever I go, bards and minstrels are reciting or singing my poems.
I'm a poet
There is nothing that brings me more joy than the day-to-day task of ruling [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. Some may think it lacks glory, but I do it well enough that I've become known for my prowess.
I'm an administrator!
This lifestyle of utmost pleasure and joyous life suits me perfectly. This can be nothing but heaven.
I'm a hedonist
The duel was close fought, but in the end I was victorious over my opponent. As I basked in the admiration of my peers, I knew that I had to do this again.
I'm a duelist

I have finally become an expert in Islamic jurisprudence! My knowledge of the Qur'an, the Sunnah, Ijma' (Consensus) and Qiyas (Analogy) is what makes me a faqih and I will use that knowledge to be a better [Root.GetTitle] and ruler of my people.
I am proud to have become a faqih!

Whenever the engineers are working in [Root.Capital.GetName], I always make an effort to visit them and talk. They have such interesting ideas! Building things has always been a pleasure for me, whether they be physical or far more abstract.
I'm an architect!

What goes on behind a battle is far more interesting to me than the actual fighting. Strategies, manoeuvres, even the issues of attrition and supply...these are the things that matter most when it comes to victory, and it applies to far more things than simply the battlefield.
I'm a strategist!

Spending time with other people--that's what gives me energy. Talking with them, knowing the things they want or don't want. I've always had a knack for it, and wherever I go you're bound to find me in the centre of the largest and loudest group.
I'm a socializer!

I watch everything, and I listen. Other people don't see what I see--the cause and effect of every action, the moves and counter-moves that are required to make something happen. When I take action, it's very likely nobody will even know I did it. That is how plans succeed.
I'm a schemer!

Playing a game well means understanding its inner workings. You must know the rules, you must know your opponent's strengths and weaknesses. It is life and politics played out on the chessboard. I play because I win, and I like winning...and, yes, sometimes just for fun. What could be better?
I'm a gamer!

On a stormy but otherwise peaceful night in [Root.Capital.GetName], a traveling [Root.Religion.GetName] merchant takes refuge in your holding. He seems like an interesting man, and you've nothing else to distract you. How do you spend the evening?
Entertaining him, of course
Discussing fighting techniques with his guards
Debating him on matters of history
Relaxing by myself
There is a social event happening this evening in [Root.Capital.GetName], one of the most important [Root.Capital.Religion.GetName] holidays. Everyone of importance will be partaking in the revelry.
Of course I will attend!
I will watch everyone closely
This is a good opportunity to meet the merchants
They can do without me for one evening

On a quiet day in [Location.GetName], you can't help but notice some of your knights sparring. One of them is doing a poor job of it, and the other men are making sport of his failures rather than helping him.
Time to show them all a few tricks
I'll intervene, and perhaps raise morale
They need a lecture on good [Root.Religion.GetName] virtues
I will relax and leave them to it

You overhear some courtiers in [Root.Location.GetName] arguing about the war. The disagreement is clearly about how a ruler could best contribute to victory. When they see you, they immediately go quiet and leave...but afterwards, you decide you have your own answer to their issue.
By leading the armies into battle
By knowing what happens before the enemy
By keeping the armies fed and paid
By staying alive

Peace reigns in the [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], and for once you are left with nothing to do and no councillors vying for your personal attention. An unusual circumstance, to be sure, but one you can easily solve.
There are always matters of ruling to attend to
I shall call for a hunt in the nearby woods
Time for reading? That almost never happens
I will spend it with my loved ones

You are riding with attendants through [Root.Capital.GetName] when you hear a disturbance ahead. One of your men suggests that you steer around it, as it appears to be some kind of violent dispute in the market between merchants. Hopefully it does not get out of hand!
I will intervene and resolve their dispute
I will speak with the men and calm the situation
I will watch to see what's happening, and why
I have larger issues upon which to focus
Every time I think of my rival, [target_rival.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], I wonder what I would do if [target_rival.GetSheHe] were here before me now, alone.
Find out what [target_rival.GetSheHe] has planned
Kill [target_rival.GetHerHim], if I could
Try to resolve our differences
There's no use indulging such fantasies
I can't stop thinking about my plot to [Root.GetPlot]. So many plans to make, but none of them seem to come to fruition fast enough!
Then I will make more plans
I will distract myself in the study
Time to busy myself at court
I will find a way! I must!
A traveling merchant comes to [Root.Capital.GetName], and it appears he has quite an assortment of rare books to offer. He is naturally quite eager to show them to you, and gauge your interest.
I will take them all, if I can
Does he have anything on warfare?
A treatise on governance would be interesting
I would rather save my coin
The old Anglo-Saxon kingdom of England will now be forfeit…but do not despair! From its ashes a much more powerful and glorious realm will arise!
England shall rule victorious!
The old Anglo-Saxon kingdom of England will now be forfeit…but do not despair! From its ashes a much more powerful and glorious realm will arise!
The Duchy of Normandy
With the domination of this duchy the people are now more commonly referring to Neustria as Normandy.

The Islands and Peninsula south of Rome have fallen to those who oppose Christianity. Whispers have been heard that the pope the is frantically considering funding an expedition to reconquer the peninsula.
The Fall of Sicily
What will the pope do?
And so they crumble

Unsurprisingly, the pope has chosen a promising local young Italian mercenary band to take control of Southern Italy away from the Heathens. With official Papal support, this young Mercenary captain hopes to achieve the crown of Sicily, as promised by the pope.
Interesting...
The Champions Head Out

The re-conquest of Sicily was an astounding success. The pope has motioned to officially crown the King of Sicily today. Already the pope makes plans for future such events, some have even said they’ve heard rumours of such a thing being called a Crusade. Time can only tell what will happen next.
King of Sicily

In a very surprising and bold move, the Pope has decided to give the Norsemen of the North a chance to prove themselves worthy of the crown of Sicily. Of course they submitted to papal authority prior to being allowed to invade Southern Italy. This should prove to be a very interesting series of events, no matter the outcome.

After having heard the success of the Normans, the pope has decided to give them an offer they can’t refuse. They’ll be allowed to invade southern Italy with full papal support. Should they succeed, they’ll be crowned by the pope himself as Kings of Sicily.

Having heard the news of southern Italy’s struggle, some Croatian mercenaries have volunteered to help the pope. Impressed by their determination and self-sacrifice, he has decided to give official papal support to these mercenaries to take back Italy. Should they succeed, the crown of Sicily awaits them.

Having heard the news of southern Italy’s struggle, some Serbian mercenaries have volunteered to help the pope. Impressed by their determination and self-sacrifice, he has decided to give official papal support to these mercenaries to take back Italy. Should they succeed, the crown of Sicily awaits them.

Often forgotten, there are still resident Greeks in southern Italy. After having affirmed their support of the Pope of Rome they now seek to re-conquer their lost lands from the heathen invaders. Motivation is certainly not lacking for these people.
An auspicious day it is indeed, for you will be crowned the King of Sicily by none other than the pope himself. As you approach the pope, you can't help but feel a sense of pride rise within you.
The Coronation
Finally!
The pope's plans have failed. His trusted champions have been dispersed, and there's little hope for a Christian reconquering of Sicily.
The Sicilian Invasion Fails
Disaster!
Too bad for the Christians.
A New Culture
A New Culture
A New Culture
The people of Dyrrachion have taken to calling themselves Albanians
I don't care, as long as they pay their taxes
I admire their culture
The Kingdom of Albania
The Kingdom of Albania, once de-jure part of Greece, has formed it's own kingdom under [Root.GetTitledFirstName].
Good
The Kingdom of Albania
The Kingdom of Albania, once de-jure part of Greece, has formed it's own kingdom under [From.GetTitledFirstName].
Interesting

Your Grace, the vile Polish have taken the Moravian territories from us and in their naivity they think they could claim the Duchy of Bohemia as well! Of course we could defeat them single-handedly, the problem is that they are a little bit more powerful at the moment and so we should probably resort to some more cunning tactics...
A temporary setback
They will never take our freedom!! Hopefully

The Bulgarian state has finally perished by your hands and their 'empire' has collapsed into ruins. The conflict that has lasted decades is over and we can rejoice that our northern borders are safe once more and our control of the Balkans is undisputed. For this achievement you are going to be known for at least another millennium.
Call me the Bulgar-Slayer!

My lord, nothing less than a miracle has occured. We have repelled the full scale Byzantine invasion and our Empire is safe once more. But discontent is growing in the Roman lands and the position of the Basileus is balancing on the edge. Maybe we could benefit from that?
Take them down!
Macedonia will be more than enough
We should be grateful for what we have
A Christian monk by the name of Sigfrid has arrived from the Catholic churches of Västergotland. He would like to preach at Your court and show You the benefits of Christianity.
What can I do?

Sigfrid has continued preaching his religion in our capital, and he seems to be gathering a larger and larger audience. After listening to one of his sermons, you have to admit that the new faith may have some advantages...
It is for the good of the realm
We shall bow to none!
Swedish King Converts
The Pagan King of Sweden has decided to be baptized by Siegfried of Glastonbury and converted to Christianity. It looks like that the era of the Old Gods is over.
What's that noise? Oh, that is Valhalla crumbling!
Fall of the Córdoban Caliphate

A messenger has arrived from Iberia - the last remnants of the Caliphate of Córdoba has been destroyed. It was the last bastion of the Umayyad Empire, the greatest Muslim realm the world has ever seen.
So it goes
Fall of the Caliphate of Cairo
A messenger has arrived from Egypt - the last remnants of the Caliphate of Cairo, an Empire created by the Fatimids has fallen to obscurity.
The forces you ordered to assemble are now ready to invade the Kingdom of England. We shall teach the Anglo-Saxons a lesson they will not forget!
To the longships!
I've changed my mind

My King! The dreadful Norse ruler of Denmark, vile Sweyn Forkbeard has finished consolidating his gains in Norway and now he has stated that he is going to invade England as many Vikings have done before…

After years of careful planning, Olaf Haraldsson, the last male descendant of Harald Fairhair has raised a large army of exiles, mercenaries and hopefuls, declaring intention to retake the Crown of Norway by force.
A papal bull has arrived demanding the return of Holy Rome to the Papacy.
Accept
Refuse

Attacking [From.GetTitledName] may be a mistake -- as the head of the [From.Religion.GetName] faith, [From.GetSheHe] has the right to excommunicate us...a right [From.GetSheHe] has now chosen to exercise.
That won't stop me!

[rightful_relhead.GetTitledName] has sent a formal request that we aid [rightful_relhead.GetHerHim] in [rightful_relhead.GetHerHis] war against [relhead_enemy.GetTitledName]. As a righteous [Root.Religion.GetName], it is my duty to protect the [rightful_relhead.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]...or is it? What could [rightful_relhead.GetSheHe] truly do if I refuse?
We will defend the [rightful_relhead.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]
We will send volunteers and donations
I see no reason to get involved
We will donate to the [rightful_relhead.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]'s cause
The Bræðralag Founded
We have founded the Bræðralag, a fellowship of sworn brethren fighting for a place in Valhalla!
The Bræðralag
The Bræðralag are proud heathen warriors who swear oaths of brotherhood to each other, and swear to fight until they please Oðinn and the heathen gods.
Their place in Valhalla is assured!
More barbaric miscreants to be slaughtered...
The Jomsvikings Founded
We have founded the Jomsvikings, a brotherhood of berserker warriors who wear wolf-skins and unleash their fury on the enemies of the Norse!
The Jomsvikings

A band of fierce Vikings have established a warrior brotherhood. These Jomsvikings are devoted to Thor, Odin and the other Norse gods. They brook no quarter on the battlefield and will permit only the strongest and ablest warriors amongst their number.\n\nThough there are those who would dismiss them as simple brigands, the Jomsvikings have vowed to defend all Norse lands being encroached by Christendom or other foreign religions.
Now that control of the kingdom has left Basque hands, a new name should be decided for this kingdom. Yourself and your council have decided on the name Navarra
The Kingdom of Nevarra
Now that the war is over, and [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has handed out titles to deserving generals, the Magyar soldiers have largely disbanded and have begun to settle into their new homes.
This is our home, now
The Harii
We have refounded the Harii, a fierce order of Germanic warriors who held back the Romans in ancient days. They will be used against enemies of the faith again.
The Harii Founded
The Harii have been refounded. These Germanic warriors once held back the Roman Empire and are loyal to their pagan faith. They will fight their enemies to the bitter end.
They honor their ancestors!

[From.GetTitledName] has issued a call that [Root.GetTitledName] has become decadent and corrupt, and that neither he nor his descendants deserve to hold the [From.Religion.GetName] Caliphate. Whether [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will make a move against the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] is currently unknown.
How dare he!
This is how it must be
[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is absolutely right
No, I support [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]
This is none of my concern

The High King of Ireland is traditionally held by an Irish king who can prove dominance over the others. [From.GetTitledName] has declared that [From.GetSheHe] is more deserving of the title than [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], and intends to press [From.GetHerHis] claim to it.
I dare [From.GetHerHim] to try!
The Rise of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

[Root.GetBestName] has proven himself a capable warrior, to the point that he has inspired his [Root.Culture.GetName] followers to assemble their clans and follow him as their nomadic leader. Nearby rulers are already fearing what this could mean to the balance of power in their region.
Let all tremble before us!
I have assembled the lords and ladies of the [changed_title.GetFullName] to vote on my proposed Succession Law change.

I have decided to institute the Gavelkind Succession Law in the [changed_title.GetFullName]. All that is needed is the support of yourself and my other loyal vassals.

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]
Approve
Ignore

I have decided to institute the Primogeniture Succession Law in the [changed_title.GetFullName]. All that is needed is the support of yourself and my other loyal vassals.

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

I have decided to institute the Seniority Succession Law in the [changed_title.GetFullName]. All that is needed is the support of yourself and my other loyal vassals.

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has made a change to the [emf_succ_title.GetFullName]'s succession laws... a change which has ensured that not only are you no longer the heir, you are no longer even considered a contender for succession.
So be it!
How dare [From.GetSheHe]! This is an outrage!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has made a change to the [emf_succ_title.GetFullName]'s succession laws... a change which has ensured that you are no longer [From.GetHerHis] primary heir, even though you are still considered a candidate for succession.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has made a change to the [emf_succ_title.GetFullName]'s succession laws... a change which has ensured you are no longer considered a candidate for succession.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has made a change to the [emf_succ_title.GetFullName]'s succession laws... a change which has elevated me to the status of [From.GetHerHis] primary heir. Be careful of the jealous eyes now cast your way.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has made a change to the [emf_succ_title.GetFullName]'s succession laws... a change which, while it has not made me [From.GetHerHis] heir, has put me in the immediate line for succession.
The results of the vote on my proposed Succession Law change in the [FromFrom.GetFullName] are in.
The proposal was approved
The proposal was rejected
The Succession Law change proposed by [From.GetTitledName] was approved.
The Succession Law change proposed by [From.GetTitledName] was rejected.
With my assumption of my distant [GetFromFromRelation]'s throne in the [From.GetFullBaseName], there are already those calling me the first of a new House.
With my violent seizure of my [GetFromFromRelation]'s throne in the [From.GetFullBaseName], there are already those calling me the first of a new House.
Yes, establish a new dynasty in [From.GetBaseName]
No, emphasize our ties to House [FromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName]
[From.GetTitledName] has taken the throne in the [From.GetFullBaseName] and established the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty as a cadet branch of the [FromFromFrom.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty.

I have decided to institute the Tanistry Succession Law in the [changed_title.GetFullName]. All that is needed is the support of yourself and my other loyal vassals.

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

I have decided to institute the Feudal Elective Succession Law in the [changed_title.GetFullName]. All that is needed is the support of yourself and my other loyal vassals.

Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

Like the Pharaohs of ancient times, [From.GetTitledFirstName] and [From.GetPossPronoun] [GetFromNewRelation] [New.GetTitledFirstName] have gotten married under the blessed auspices of the gods, ensuring fullness and Order. We can collect a Royal Aid Duty to pay for the ceremonies.
The Jewish moneylenders are here, reminding me of that loan I took...
We shall all be Sicilian
No, I wish to remain [Root.Culture.GetName]
We shall all be Anglo-Norse
We shall all be Outremer
We shall all be Latin
We shall all be Gallawa
We shall all be Russian
We shall all be Norman

For as long as we have ruled here in [Root.Capital.GetName], we have entrusted the raising of our children to local nursemaids. Our first words would not be [Root.Culture.GetName] but [melting_pot_province.Culture.GetName]. As we grew up, we learned to speak a tongue that was neither one nor the other but a syncretic mix of the two. Perhaps it is time to embrace this new tongue so we all may communicate.
It seems that this new [new_culture.Culture.GetName] language has now spread into [Root.GetName], a new culture born from a mix of the old.

Although many dislike change, this new [Root.Culture.GetName] language does have a certain functionality that cannot be denied. I have therefore prevailed upon a member of my court to adopt this for everyday administrative use.
The Jewish Community that I am sheltering has prospered and grown under my benevolent rule.

My liege, I bring news from the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. The Jewish merchants that you wisely allowed to settle in the city have grown fat and prosperous under your benevolent rule, and you can expect increased revenue from the taxes and tariffs imposed on their community.
A skilled advisor from the Jewish Community I am sheltering has made his services available to me.

A group of Jewish refugees from distant lands have come to my court. They are seeking a new a place to live after being expelled from their former homes and ask for my permission to establish a community in one of my cities.
They are welcome!
Tell them to move on

[From.GetTitledName] has decreed that all Jews in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are to be expelled from the realm and their assets seized by the crown. This includes my own Jewish subjects, who I have no choice but to banish unless I want to openly defy my liege.
Bow to [From.GetHerHis] demands
Never!
I have been excommunicated for the sin of dishonorable murder.
Being known as a dishonorable murderer is causing me severe mentral stress. Can I really live with what I've done?
The guilt weighs heavily upon me
I'm handling it just fine
I have no regrets
I was listening in on my courtiers' conversation when I heard one of them call me a murderer. They are clearly working with my enemies!
They must die! They must all die!

Your fallen enemy lies before you, he was a valiant foe and his head will make a great trophy to prove your valor to the gods. Grasping your blade firmly, you sever his head from the rest of his body.
For [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
The gods must favor you, for again you are blessed with victory! As you sever your foe's head from the rest of his body, you hear a bard singing the song of Cu Chullain.
He will have a new hero to sing about now!
I have served my liege loyally. Perhaps I should try to make friends with [Root.Liege.GetHerHim].
Let's try.
Maybe later...

My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], approached me after a council meeting today and asking me to join [From.GetHerHim] for supper. We both had a grand time, and I think perhaps I should continue to spend time with [From.GetFirstName].
Let's be friends, [From.GetFirstName].
[This.GetTitle]s have no friends. Only subjects and enemies!
I dined with my liege and now the two of us have agreed to go meet again within the fortnight. I think this is the beginning to a beautiful friendship!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] and I had a great time at supper, but [From.GetSheHe] refused my kind offer to meet again. Perhaps another time...
I feel the need to talk to someone. Perhaps one of my courtiers will entertain me.
Let's see what they have to say.
I'm not interested in these people.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] came by to talk with me today. We discussed many interesting subjects and [From.GetSheHe] seemed quite pleased. [From.GetSheHe] suggested that perhaps we should meet for a bottle of wine sometime.
That sounds great!
Perhaps another time...
[From.GetTitledFirstName] was interesting to talk to, and [From.GetSheHe] responded positively to the suggestion that we should drink together. I think I've made a friend.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] didn't seem too interested in being friends. Oh well...
My liege seems bored these days. Perhaps I should invite [Root.Liege.GetHerHim] to practice fencing with me.
I was sitting alone when [From.GetTitledFirstName] asked me if I wanted to spar with [From.GetHerHim]. I had a lot of fun... perhaps I should consider training with [From.GetHerHim] more often?
[From.GetTitledFirstName] and I became friends, and I have taught [From.GetHerHim] how to fight better.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] didn't want to become a duelist.
I feel the need to talk to someone. Perhaps one of my liege's courtiers will entertain me.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] came by to talk with me today.  We discussed many interesting subjects and [From.GetFirstName] seemed to be quite pleased.  [From.GetSheHe] suggested perhaps we should meet for a bottle of wine sometime.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] was interesting to talk to, and [From.GetSheHe] responded positively to the suggestion that we should drink together. I think I've made a friend.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] didn't seem to interested in being friends. Oh well...
[Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s current regent is not suitable. I should be regent!

You have grown tired of being called '[Root.GetFirstNameWithNick]', and have insisted nobody call you that in your presence. Your councillors tell you it might be possible to get the commoners to stop using the nickname, but there's no guarantee they won't simply take up calling you by it again later. One's reputation cannot be controlled.
Just make them stop
Punish anyone who utters it—that will do the trick
Do whatever you have to, I don't care
Perhaps I should let it go...
It took some time, but it seems the discouragement has paid off. Nobody calls you '[Root.GetFirstNameWithNick]' anymore... though how long that'll last is hard to say.
There was a certain amount of 'persuasion' required, but eventually the commoners started calling you by your proper name again. Should they forget later, perhaps another reminder will be necessary?
For a time, it seemed like your efforts were successful... until you hear one of your courtiers slips up and calls you '[Root.GetFirstNameWithNick]' by accident. This will clearly take more time.
Then we will take the time
Inadequate soil preparation in §Y[Root.GetName]§!.
Poor seed selection hurts farming in §Y[Root.GetName]§!.
Lack of manure hurts farming in §Y[Root.GetName]§!.
Lower mean temperature hurts farming in §Y[Root.GetName]§!.
Arable land deserted in §Y[Root.GetName]§!.
Draining of marshes and fens in §Y[Root.GetName]§!.
Resettlement on newly claimed land in §Y[Root.GetName]§!.
Increased land productivity in §Y[Root.GetName]§!.
Pillaging

Sieges could drag on for months and even years, and the besieging troops had to forage the countryside for supplies. These foraging parties could sometimes devolve into looting and outright vandalism. This was the case in [besieged_settlement_province.GetName], where our troops have have pillaged and torched one of the province's buildings.
It can't be helped
The besieging troops have destroyed a building in [besieged_settlement.GetName]!

Word travels swiftly through [Root.GetName] as your soldiers approach, and the [Root.Religion.GetName] faithful gather in large groups. They are terrified, but ready to resist should you give your men the order...
They will be given to [Root.Owner.Religion.GetHighGodName]
Perhaps not...
Automatic Distribution of Titles

1) Right-click on the county's coat of arms and use the 'Raise Banner in X' option to flag holdings in that province as ones you want to keep. You can use the 'Lower Banner in X' option  to unflag provinces.

2) Use either the 'Distribute All Barony Tier Holdings' or 'Distribute All Holdings' decision to hand out all non-flagged titles to random rulers.

3) Use the 'End Distribution of Titles' decision to clear the other decisions from your list and to remove all existing flags.
I understand

'My [Root.GetLordLady], the titles to the counties and baronies have been distributed, as per your orders. I trust the candidates are to your satisfaction.' -- Signed, [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName]
I'm certain they are
'My [Root.GetLordLady], the titles to the baronies have been distributed, as per your orders. I trust the candidates are to your satisfaction.' -- Signed, [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName]
I'm certain they are
I will pay for my freedom, if I can afford it.
I will not pay.
[Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] offered to release me from prison if I pay a ransom.
We have received a ransom demand from [FromFrom.GetTitledName] for the safe return of [From.GetTitledName].
I will pay to get them back.
I will not pay to get them back.
The ransom has been denied!
Well, let them rot...
You have chosen to become part of the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty. What relation will [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] be to you?
[From.GetSheHeCap] will be my [From.GetFatherMother]
He will be my brother
She will be my sister
He will be my nephew
She will be my niece
He will be my uncle
She will be my aunt
We will be only distantly related
I've changed my mind...
[From.Siege.GetName] Besieged
[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA], an enemy host is approaching [From.Siege.GetName] with the intent to besiege it. If you wish to flee to safety, you must do so quickly!
You can hear the sounds of battle from your prison cell. Could it be? Is [From.Siege.GetName] being besieged?

In your addled state, you can barely understand what is going on. [From.Siege.GetName] is being attacked? By whom?! People are urgently ushering you through the halls, and there is shouting everywhere. Where are they taking you?

The grown-ups at [From.Siege.GetName] seem awfully nervous. An army is coming, they say, and they intend to send you somewhere safe. It makes no sense to you. Isn't [From.Siege.GetName] the safest place in the entire world?

Word has reached you in [Root.Location.GetName] that the enemy has attacked [From.Siege.GetName]. How long it can withstand the siege is uncertain, but with any luck it will be long enough to protect your loved ones.
I hope they get everyone to safety!
Sadly, there is nothing I can do from here...
Run? Run now? Where are we going?
They never tell me anything!
I must get to safety at once
*My* safety is all that matters
I am not leaving without my family
Send my family to safety - I must defend [From.Siege.GetName]
I am not going anywhere!
Escape Attempt

My [Root.GetLordLady], if [Root.Siege.GetName] falls into the hands of the enemy, you could be placed into jeopardy. If you are going to attempt an escape, it must be now. We will not get another chance.
Slip out a postern door at midnight
Brave the sewers
Just give me a rope...
I think it's better we wait
Just as I thought I had made it to freedom, a group of armed men appear under the banner of my foe.  Exhausted from my escape, it is all I can do to croak the word 'yield.'

In the dead of night, as a low mist hung about the curtain wall, you creep out a postern door and float across the moat on an inflated sheepskin.  It's only by the ineptitude of the enemy watch that you stagger, dripping wet, through the siege lines and to the safety of a nearby wood.  Thanks be to God! ... Although any family left behind is likely angry with us...

Your steward leads you down into the store rooms to a passage you didn't even know existed.  Beyond it, a dismal tunnel full of death and decay, and you are only too glad to reach the moat and relatively fresh water. I hope I never have to do that again!  It only now occurs to me that any family left behind is likely angry with me for leaving them in the hands of the enemy.

They said only a lunatic would attempt climbing down the southeast wall, and certainly the enemy agreed!  A near thing, too, when my foot slipped on that patch of moss.  My brush with death over with, and safety assured, it only now occurs to me that any family left behind will see this as a desertion, not a bold deed of heroism...
My [Root.GetLordLady], we've caught [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] while [From.GetSheHe] was trying to sneak out of the castle!
Take [From.GetHerHim] back to my dungeons immediately!
My [Root.GetLordLady], we've finally taken [FromFrom.GetName]... and it appears [FromFrom.Holder.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] numbers among those within. What should we do?
Take [siege_owner.GetHerHim] prisoner at once
Imprison [siege_owner.GetHerHim] and anyone else we find
Kill [siege_owner.GetHerHim] and anyone else within
Leave [siege_owner.GetHerHim] and [siege_owner.GetHerHis] family be

My [Root.GetLordLady], we've finally taken [FromFrom.GetName]... but it appears [FromFrom.Holder.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has gone into hiding. We can search for [FromFrom.Holder.GetHerHim], but [FromFrom.Holder.GetSheHe] will not be easy to find. What would you have us do?
Find [FromFrom.Holder.GetHerHim]—[FromFrom.Holder.GetSheHe]'s the only one we want
Find [FromFrom.Holder.GetHerHim] and anyone else of importance
Kill everyone you can find

My [Root.GetLordLady], we've finally taken [FromFrom.GetName], and it appears that [FromFrom.Holder.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] may have family within... though some may have gone into hiding. If they have, they may not be very easy to find. What would you have us do?
Imprison anyone of importance you can find
Leave them be, they are unimportant
My [Root.GetLordLady], our forces report that [FromFrom.Holder.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has prisoners being held at [FromFrom.GetName].
Release all prisoners
Transfer them to MY dungeon
Release anyone with whom we have common cause.
Release only my relatives
Whoever these people are, they smell like they belong there...

As the forces of [siege_attacker.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] finally burst through the gates of [FromFromFrom.GetName], you assumed they would take you prisoner if they found you... but that was not to be. You heard the screams before they reached you, and, upon realizing they were slaughtering everyone, you tried to flee. Eventually they caught up to you and summarily put you to the sword.
I will be avenged!
As the forces of [siege_attacker.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] finally burst through the gates of [siege_holding.GetName], you attempted to evade them... but ultimately were unsuccessful.
After the siege, we found §Y[From.GetTitledName]§! and immediately took [From.GetHerHim] prisoner.

We have finally taken [FromFrom.GetName], and the men are already busy looting and setting fires. A glorious day! I know the men are ready to slake their bloody thirsts upon the holding. What instructions shall I give them?
Tell them to control themselves—I want prisoners
No, let them celebrate their victory
Tonight we offer sacrifices to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!
As the attackers finally burst through the gates of [siege_holding.GetName], you attempted to evade them... and, while you were ultimately successful in escaping, you did not do so unscathed.
At least I got away!

As the forces of [siege_attacker.GetTitledFirstName] finally burst through the gates of [siege_holding.GetName], you assumed they would take you prisoner if they found you... but that was not to be. Once you saw the daggers, and heard their horrid chanting, you realized with horror that they were going to sacrifice you to their pagan gods...

Your council gathers as you inform them of your decision to disinherit [From.GetTitledFirstName]. While the reasoning is obvious to everyone, their somber faces betray the fact this is not something to be lightly considered. [From.GetFirstName] could take up arms against you, after all, and many of your vassals would consider [From.GetHerHis] position completely justified.
I have considered the matter carefully—let it be done
I doubt [From.GetSheHe] will even understand what has happened...
[From.GetSheHeCap] is in prison—what could [From.GetSheHe] do?
Perhaps not, then

News has spread throughout the realm that [From.GetTitledFirstName] has declared [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] unfit to inherit the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], even though the law of the land states that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] should. Everyone knows the reason, but many are saying it doesn't seem right that the law should be ignored... even by the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle].
Actually, [From.GetSheHe] IS the law
I feel for [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], but that is how it is
This is an outrage! [From.GetTitledFirstName] has no right!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has declared you unfit to inherit [From.GetHerHis] titles, even though the laws of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] say that I am. It is only [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s great prestige that allows this, although it is certain many of [From.GetHerHis] vassals would be sympathetic to your cause.
Disappointing, but truly I am relieved
Look for support in dealing with this outrage
I will become [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], no matter what [From.GetSheHe] says!

My [Root.GetLordLady], I am certain you have heard the recent news regarding my disinheritance. I consider this an illegal act, and since I understand you to be sympathetic regarding my cause I will join your court while I consider my options. -- Yours in thanks, [From.GetTitledName]
We are pleased to welcome [From.GetHerHim]
If [From.GetSheHe] must come here, then so be it

While you can barely understand in your current state, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has declared you unfit to inherit [From.GetHerHis] titles. People around you are talking about this, and some are angry, but it's simply too dizzying to think about.
Maybe it's for the best

Languishing in prison as you are, it's several days before you hear the news that [From.GetTitledFirstName] has declared you unfit to inherit [From.GetHerHis] titles, even though the laws of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] say it should be so. As unsurprised as you are, you know there are those who would support you... if you could ever get out of here.
There will be a reckoning once I am free

The situation with [From.GetTitledFirstName] has changed, and perhaps the time has come for a reconciliation. It will not be easy, of course... your council hums and haws over the idea of you going back on your decree, as lingering bad feelings will persist regardless, but it is possible.
He is my son--that is all that matters
She is my daughter--that is all that matters
Perhaps they are right

Some good news! The bad blood between [From.GetTitledFirstName] and [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] has been settled, with [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] being granted full inheritance rights once again... even if some are grumbling at [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s arbitrary decrees.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] should be pleased, at least
It appears the impossible has happened: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to reconcile, and has decreed that you once again enjoy full inheritance rights in the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].
With the recent death of [From.GetTitledFirstName], [From.GetHerHis] decree regarding your inheritance rights no longer applies.
[From.GetSheHeCap] will not be missed
A New Emperor

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has assumed the throne of the Carolingian Empire... and now it falls to you to decide whether you will accept [From.GetHerHis] rule, or whether you will break the oaths of fealty and declare independence.
The [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] will find its own path
[From.GetSheHeCap] is my emperor, and all of ours

My [Root.GetLordLady] [Root.GetFirstName],\nIt is my position that the Carolingian Empire is a legacy deserving of the likes of Charlemagne, and requires a ruler of sufficient substance and character to earn its support. I believe that ruler is not you, and thus the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] hereby declares its independence from the empire. We will find our own way from this day on.\n[From.GetTitledName]
An outrage!
The Holy Roman Empire

To the most devout and serene [Root.GetTitledFirstName],\nIn the name of the Lord, I, [From.GetTitledName], agree to offer my blessing and will anoint you as Holy Roman Emperor. May your rule be both just and eternal.

'In the name of Christ, I, [From.GetTitledFirstName], promise, pledge and guarantee in the sight of God and the blessed Apostle Peter that I will be the protector and defender of this holy Roman Church in all ways useful to her, however many, in so far as I am supported by divine assistance according to my knowledge and ability.'\n\nToday [From.GetTitledFirstName] was crowned by his Holiness the Pope and formally received the title of Holy Roman Emperor and the Imperial Regalia with the blessing of the Pope.
Offer to become [From.GetHerHis] devout vassal
Wish [From.GetHerHim] well

To [Root.GetHerHisCap] Imperial Majesty, [Root.GetTitledName],
I offer my congratulations on your coronation, and, as a loyal subject to [FromFromFrom.GetTitledName], I hereby offer you my devout oath of fealty. Let the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] become part of the Holy Roman Empire.

Signed in faith,
[From.GetTitledName]
Accept [From.GetHerHis] oath of fealty
No, I don't want [From.GetHerHim] as a vassal
The Carolingian Empire

The throne of the Carolingian Empire is not an easy thing to hold. Its vassals are notoriously independent, and as each generation of rulers gets further from Charlemagne, their memory of what the throne stands for growns more distant. For now, at least, your rule appears to be safe.
End of the Carolingian Empire

Though you recently assumed the Carolingian throne, it appears it is not yours to hold. The Pope has refused to anoint you with his blessing, and indeed there are far too many who consider the throne to exist only in name. To them, you claim of the imperial title is meaningless. The once-great empire of Charlemagne has fallen to chaos.
No! This cannot be!

While [From.GetTitledFirstName] has assumed the throne of the Carolingian Empire, it appears that far too many consider [From.GetHerHis] title to exist purely in name. The Pope has refused to anoint [From.GetHerHim] with his blessing, and thus the once-great empire of Charlemagne has fallen to chaos.
This is terrible news!
So be it

Part of the agreement made between [From.GetTitledFirstName] and [current_pope.GetTitledFirstName] for [From.GetHerHis] coronation was the turning over of certain lands in central Italy to the Pope's control -- lands which include part of your domain.
What? I never agreed to this!
Since you are not a subject of the Holy Roman Empire, some of your titles have become de facto kingdoms.
Under the laws of the Holy Roman Empire, some of your titles have been demoted to a slightly lesser rank.
I expressed my wishes and desires for a coronation in Rome to his holiness the Pope. Hopefully he will accept my request so that I can begin inviting my lords to attend the coronation ceremony.
Of course he will accept

To the most Reverend and Blessed Apostolic Pope,

I would like to ask you for your blessing in my rule as Emperor-elect by holding officially holding a coronation ceremony in my honour.

Your most devoted subject,
[From.GetTitledName]
[From.GetFirstName] is deserving of a crown
[From.GetFirstName] is no true Emperor

To the most devout and serene [Root.GetTitledFirstName],\nIn the name of the Lord, I, [From.GetTitledName], would like to offer you my blessing to allow your coronation in Rome, as [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Emperor, under my guidance.
Excellent, send out the a message to invite all my lords

To [Root.GetHerHisCap] Majesty [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
In the name of the Lord, I, [From.GetTitledName], would like to inform you that I deem you are not yet worthy and just enough as a ruler to be offered my blessings to become crowned as the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Emperor. The Lord surely has much faith in you as you have in him, but remember that the honour of receiving His blessing does not come easy and is only for the purest of souls.
Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Why can't he ever just say:No!

To Noble [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
You should be happy to know that, I, [From.GetTitledName], will hold a coronation ceremony in Rome in my honour with the blessing of his Holiness the Pope. You received the honour to be invited to attend the ceremony, which will be held soon in Rome. I await your postive reply.

Your most Holy Lord and Liege,
[From.GetTitledName]
I will attend the ceremony
I refuse to set foot in that pompous windbag's castle
[From.GetTitledName] is sorry to inform you that [From.GetSheHe] will not be able to attend the coronation ceremony in Rome as [From.GetSheHe] has more important issues to attend to.
I have no words for such dishonor
Today I was crowned by his Holiness the Pope and formally received the title of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Emperor and the Imperial Regalia with the blessing of the Pope.
[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Emperor
This will strengthen my rule significantly

Today [From.GetTitledFirstName] was crowned by his Holiness the Pope and formally received the title of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Emperor and the Imperial Regalia with the blessing of the Pope. The ceremony was magnificent.
Long may [From.GetTitledFirstName] live!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has been crowned and received the Imperial Regalia by his holiness the Pope in the St. Peter's Basilica in Rome. The divine blessings conveyed by his Holiness the Pope confirm the right of rule over all Imperial lands governed by [From.GetTitledFirstName] and his appointed vassals.
Ok

'In the name of Christ, I, [Root.GetTitledFirstName], promise, pledge and guarantee in the sight of God and the blessed Apostle Peter that I will be the protector and defender of this holy Roman Church in all ways useful to her, however many, in so far as I am supported by divine assistance according to my knowledge and ability.'\n\nToday [Root.GetTitledFirstName] was crowned by his Holiness the Pope and formally received the title of Holy Roman Emperor and the Imperial Regalia with the blessing of the Pope.
Pope Crowns Emperor
The [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] United
The Kingdom of Aquitaine has been united fully under the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] as a single kingdom, with a single crown, and a single ruler in [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

With Lotharingia and Burgundy having fallen under my domain, my relatives are crying foul. They are demanding to meet with me at Meerssen, to create a new treaty to replace the Treaty of Verdun which first split up the Frankish Empire. If I do not, there will be no peace.
Agree to the new treaty
No, the inheritance is rightfully mine!
The Treaty of Meerssen

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has met with his vassals at Meerssen and come up with a new treaty following his inheritance of Lotharingia and Burgundy. This will more equitably split the lands of Lothaire among his heirs, and allow for peace—at least for a time.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has inherited both Lotharingia and Burgundy, lands that were intended to be spread amongst the heirs of Lothaire. [From.GetSheHeCap] has refused to even discuss the issue of inheritance, all but daring his vassals to press the issue.
It is not worth fighting over
This cannot be allowed to stand!

I already rule the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], but receiving an official [Root.Religion.GetName] coronation will legitimize my standing to my vassals. Now is the time to begin planning what is sure to be a lavish ceremony, attended by all!
I look forward to it!

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I am pleased to invite you to my forthcoming coronation at [From.Capital.GetName]. There I will be officially crowned as [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] in the sight of [From.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap], and your presence would be most welcome.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledName]
I will gladly attend
I have other things to do
Send an envoy in my stead
Alas, the war detains me
Alas, I am far too busy at present

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I am very pleased to accept your invitation, and will be journeying to [Root.Capital.GetName] shortly to personally attend your coronation.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA],
While I appreciate your invitation, I am afraid I must decline. I trust my presence at the coronation will not be overly missed.

Yours,
[From.GetTitledName]

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I fear I will not be able to personally attend your coronation. An envoy will be sent to [Root.Capital.GetName] in my stead, to stand as a representative of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].

With respect,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA],
While I would like nothing better than to attend your coronation, I fear the war in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] demands my full attention and thus I will be unable to get away. I wish you well on this auspicious occasion.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA],
I am pleased to have received your invitation. Alas, matters in [From.Capital.GetName] already have my commitment, and thus I will be unable to make the journey to [Root.Capital.GetName] in time to attend the coronation. Please accept my apologies and congratulations.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[coronation_liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is planning a proper coronation in the eyes of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap], and will require a [Root.Religion.GetName] priest to perform the ceremony.
I shall be that priest

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA],
As you will be holding a proper [Root.Religion.GetName] coronation, I would be pleased to offer my services in performing the ceremony.

May [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] watch over you,
[From.GetTitledName]
[From.GetSheHeCap] may perform the ceremony
I will hold out for someone better

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA],
I would be more than pleased to have you perform the coronation ceremony. Please accept my eternal gratitude.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA],
While I appreciate your offer, I believe it would be prudent if someone more qualified performed the coronation ceremony.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
This is an insult!
Sadly, the outbreak of war in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] means that the coronation festivities will have to be cancelled.

My [Root.GetLordLady],
Sadly, the outbreak of war in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] means that the coronation festivities will have to be cancelled. My apologies for the inconvenience.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
That's too bad
With your untimely death, the coronation festivities will clearly need to be cancelled.
And I was SO close!
And I was JUST coronated!

My [Root.GetLordLady],
Sadly, the untimely death of [From.GetTitledName] obviously means that [From.GetHerHis] coronation must hereby be canceled. We regret the inconvenience.

Signed,
The Chancellor of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]
The [From.PrimaryTitle.GetAdjective] Coronation

'I, [From.GetFirstName] of the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty, and with the blessing of [From.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap], do hereby rightfully assume the crown of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].'\n\nWith those words does [From.GetSheHe] become [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] in truth, with each of [From.GetHerHis] vassals lining up to bow before [From.GetHerHim] and swear everlasting fealty. It is an impressive ceremony, full of pomp and circumstance, and one that will write [From.GetTitledFirstName] into history. The streets of [From.Capital.GetName] are lined with [From.Capital.Culture.GetName] crowds cheering, with everyone straining to get a look at the important personages that pass by on their way to the forthcoming feast.
I have never been more proud
Long live [From.GetTitledFirstName]!
I bet the ceremony was nice

With the coronation ceremony finished, the newly-anointed [From.GetTitledFirstName] retired to [From.GetHerHis] castle for the celebration feast. The hall is packed with people: the lords and ladies of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], their wives and husbands, visiting [From.Religion.GetName] rulers and emissaries...it will be a night to remember!
Let the festivities commence!
This will be quite the celebration!

The coronation feast goes well into the night, and you find yourself frequently spending time with your host, drinking wine and laughing over stories. You leave feeling as if the two of you have gained an excellent understanding of one another.
I've found a new friend!

As the coronation feast continues, you find yourself frequently in the company of [From.GetTitledFirstName], drinking wine and laughing over stories. While you would not have thought so initially, it seems as if the two of you have gained an excellent understanding of one another.

It was bound to happen. You drank a little too much at the coronation feast, and when you ran into your host you argued over a title they hold which you believe rightfully belongs to you. Heated words were exchanged, to the point where guards had to politely separate the two of you.
This is not my fault!

It was bound to happen. [From.GetTitledFirstName] drank too much at the coronation feast, and at one point in the night confronted you. [From.GetHerHisCap] words slurred from drink, [From.GetSheHe] argued with you over a title that you hold which [From.GetSheHe] believes rightfully belongs to [From.GetHerHim]. It caused quite the scene, reaching the point where guards had to politely separate the two of you.
How dare [From.GetSheHe]!

You suspected that [challenge_target.GetSheHe] might be at the coronation feast, and sure enough...there [challenge_target.GetTitledFirstName] is, laughing and carrying on. You despise the man, and with a few drinks in you, it occurs to you to challenge him to a duel right here and now.

You challenged [From.GetTitledFirstName], but [From.GetSheHe] spluttered excuses regarding how this was a feast and you are both guests and so forth...and declined the challenge, much to his embarrassment.
The coward!

A series of shouts arose during the coronation feast, and the guests parted to reveal the culprits: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] with blade drawn, challenging [From.GetTitledFirstName] to a duel. Both men are ready to fight, and are asking for your leave to settle matters here and now.
Absolutely not! This is a feast, not a tavern!
Talk them out of the foolish idea
Why not? Some entertainment!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] was furious at both of us for daring to ask to duel, all but ordering us out of the feast. We left, more bitter at [From.GetTitledFirstName] than at each other.
[From.GetSheHeCap] had no right to speak to me in that fashion!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] listened to our request to fight, and instead of agreeing took us each aside in turn and spoke to us calmly. [From.GetSheHeCap] said that it would be unfortunate if either of us were hurt, as it would be a breach of hospitality, and begged us to reconsider...and [From.GetSheHe] was right. It was a foolish idea.
Another time, then

Those at the coronation feast gathered as a duel ensued between [FromFromFrom.GetTitledName] and [FromFrom.GetTitledName], overseen by [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetHerHim]self. The fight was a spectacle...and, in the end, [FromFromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] was stabbed by [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] and died!
Most unfortunate
The bastard killed me!
Ha! [From.GetSheHe] had it coming!
How scandalous!

Those at the coronation feast gathered as a duel ensued between [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and [From.GetTitledName], overseen by [coronation_duel_host.GetTitledFirstName] [coronation_duel_host.GetHerHim]self. The fight was a spectacle...and, in the end, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] lost the duel and was badly wounded. [From.GetTitledFirstName] is victorious!
There, it is done
[From.GetSheHe] must have cheated!
Victory is mine!

Those at the coronation feast gathered as a duel ensued between [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and [From.GetTitledName], overseen by [coronation_duel_host.GetTitledFirstName] [coronation_duel_host.GetHerHim]self. The fight was a spectacle...and, in the end, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] conceded defeat after first blood. [From.GetTitledFirstName] is victorious!

Those at the coronation feast gathered as a duel ensued between [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and [From.GetTitledName], overseen by [coronation_duel_host.GetTitledFirstName] [coronation_duel_host.GetHerHim]self. The fight was a spectacle...and, in the end, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] was stabbed by [From.GetTitledFirstName] and died!

The coronation feast was going so well...and then you saw [Spouse.GetFirstName]'s lover, there across the room, laughing and as brazen as [Root.GetSheHe] pleased. How could [Spouse.GetSheHe] invite [Root.GetHerHim]?
[Spouse.GetSheHeCap] does this to spite me!

The coronation feast was going so well...and then you saw [From.GetTitledFirstName] staring daggers at you. [From.GetSheHeCap] accosted you in front of your guests, making a scene over the fact your lover was present at the coronation! Eventually [From.GetSheHe] stormed off, but it was an embarrassing moment.
That could have gone...better
The coronation's festivities are going well...so well, in fact, that the muse has overtaken you. Perhaps an ode to your host, publicly declared for all to hear?
Yes! Wonderful!
No, I couldn't bear the shame

At one point in the coronation's festivities, [From.GetTitledName] stands and gets everyone's attention. [From.GetSheHe] delivers a poem in [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s honor...and it is beautiful. Those gathered are moved, and the applause afterwards signifies that this ode will be written down and remembered.
Well done, [From.GetTitledFirstName]!
I couldn't be more pleased
How fabulous!

At one point in the coronation's festivities, [From.GetTitledName] stands and gets everyone's attention. [From.GetSheHe] delivers a poem in [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s honor...and it is terrible. Did [From.GetSheHe] intend to insult [From.GetHerHis] host, or was it an accident? The awkward coughs afterwards signify this moment is best forgotten.
Awkward, indeed...
No, this is terrible!
How awful!

'To our good host, [Root.GetTitledFirstName], long may [Root.GetSheHe] reign!'\n\n[From.GetTitledName] stands and delivers an eloquent toast in [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s honor at the coronation feast, prompting a round of approving applause from those gathered.
Many thanks, [From.GetTitledFirstName]!
Long may [Root.GetSheHe] reign!

On the night of the coronation feast, it seems everyone wants to dance with you. [From.GetTitledFirstName] in particular, however, seems more interested than most. The way [From.GetSheHe] smiles at you, you suspect [From.GetSheHe] might be interested in more than just a dance with the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]...
Oh, really? Let's see where this goes...
A dance is more than sufficient

On the night of the coronation feast, it seems every [Root.GetManWomanOpp] wishes to dance with you. How tiresome. [From.GetTitledFirstName] winks in your direction, seeming to understand your discomfort. Indeed, you suspect [From.GetSheHe] might understand better than most...
Let's talk in private, [From.GetFirstName]...
I'm not interested in [From.GetHerHim]

All throughout the coronation feast, [From.GetTitledName] has done nothing more than make caustic remarks about you when [From.GetSheHe] thinks you're not listening. You're not even certain why [From.GetSheHe] came to the coronation at all, if this is how [From.GetSheHe] feels.
Endure it—it's only one evening, after all
Confront [From.GetHerHim]—this needs to stop!

As if [From.GetHerHis] drinking weren't bad enough, [From.GetTitledName] managed to make quite the spectacle of [From.GetHerHim]self at the coronation feast, dancing on tables and carrying on until finally [From.GetSheHe] vomited on the floor in front of everyone.

With [Root.GetTitledFirstName] currently sitting upon its throne in [Root.Capital.GetName], the Byzantine Empire is beginning to crack at the seams. With [Root.GetTitledFirstName] currently sitting upon its throne in [Root.Capital.GetName], the Byzantine Empire is in a state of chaos. The Eastern Roman Empire has resisted the slow decay and corruption of its power throughout the Dark Ages, but now it seems entropy has finally taken its toll. [Root.GetTitledFirstName] watches from [Root.GetHerHis] throne in [Root.Capital.GetName] as all of Anatolia slips from the empire's grasp, a sure sign of just how far it has fallen from grace. With the eastern provinces in Armenia having been conquered by the Seljuks, the authority of the Byzantine Empire over all of Asia Minor has rapidly begun to crumble. [Root.GetTitledFirstName] watches helplessly from [Root.GetHerHis] throne in [Root.Capital.GetName] as a muslim warlord establishes the so-called 'Sultanate of Rûm' in lands that were, until recently, rightfully [Root.GetHersHis]. Through constant prayer and dedication to virtue, all the stress you feel has started to...simply melt away. Perhaps this is the peace a simpler life entails.
