Dire events are underway in [Root.Capital.GetName], capital to the mighty [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]: [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], considered by many to be a weak caliph, has been turned into a veritable prisoner within his own palace. His advisors have taken control of the court, and already cracks have begun to appear in its authority over the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]'s vassals. Whether [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will be able to regain control or whether the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] will crumble into anarchy is currently unknown.
Oh no!
This travesty is an affront to Allah
It couldn't happen to a nicer caliph
While [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has taken command of the Sunni caliphate, the court remains firmly in control. You will have to be strong if you are to overcome their rule and restore order.
They will not get away with this
Order Restored in [Root.Capital.GetName]

It has taken a bloody coup, with [imprisoned_regent.GetTitledName] being overthrown and imprisoned, but [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has restored order in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. The Sunni caliphate once again has authority respected by its vassals. It remains to be seen whether [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will exact more vengeance upon those of his court who kept him hostage, and whether he will be able to bring the lands he lost back under his fold.
Ha! Finally!
This is a good thing, I think

The court of [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] runs rampant with anarchy and corruption. Perhaps it is time for the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] to declare its independence before the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] crumbles completely and takes you with it?
Yes, let us make our own way
No, I am loyal to the caliph!

Alas, the anarchy rampant within the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has claimed another victim: from your quarters in the palace, you hear that [From.GetTitledName] has declared [From.GetHerHis] independence from the caliphate in pure disgust. Naturally your court is at odds regarding what to do about it.

After the unjust murder of his son by local authorities, a follower of the Kharijite sect of Islam by the name of Musawir ibn 'Abd al-Hamid al-Shari has launched an insurrection in the province of Mosul, aiming to toppling the rule of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. This presents a serious threat to the caliph, and further evidence of the reign of anarchy in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].
Muslim heretics in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]? Good news!
Another sad blow to the caliphate

The [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] is difficult to manage, due to its sheer size and splendor. It is an easy thing for the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]'s court to become decadent amidst such wealth, and for power to be misused even if that is not something the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] desires.
I will see this corruption rooted out!
This is hardly unexpected...

[From.Religion.GetName] leaders in [From.GetName] are becoming increasingly displeased at the decadence of the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty under [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]. They are stirring discontent against you, and only quick and brutal action could possibly stop their words from taking hold.
Ignore it, for now
Round up the agitators and execute them

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],
I write you now because I can endure your sins no further. You are a [GetFromFromRootInsult] [Root.GetManWoman], and an apostate in the eyes of Allah. I hereby declare you Kafir!

[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
Oh no!

My liege,
Though it pains me to say it, I can no longer watch your descent into sin. You are a [GetFromFromRootInsult] [Root.GetManWoman], and an apostate in the eyes of Allah. I hereby declare you Kafir!

[FromFrom.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName] is brought up from the dungeon and escorted to the plaza in [From.Capital.GetName], in front of the cheering crowds and [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] looking on. There, as the sword is raised above [Root.GetHerHis] neck, [Root.GetSheHe] looks at [Root.GetHerHis] [GetFromRelation] with pleading eyes. 'Don't do this, [From.GetFirstName]! There has to be some other way...' Alas, there was not.
You are family, but this is how it must be

[Root.GetTitledName], [GetHusbandWife] of [From.GetTitledName], is dragged into the central square of [From.Capital.GetName], where a huge bonfire roars. In a last, desperate effort to save [Root.GetHerselfHimself], [Root.GetSheHe] calls out to [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]. 'I have always loved you, [Root.GetFirstName], and I always shall!' But it is not enough.
Forgive me then, my love, but this is how it must be

[Root.GetTitledName] is brought up from the dungeons and placed at the block in front of a cheering crowd in [Root.Capital.GetName]'s central square. As they raise the sword above [Root.GetHerHis] neck, [Root.GetSheHe] cries out to the watching [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]: 'Don't do this, [From.GetFirstName]! We are family, and of the same blood!' But the sword descends even so.
It is not enough to save you

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] spits at the ragged creature curled into a ball before [From.GetHerHim]. 'King of Kings,' [From.GetSheHe] mocks, with a sharp kick to the kidneys, 'Bringer of Benefit. There is only one Bringer of Benefit, and that is Allah, whose truth and love you have rejected for idolatry.' [From.GetSheHeCap] raises a great scimitar, shining steel reflecting the screaming crowd, and beheads [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal].
I hope Allah has a special jinn waiting for your soul

[Root.GetTitledName] is dragged, stumbling and bloody, before a screaming crowd in [From.Capital.GetName]. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] regards [Root.GetHerHim] and laughs. 'This broken old [Root.GetManWoman], covered in [Root.GetHerHis] own filth, dressed in ragged, once-fine robes, is the [Root.GetManWoman] who commanded a hundred legions of infidels to invade Dar al-Islam? You are so pathetic, it is not even worth the torture. Just cut off [Root.GetHerHis] head.' The attendants rush to do just that.
Pray your carpenter comes to save you

[Root.GetTitledName] flinches, but does not scream, as the nails are pounded through [Root.GetHerHis] hands. The crown in [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square cheers wildly, while [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] looks on. 'You are brave,' [From.GetSheHe] calls out, 'I will give you that. But you should thank me! I am giving you the chance to die like your false savior!'
I wonder if [Root.GetSheHe] sees [Root.GetHerHis] house from there

The blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to him: 'Your sins are great, for there can be no peace when the Commander of the Faithful is not faithful to Allah. Pray for forgiveness now, and maybe Allah will forgive you when you meet Him.'
And I shall send you to Him

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'You have kept your faith, that is true. But it is now obsolete. Convert to Islam, or die.' The [Root.GetManWoman] makes no response, save to spit in the ground before the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], sealing [Root.GetHerHis] fate.
So be it

[Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a roaring bonfire and a wildly screaming crowd. [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'All that work to restore your false religion, yet in the end it is undone once more. Your people worship fire, yes?' [From.GetSheHeCap] grins wickedly at the bonfire, radiating intense heat. 'Let us see how much it likes you.'
Not that much, as it turns out

[Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s jailors have not been kind to this so-called '[Root.GetKingQueen] of the Jews'. Body battered, face broken and bruised, yet [Root.GetSheHe] still stands tall against the jeering crowd. [Root.GetSheHeCap] breathes a prayer as [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] raises [From.GetHerHis] blade.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] take your soul!

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'All your worldly power, all those armies at your command. They are not but dust in the face of Allah.' The command is given, and [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] dies.
Allah may show you mercy, but I shall not

The crowd in [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square screams wildly as the execution of [Root.GetTitledName] is carried out. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] looks at the corpse of the [Root.GetManWoman], hanging broken and crucified upon the cross. 'I must give [Root.GetHerHim] credit,' [From.GetSheHe] says. '[Root.GetSheHeCap] did not cry out, not even in the end.'
A pity such a brave [Root.GetManWoman] followed a false religion

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'You pagans may have the trappings of a religion, but you are no better than monkeys, imitating your betters. There is but one true faith, and that is written in the Qur'an. Pray to your false idols, but they will not save you.' With those words, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s fate is sealed.
Goodbye, idolater

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'Give me your trust said the King on his throne,' [From.GetSheHe] quotes, 'but there is no King one should trust but Allah. You have turned your back on the Highest, and now He has turned his back on you.' With those words, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s fate is sealed.
Let the true King show mercy upon you

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [Root.GetSheHeCap] is thrown before [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], who spits on [Root.GetHerHim] in disgust. 'You pigs invade our lands, massacre our people and defile our holy lands with your false god. I tell you this - your death, no matter how agonizing, is far better than you deserve.'
And I will make it quite agonizing indeed

[Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'You have the blood of the Prophet in you, yet you turn against Him. Death is nothing compared to the tortures that await you in the afterlife. But out of respect for the Prophet, I will not shed your blood.' [From.GetSheHeCap] points to the nearby cistern of water, where [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is to be drowned...
It was done respectfully, I think

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'You are a wise and noble [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], and I am sorry it has come to this.' Then [From.GetSheHe] smiles. 'Or, rather, I am sorry I will not receive a ransom for you.' With those words, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s fate is sealed.
Faith is more important than gold

[Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'You have betrayed your God and his Commandments. For the sin of apostasy, I hereby sentence you to death!' The crowd cheers as [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] raises [From.GetHerHis] sword high above the Kafir's head.
Allah may show you mercy, but I shall not

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'You are a mighty fighter, [Root.GetManWoman] of the pale North, but there is no strength greater than that of Allah.' With those words, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s fate is sealed.
Let judgement be done!

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim] with a wry grin: 'They say you are a very clever [Root.GetManWoman]...but have you thought of a way to save yourself?' [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] says nothing, and thus [Root.GetHerHis] fate is sealed.
Not clever enough, it seems

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. As [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim], [From.GetSheHe] realizes a certain amount of the jeers are directed at [From.GetHerHim]. Perhaps slaying a drooling moron isn't the most dignified way to honour Allah, or impress the people. Even so, it must be done.
[Root.GetSheHeCap] barely understood what was happening...

The dazed and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. As [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] watches, the court imam makes a declaration: 'This sinner has grievously offended Allah, and persisted in their error even when confronted with the truth. For such a sinner, there is nothing but death.' With those words, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s fate is sealed.
Allah may show you mercy, but I shall not

The dazed and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is not even present to witness the execution, but [From.GetHerHis] court imam makes a declaration: 'This sinner has grievously offended Allah, and persisted in their error even when confronted with the truth. For such a sinner, there is nothing but death.' With those words, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s fate is sealed.
Allah may show you mercy, but I shall not
A terrible way to die!
Alas, poor [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]!
Such is as Allah commands
To prove you are free from the sin of gluttony, you have decided you shall publicly fast for ten days in repentance, while praying for the intercession of Allah.
Hunger is a demon to be defeated
It is done. Your fast is over, and while it has left you weak, you have demonstrated your piety and a new appreciation for temperance.
Everything in moderation
Charity is one of the most important virtues of Islam. To prove your charitable nature, you go among the poor and distribute a great deal of your wealth, and then pray with the lowest of the low.
Wealth is a curse

It is the responsibility of every Kharijite to spread the faith with determination and ardor. To prove your dedication, you will spend your days memorizing the Holy Qur'an until you can repeat it for the imams, no matter how stressful it might be.
It was difficult, but I did it

A Kharijite must strictly obey Sharia law as written in the Holy Qur'an, and not deviate from it. To prove your dedication, you place the decisions of your court in the hands of the Grand Muffi, and listen intently as his pronouncements are made.
It was a burden, anyway

Every Muslim must put his full faith in the Holy Qur'an, and never doubt or question it. Thus you redouble your efforts to publicly prove your faith, attending services at the mosques with renewed ardor.
But do I truly believe the words I speak?
I will repeat the words, but I do not truly believe them

Your addiction to drink is a curse, and to overcome it your redouble your efforts in every other facet of your life until you think of it no more. You publicly debase yourself before Allah and commit public penance, to prove that you are no longer the [Root.GetManWoman] they believe you to be.
Forgive me!

Your immoral lifestyle flies in the face of the Prophet's commandments, and so you eschew all personal desires and instead rededicate yourself to every other facet of your life. You publicly debase yourself before Allah and commit public penance, to prove that you are no longer the [Root.GetManWoman] they believe you to be.

Decadence is the bane of a Muslim's existence, and you have allowed yourself to wallow in your personal worth for too long. Now you rededicate yourself to every other facet of your life, publicly debasing yourself before Allah and committing public penance, to prove you are no longer the [Root.GetManWoman] they believe you to be.

Though once considered kafir, an apostate in the eyes of Allah due to [Root.GetHerHis] sinful nature, [Root.GetBestName] has committed public penance and divested [Root.GetHerselfHimself] of all immoral desires. Thus [Root.GetSheHe] is ready to be accepted back into the fold as a true Kharijite, deemed worthy by the imams.
Praise Allah!
Well done!
Your latest collection of Islamic poetry has made quite the stir at court, and your courtiers can't stop talking about them. Your fame as a poet is spreading rapidly.

The work on your epic poetry has, unfortunately, come to an end. You no longer have the mental capacity to pursue it, and the body of work you have created up to this point will, undoubtedly, have to serve as your lasting legacy.
Sadly, the work on your epic poem has come to an end now that you are imprisoned. You're not even certain you'll be able to pick up where you were once you get out...if you do.
The work on your epic poem is unfortunately delayed due to the outbreak of the war. All is not lost, however! You will pick up the quill once more once all this war business is done.

Your dark mood has removed all desire to work on your epic poem for the time being. Indeed, the despair lingers such that you're uncertain you'll ever pick it up again. What effect does poetry have on the world, after all? Anything?
You have found yourself so stressed over the last year that you just can't see yourself continuing work on your epic poem for the time being...perhaps ever. You shall have to see.

The malady from which you suffer has made it impossible to progress on your epic poem. Perhaps once you are feeling better, the writing will resume. But for now? Getting over your illness is all you can truly think about.

Work continues on your epic poem, but as of late your find it...lacking a certain something. You need some inspiration, something to shake up your creative juices. Where will you look for that inspiration?
With women, and plenty of them!
With handsome men, and plenty of them!
With a great deal of wine!
With song, merriment, and trouble!
Why must I limit myself to just one thing?

Work continues on your epic poem, but you have run into a problem: to firmly set it in the correct zeitgeist, you need to properly set the scene...and that requires you to look for sources of information outside of your everyday experience.  Where should you start your investigation?
Observe the fashions and intrigues of court
Spend time with your soldiers, and talk of war
Study the tales of history in the library

Work continues on your epic poem, and lately you have found that a certain young and beautiful woman at court has served marvelously as your muse. Sadly, her heart is spoken for...but, even so, your thoughts are consumed with thoughts of her, to the exclusion of your work.

Work continues on your epic poem, and lately you have found that a certain handsome young man at court has served marvelously as your muse. Sadly, his heart is spoken for...but, even so, your thoughts are consumed with thoughts of him, to the exclusion of your work.
Satisfy your carnal desires elsewhere
Is not unrequited love a source of inpiration as well?
I will have her, no matter what!
I will have him, no matter what!

You have tried to progress on your epic poem, but as of late you find yourself suffering from severe writer's block. You spend all day staring at an empty parchment, unable to put down anything of note in words.
Shake things up with a party!
Lock yourself in a minaret until you write something

You have tried to progress on your epic poem, but you find yourself giving more and more into despair. Nothing you write seems to have any worth to you, and the words simply never flow. Perhaps you are not the poet everyone thinks you are?
I should put this aside before I embarrass myself
No! I will keep trying, no matter what!
You pause to realize that you have barely worked on your epic poem in the last year. Things keep coming up at court, one distraction after another, and they are always so important!
I'll get around to it eventually
Work on your epic poem has progressed quickly as of late. You've experienced a significant breakthrough, and the words flow from your pen like...things flowing from a something that flows...
I'm pretty good at this!
Finally, after much work and toil, you've finally completed your epic poem. The beauty of it is sublime, the imagery innovative and story is inspiring.  You can't wait to recite it before the court.
Finally!

The renowned poet, [Root.GetTitledName], has evidently completed another masterpiece of Islamic literature. It is said that he stood and read it before the court...and the reaction was mixed and unenthusiastic. There are some who say this work will be remembered in time for its greatness, but for now [Root.GetTitledFirstName] appears to mostly be embarrassed.
Aargh! All that work, and for what?

The renowned poet, [Root.GetTitledName], has evidently completed another masterpiece of Islamic literature. It is said that he stood and read it before the court...and the reaction was astounding. Men wept tears of joy and women swooned. The work has immediately gained popularity throughout Muslim lands.
Now I can finally rest and be content
Wonderful work, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]!

Working in these dimly lit rooms, studying the secrets hidden in the letters of the Holy Qur'an, through countless sleepless nights has taken a toll on your eyes.  You fear your sight is starting to go.
Not my eyes! How will I read?!
While the true secrets hidden within the code of the Holy Qur'an remain elusive, all this constant studying has improved your overall knowledge.

Spending so much time cooped up in a small room, studying the secrets hidden in the holy books, has take a toll on your body. Your muscles have atrophied and your reactions are much slowed. Such is the price of scholarship.
While the true secrets hidden in the Holy Qur'an has eluded you, working at solving these puzzles has sharped your mind to a fine edge.

Over your many months of studying the Holy Qur'an, you have managed to master the hidden secrets in the Persian and Arabic alphabets as well as the knowledge of numerology. You now know many mystic secrets.

All those long weeks and months spent studying the Holy Qur'an in order to grasp its secrets, and yet you feel further away from the truth now then when you started. Could all this be just a waste of time?

Your carnal desires have only served to distract you from your true calling: unlocking the secrets of the Holy Qur'an. Indeed, you've barely touched another person during these last months of study. Perhaps it would be best to avoid them altogether?
As you slowly start to unlock the secrets of the Holy Qur'an after many months of study, you discover your newfound knowledge has improved your ability to seek the pattern in events around you.

The knowledge you've gained through many long months of studying mystic secrets of the Holy Qur'an has sharpened your mind to such a degree that you are now truly considered one of the wisest men of your generation.
All those late nights spent pouring over the Holy Qur'an, and it has all taken its toll on your health. You have made progress, but you have also become seriously ill as a result of your dedication.

You've used your knowledge of the secrets hidden within the code of the Holy Qur'an to predict the future...yet so far all your predictions have turned out wrong, and your subjects are getting restless.
Your knowledge of the secrets hidden within the code of the Holy Qur'an have predicted a strong and prosperous future for you and your nation.
Your knowledge of the secrets hidden within the code of the Holy Qur'an have predicted a dark and troubled time for you and your nation. The news has upset the common folk.
Your knowledge and continued study of the secrets hidden within the code in the Holy Qur'an have brought great fame and renown to yourself.
Fazlallah Astarabadi

A radical Muslim preacher and mystic, Fazlallah Astarabadi, has been spreading his kabbalistic Shia heresy all over [hurufi_province.GetName] and the surrounding provinces, drawing great crowds and many disciples. At first he was ignored as just another itinerant madman, but his secular power has grown enough that he can no longer be ignored. The question is now whether his doctrine has any merit to [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], the ruling [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], or whether the heresy will be combated as any other.
I believe his words ring of truth
This heresy must be stamped out!
He is a great Hurufi scholar
Such a perversion of Allah's wisdom!

The schism at the heart of Islam dates back to its earliest days. The majority Sunnis have long persecuted the followers of Ali, the Shias, forcing them into hiding. The partisans of Ali look to his descendants for leadership, but they are forced to keep their ancestry secret. Now though, the Shias are mobilizing their strength behind a young man by the name of [shiite_revolter.GetFirstName] whom they claim to be Ali's rightful heir and Imam. Other Islamic jurists claim that the boy is clearly a fraud, but to his followers he is the one they have been waiting for and now they flock to his banner as he begins his crusade to wrest the [shiite_revolt_target_title.GetFullName] from the hands of [shiite_revolt_target.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal].

The schism at the heart of Islam dates back to its earliest days. The majority Sunnis have long persecuted the followers of Ali, the Shias, forcing them into hiding. The partisans of Ali look to his descendants for leadership, but they are forced to keep their ancestry secret. Now, however, the Shias are mobilizing their strength behind Imam [shiite_revolter.GetFirstName] -- descendant of Muhummad through his daughter, Fatimah, who has abdicated his title as the [abdicated_title.GetRulerTitle] of [abdicated_title.GetName] in order to lead his faithful against [shiite_revolt_target.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] for control over the [shiite_revolt_target_title.GetFullName].

The schism at the heart of Islam dates back to its earliest days. The majority Sunnis have long persecuted the followers of Ali, the Shias, forcing them into hiding. The partisans of Ali look to his descendants for leadership, but they are forced to keep their ancestry secret. Now, however, the Shias are mobilizing their strength behind Imam [shiite_revolter.GetFirstName] -- descendant of Muhummad through his daughter, Fatimah, who has surfaced from relative obscurity to lead his faithful against [shiite_revolt_target.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] for control over the [shiite_revolt_target_title.GetFullName].

With your assumption of the Shiite caliphate, Shiite faithful from across many realms have flocked to [Root.Capital.GetName] to fight under your banner. They believe that you will lead them to greatness, and that the might of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] will not be ignored by any in the Muslim world.
Your actions have proven you worthy of deeper initiation into the secret rites of the Druze. It is considered a great honor to join this elite group of religious leaders.
I have been waiting for this!
I am not interested
Oath of al-'Ahd

'I, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], being sane of spirit and body and duly qualified, attest on my soul, without compulsion or constraint, that I renounce all the different cults, religions, and creeds and acknowledge nothing other than obedience to our Lord al-Hakim, revered be his name, and obedience is worship
In al-Hakim's name, I am ready

Only the truest and most brilliant of the Uqqal become Ajawid, the highest religious authorities of the Druze religion. Other Ajawid have sat in judgment of your abilities, and have found you duly worthy of joining them in discovering the Truth within the Hidden.
I take such a burden with the gravity it is due
Rise of the Shaykh

With the ascendance of [Root.GetTitledName] to the rank of Shaykh, the Druze have been given an unprecedented spokes[Root.GetManWoman]. They are no longer the small and oft-maligned group of heretics, but a force that has arrived on the world stage of equal worth to the religions around them. Indeed, they are not truly a Muslim sect, and do not consider themselves such, and with [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] at their head they are now considered a faith in their own right.
A truly glorious day
They are still heretics in the eyes of Allah
Another Muslim schism? Hardly a surprise

[Root.Guardian.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has spoken to you a great deal about the ideals behind the Cathar faith, and how one who aspires to be closer to God must conduct themselves. [Root.Guardian.GetHerHisCap] words have made a great impact upon you.
I will be a good Cathar, I think

The Cathar Church frowns upon contact with members of the opposite sex. Thus you are raised mostly among other Cathar men, and rarely see girls your age at all. You start to feel strange urges, and it occurs to you that the church really only frowns upon reproduction...
It's technically not banned...

The Cathar Church frowns upon contact with members of the opposite sex. Thus you are raised mostly among other Cathar women, and rarely see boys your age at all. You start to feel strange urges, and it occurs to you that the church really only frowns upon reproduction...
A life of sinful urges is not something you can relegate yourself to. You are a devout Cathar, and that means that such sins are best put behind you.
For the glory of God!
Another lost soul brought into this world. Although your new child fills you with joy, you know that having children is frowned upon by the Cathar Church.
I love [From.GetHerHim] anyway

After a long search, a young boy has been found who might make for an ideal candidate. Your councillors tell you he comes from an orphanage in [adopted_province.GetName], his parents both killed by a recent plague. Although a bit grimy and shy, you feel the child might make a good ruler one day, provided he is cleaned up and raised properly.
I suppose he will do
The Council of Saint-Félix

A Cathar heresy has been brewing for some time, begun by numerous ascetic priests who espouse strange beliefs regarding there being two Gods--a 'Good God' who created the spiritual realm, and an 'Evil God' who created the material realm and all of humanity, and the reason why all humans are filled with sin--but with the gathering of these priests at a council in the province of Carcassonne, the heresy has begun to spread like wildfire. At this council, the priests codified many of their laws and spread territories into 'bishoprics', and they have since gained many followers.
Another heresy? In MY lands?!
This heresy must be stopped!
They are led by a Bogomilist, I hear
The Albigensian Crusade

The Cathar faithful desire nothing more than peace, but the men of this evil world will not let that be. And so, a change in philosophy is in order. The Cathar are now permitted, no required, to make holy war upon the unbelievers in order to drive them off and bring about the salvation of mankind.
So must it be
The Cathar Patriarchy

The growing power of the Cathar Church has led it to organize itself as a reflection of the Catholic Church. Created through the political will of [From.GetTitledName], this new Church has a leader: [new_cathar_pope.GetTitledName], elected at a special gathering of bishops in [From.Capital.GetName]. The Cathar world rejoices at the news!
Is this their idea of a Pope?
And so the Christian world devours itself
Glory to Jesus!
John Wycliff

A discredited seminary student by the name of John Wycliff has been spending his time in [new_lollard_stronghold.GetName], preaching his heretical thoughts on the Bible to the peasants--specifically that the Catholic Church must be reformed. He speaks out against the greed and excess of Catholic priests, the Sacrament of the Eucharist, and the over-emphasis of reverence paid to Christian idols. Many peasants, having no love for the corrupt priests of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], have embraced his teachings and the Lollard heresy is spreading like wildfire throughout the countryside.
Where is my Archbishop?
Terrible!
A wise man indeed
Let the heathens fight each other

As you men storm the church, they discover a rich cache of icons and relics, all of it gilded in gold and surely belonging to [From.Owner.GetTitledName]. Such greed and devotion to icons goes against everything the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith stands for...but this is still a holy place, is it not?
Destroy them, and take the gold
I will not desecrate such beauty
Translation of the Bible

Several years ago, [Root.GetTitledName] ordered a translation of the Bible into the vernacular. The [Root.Religion.GetName]s believe, after all, that one of the way the Catholic Church maintains control over the masses is by restricting those who can read it to those educated few versed in the ancient tongue of Latin. A non-Latin Bible is, then, something of a revelation. Fortunately, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s Bible is considered to be a fine translation: clear, easy to read, and already quite popular with the common man.
Glory to God!
This is an affront to God!

Several years ago, [Root.GetTitledName] ordered a translation of the Bible into the vernacular. The [Root.Religion.GetName]s believe, after all, that one of the way the Catholic Church maintains control over the masses is by restricting those who can read it to those educated few versed in the ancient tongue of Latin. A non-Latin Bible is, then, something of a revelation. Unfortunately for [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], [Root.GetHerHis] new Bible is not only considered something of a poor translation -- with far too many parts obviously swayed by the politics of the day -- it is mostly mocked outside of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and mostly disregarded. Even so, it is of great interest to many, and has aided the spread of the [Root.Religion.GetName]s faith.
We will keep working on it

The death of [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] means that [From.GetHerHis] efforts to translate the Bible into the vernacular have been put on hold. Not only that, they are in disarray, and it will take a fair amount of effort to continue the task. Alternatively, the plan could be stopped now, and at least some of the expense regained.
I will continue [From.GetHerHis] efforts
[From.GetHerHisCap] dream dies with [From.GetHerHim]

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],
You are a holy [Root.GetManWoman], it is true...but you are also not a believer in the ideals we Lollards uphold. You revel in excess and greed, and thus I cannot allow you to retain your titles in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. They are to be revoked at once, and given to a more worthy member of the clergy.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],
I understand you espouse the Lollard ideals...yet I see no evidence of that in your conduct. You make a mockery of all we believe, and thus I cannot allow you to retain your titles in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. They are to be revoked at once, and given to a more worthy member of the clergy.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],
Since you are a priest who understands the tenets of the Lollard faith, you will see why I have come to the belief that you have gained far too many titles for your station. A good [Root.GetManWoman] of the Lord should attend to more simple matters. Thus I hereby declare that your greater titles be claimed by the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].

Signed,
[From.GetTitledFirstName]
So be it -- there is nothing to be done
No! I will fight [From.GetHerHim], if I must!

My [Root.GetLordLady],
If that is what you have decided, then so must it be. My titles are yours.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

My [Root.GetLordLady],
If you truly feel that my greater titles are not suitable for a Christian priest, there is nothing I can do to stop your claim.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I will not bow down to the petty demands of a [GetFromRootInsult] [Root.GetManWoman] such as yourself, not now and not ever!

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
[From.GetSheHeCap] will regret that...
Brother Angelo

A disgruntled Catholic monk by the name of Brother Angelo has heavily criticized [Root.GetTitledName], and in so doing has rocked the authority of the Roman Catholic Church. Brother Angelo denies that [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is legally the pope, as [Root.GetSheHe] has abrogated the Rule of St. Francis -- which, according to his doctrine, represented the pure and simple Gospel. He has asserted that all of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s decrees are thus invalid, and that all Catholics who follow the Pope's will have lost the grace of God.
The man is clearly a heretic
He sounds like a man with the right ideas
Criticize the Pope? Unheard of!

The words of Brother Angelo have been weighing on your soul. Too many churchmen are more concerned more with power and money than with their holy calling, and the result is a Catholic Church that is rife with corruption. Perhaps the Fraticelli are right?
I believe in their call for reform
Right or not, I will follow the Faith
The Poor of Lyons

A wealthy merchant of Lyons by the name of Pierre Valdes gave up all his earthly possessions and began wandering the countryside as a preacher after a brush with death. He has been condemning the Catholic Church for its corruption, as well as calling for a return to a more Biblical lifestyle. The man has rapidly gained followers amongst the poor of Lyons, and his disciples have ranged even further and begun seeking converts in northern Italy -- enough to cause considerable concern within the Catholic hierarchy.
The man is clearly a heretic
And thus another heresy begins
Another problem for the Catholics

The founding of the Waldensian Church was mostly underground, and the so the early initiates organized themselves into cells. The Doctores would lead the cells and train Novellani, who would go and preach to the masses, while the Sandaliati would travel to keep the cells in touch. It is a tradition that has continued to this day.
I am Sandaliati
I am Doctores
I am Novellani

As a Waldensian [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], you are considered to have brought considerable renown to the cause. What some might have disregarded as a passing thing is now given far more serious weight in the world, perhaps even enough to one day challenge the gravitas of the Pope himself.
Lux Lucit in Tenebris!

As your men storm the church, you cut down a [From.Owner.Religion.GetName] priest trying to protect a relic, gilded in gold. These false idols are a means to deceive the peasants and confuse ignorant fools. You are of half a mind to destroy them and return the wealth to the people.
Do it
I would rather keep it for myself

Rome, the Eternal City, and the source of all the corruption of the Church. It is full of treasures stolen from the people, false relics to deceive the gullible. Your men have their orders: destroy them all, and return the wealth to the people.

Canterbury, where the tomb Thomas Beckett lies...or lied, since it is there no longer. The tomb has been destroyed by your holy wrath, no longer able to tempt poor Christian fools away from devoting their faith to false relics, and the wealth of its riches returned to the people.

You don't know who is buried in this shrine, but you know it is not St. James. That is just a false legend made to trick pilgrims and take their money. Well, no longer. You give the bones a proper burial, and then burn the shrine down around you. The wealth of its relics have been returned to the people.

In the Cathedral of Köln, there lies the Sarcophagus of the Magi: over two meters of gilded silver and jewels. Why waste such wealth on falsehoods, idols that lure the foolish away from their true faith in God, when it could be given to the poor?
So must it be
The Sacking of [FromFrom.GetName]

After the Waldensians seized Rome, they proceeded to destroy any and all holy relics they could reach, stripping all the wealth from the Roman churches. The bones of St. Peter have been thrown out and cast into the street, the Chains of St. Paul melted down, and the Scala Santa smashed and destroyed. Catholics everywhere are distraught.

Canterbury, the great pilgrimage site for all of the British Isles has been destroyed, the tomb of St. Thomas Beckett desecrated by the Waldensians. Even as the heretics rejoice at their victory, so are Catholics elsewhere distraught at the loss of the holy relics now cast aside as worthless.

The Way of St. James has no endpoint now, as Santiago de Compostela has fallen to the Waldensians. The shrine of St. James has been destroyed, the bones once therein now missing, and the many holy relics which belonged to the shrine have either been destroyed or cast to the people as trinkets.

The Grand Cathedral of Köln now smoulders as the Waldensians strip it of everything of value. Countless relics have been destroyed, including the Sarcophagus of the Magi: over two meters of gilded silver and jewels, all melted down. The Waldensians say that the poor shall be able to eat for a year on what was stored there.
Sacrilege!
A victory for sense and righteousness!

All Waldensian lords are expect to give charity to the poor and disenfranchised in their realm. Now, that tenet is tested as a large number of refugees have arrived into [Root.Capital.GetName] from the provinces of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. The war has left them destitute, and their numbers have overwhelmed the ability of the city to support them.
They must be helped
There is nothing to be done
In the sermon today, your priest expounded on the sin of greed, and how no greedy [Root.GetManWoman] can enter heaven. You just wish he didn't use yourself as an example.
He's not wrong...

A recent opportunity to improve the facilities in [Root.Capital.GetName] for assisting the poor has arisen, and it is something your councillors tell you will not only assist the people but make the city far better than it has ever been. It does, however, require a significant investment.
Then we must do it
We cannot afford it
The ideals of the Waldensian faith have made a big impression on you. You have decided to be charitable at all times.
The poor need our help!

Messalians believe everyone is born with demons inside them, and those demons can only be expelled by intercession of the Holy Spirit...which can only be summoned with intense asceticism and prayer. It may take years to finally succeed, but you are ready to begin.
Let the demons be driven out, once and for all!
You have prayed and fasted for months on end, but despite all your efforts you are still haunted by the sins of the flesh. You are forced to give up in defeat.

You have prayed and fasted for months on end, but in the end you are forced to admit your mind is still not your own. If anything, the spells of lunacy have become worse as weakness and dizziness beset you, and there are nights were you wander through the castle, howling. The demons are too strong, and you are forced to admit defeat.

You have prayed and fasted for months on end, but in the end you are forced to admit your mind is still not your own. In fact, the visions come more frequently, now. Lucifer himself has been speaking with you, whispering of your lamentable weakness...and you have to admit you agree. The demons within you are simply too strong.
I will try again, I swear it!
It has taken many, many months of prayer and cold baths, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Luxuria from your soul.
It has taken many, many months of prayer and painful dedication, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Gula from your soul.
It has taken many, many months of prayer and many painful donations to the poor, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Avaritia from your soul.
It has taken many, many months of prayer and far too many early morning exercises, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Acedia from your soul.
It has taken many, many months of prayer and more slow counts to ten than you can even recall, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Ira from your soul.
It has taken many, many months of prayer and a great deal of contemplative meditation, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Invidia from your soul.
It has taken many, many months of prayer and a great deal of contemplative meditation, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Superbia from your soul.
It has taken many, many months of prayer and far too many visits to the local orphanage, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Cruelty from your soul.

You almost thought this day would never come. After many, many months of prayer and meditation, you wake up one morning and...the voices in your head are simply gone. You cannot even remember a time when you felt so in control of yourself. The demon in your mind has finally been driven out!

You almost thought this day would never come. After many, many months of prayer and meditation, you wake up one morning and...your mind is simply your own. No more irrational impulses, no more dangerous thoughts. It is as if they simply never were. You cannot even remember a time when you felt so in control of yourself. The demon in your mind has finally been driven out!
Finally, I am free!
Since you are no longer Messalian, there is no point in continuing the prayer and fasting. There are no demons within you to cast out.
While you would happily continue your ritual prayer and fasting, it is simply not possible to do so while you are imprisoned.
While you would happily continue your ritual prayer and fasting, such rigorousness is now simply beyond your capacity.

Despite your prayers, you are still haunted by lustful dreams at night. The craving for carnal pleasures feels as if it will overwhelm you at times. The demon within may be too strong for you to expel.
I will surround myself with those of my own gender, no-one else!
I cannot resist the temptation
The bold contours and muscles of the young men of your court are becoming irresistible. You realize you've been spending your days idly dreaming of their strong, oiled arms...
The soft scents of the young women of your court are becoming overpowering. A nice warm bath sounds nice, where you can can massage oil into one or two of their young, nubile bodies...
I must resist temptation!
I have no choice but to give in...
You have never felt this hungry in your life. You think of all the food stored in your kitchens. All the prayer in the world won't help if you starve to death...
I cannot surrender to the sins of the flesh!

The sound of rattling dice draws you toward a pair of guardsmen, gambling for silver. It just so happens you have a set of loaded dice in your pocket, given to you from a friend in jest. Should you teach these fools a lesson?
No, gambling is sinful and greedy
Perhaps just a few games won't hurt...
You haven't been keeping up on your prayers to expel the daemon of Sloth, which, beyond the irony of the situation, has been troubling you...
I will make a determined effort
The prayers can wait until tomorrow
A particularly irritating courtier has been on your nerves of late, when you happened to spot him prancing around with the most ridiculous hat on, causing your blood to boil.
Slowly count to ten...
Have that hat nailed to his head

Your attempts to pray your envy away have been difficult. Lately, you have begun coveting a fine horse possessed by one of your courtiers, one who has been the pride of all [Root.Capital.GetName]. It would be so simple a matter for you to just take it for yourself. What could he do?
I can do without another horse
It is rightfully mine, anyhow
Your prayers to end your pride have not been successful. However, a young member of your church has proven himself skilled at exorcisms. Do you own up and ask for his assistance?
Humbly ask him for help
No, that's ridiculous! What could he do?

A criminal is brought before you for justice, having been caught stealing a small breakfast roll from the market. Although you have been trying to end your cruel inclinations, letting this man go will reflect poorly on you...you do have a reputation to uphold, after all.
Let him go free
Hang him as he deserves!
Choose a patron saint to watch over you and to who you will direct your prayers.
St. Nestorius, the Evangelist
St. Addai, disciple and healer
Lucifer, the greatest of the Archangels
St. Adelphius, the founder of the Faith

In a dark cellar, at the stroke of midnight, you take the oath. Surrounded by pentagrams, ram skulls and strange inscriptions written in no modern tongue, you swear to keep and preserve the secrets of Cult, and to die before revealing any of them. There, you learn the secret Truths of Heaven and Hell, passed down from Adelphius himself...
Better to reign in Hell...
The Army of Lucifer

The growing power of the Messalians can no longer be denied. With the aid of [Root.GetTitledName], a group of fanatics, peasants, and madmen have now banded together to create their own army -- one that has, much to the shock of Christians elsewhere in the world, taken as its patron saint none other than Lucifer the Lighbringer, greatest of the Archangels and the King of Hell. Lucifer, they believe, is no more than an agent of chaos and change, and in His name they intend to bring about a change in the world. They will drive the demons of sin from the ranks of humanity with the force of their arms...if they are given the chance, that is.
A glorious day!

My [Root.GetLordLady], this extremely generous donation will not be forgotten. You have my friendship, as well as that of all the [From.Religion.GetName] faithful. Rest assured that you will be rewarded in the afterlife, if not on Earth!
Yours in faith,

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

My [Root.GetLordLady], this antagonism is completely unwarranted! The [holy_order_name.GetName] serves [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], but, one has to wonder, do you?

With anger and sadness,

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I have thought long and hard about this, and I believe I have come to the conclusion that I must dedicate my life utterly to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. With your permission, I wish to join a monastery, though of course I will be available at court, should you need me.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I have thought long and hard about this, and I believe I have come to the conclusion that I must dedicate my life utterly to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. With your permission, I wish to join a nunnery, though of course I will be available at court, should you need me.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]
The Order of Saint Blaise

In order the stem the tide of infidels and heretics bearing down upon the innocent faithful, a small army of Armenian soldiers and clerics have banded together under the banner of Saint Blaise. With the Latins and Greeks pushing from the west and the Muslims from the East, there is very little these men have aside from unshakeable faith in the power of God to stand between them and their enemies.
Knights of true Christendom!
The Knights of Saint Mark

In order the protect the oppressed faithful from the iron scepter of Muslim domination and the encroachment of the schismatics, the Knights of Saint Mark has arisen to preserve the Coptic populations scattered throughout Egypt and Abyssinia. Tales abound of their courage and tenacity, even against innumerably greater odds.
Acheiropoieta

Above the gate to a city in [acheiropoieta_province.GetName], there is enshrined an Acheiropoieta: an icon which, it is claimed, was not created by human hands but rather came into existence miraculously. All icons in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are condemned to be destroyed, but the people of [acheiropoieta_province.GetName] have refused to destroy the Acheiropoieta, claiming its divine heritage shelters the city from danger. [iconoclast_patriarch.GetTitledName] has, however, demanded you deal it regardless.
Send soldiers to destroy it immediately
Let them have their false icon
Take it and keep it for yourself

You still have the acheiropoieta you took so long ago from the city in [acheiropoieta_province.GetName]. You keep it in a secluded shrine that only you have access to. Lately, as you go to visit it, you hear voices in your head, telling you things, things confusing your mind...
It really is divine! Icons are real!
It is [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] trying to destroy me!
Constantine's Return

The war is not going well, and many parts of the empire are already in chaos. Now, a group of soldiers has reportedly broken into the imperial mausoleum in the Church of the Holy Apostles, opened the sarcophagus of Constantine V, and implored him to return and save the empire. Iconoclast zealots have been quick to jump on this news, claiming it is Orthodox idolatry that is dooming the emperor. They have pleaded with [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] to honor the memory of the former emperor and lead the emperor away from its idolatrous ways before it is too late.
They are right -- the idolatry must end!
That is not why we are losing the war
This does not bode well...
[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has embraced the iconoclast heresy, demanding that all holy icons be destroyed and all subjects of the empire convert as [From.GetSheHe] has.
Perhaps [From.GetSheHe] is right...
[From.GetSheHeCap] is a fool and a heretic!
Finally an [From.PrimaryTitle.GetTitledName] with sense!
This is of no concern to me
[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

While the Paulician faith has been riven by internal conflicts for the last few decades, the heresy has a new leader in [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], a zealous priest of [Root.Culture.GetName] origin as well as an effective converter. He has spread his sect throughout Armenian lands ruled by the Byzantine Empire, and is very quickly becoming a major problem for Orthodox rulers.
Blasted heretics!

All across the Byzantine Empire, Paulicians are being violently persecuted on the order of [Root.GetTitledName]. They are rounded up and imprisoned, their homes burned and their belongings seized. All Paulician courtiers have been ordered either executed or banished.
Hopefully that will take care of it
A rather extreme measure...
This is an outrage!
The Paulician Patriarch

[Root.GetTitledName] has claimed the title of Paulician Patriarch, head of all Christians who follow the teachings of Paul of Samosata. Others outside of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] claim the [Root.GetManWoman] is little more than a glorified warlord, but to the Paulician faithful [Root.GetSheHe] is a symbol of their victory against attempts by their fellow Christians to suppress them. Perhaps, in time, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will lead the Paulicians to claiming a piece of history in Europe.
A glorious day for us all!
Who is this upstart heretic?
A self-titled warmonger? How very Christian...
Bogomilists in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]

A heresiarch by the name of 'Bogomil', which may not even be his true name, has appeared in the province of Kossovo, capitalizing on the anger of the locals following their conversion from pagan ways. His teachings of a heresy that seems to combine Christianity with a combination of Gnostic dualism and anti-church sentiment has caught on extremely quickly in both Kossovo and the surrounding areas, presenting a challenge to [Root.GetTitledName]'s rule as well as to the authority of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. Some believe that this 'Bogomil' has reached the court of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], and that [Root.GetSheHe] might even be considered a conversion to these heretical beliefs.
I believe this priest has wise things to say
Me, convert? To a foul heresy?!
Hurrah!
This does not bode well...

The formalization process of Bogomilism has officially begun, with [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] meeting with a group of perfecti leaders in [Root.Capital.GetName] and expressing [Root.GetHerHis] desire to see the faith go from a disorganized movement to one fully integrated with [Root.GetHerHis] rule. They expressed doubt, but were willing to hear [Root.GetHerHim] out, for the time being.
We will all have to be patient

All this talk of 'reforming' the Bogomilist faith in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is pointless. Perhaps the previous rulers were interested in such a thing, but since you are not a Bogomilist, you will certainly have no part in it.
While you would gladly continue the process of reforming the Bogomilist faith, you no longer have the influence to do so.

[Root.GetTitledName]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the Bogomilist faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have been rewarded after a recent meeting of Perfecti in [Root.Capital.GetName]. They finally agreed to a common liturgy, so that ceremonies performed across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] use a common set of prayers and rituals, and that this will be taught to new Perfecti going forward.

Up until now, Bogomilist priests have all used different letters and gospels in their preaching, a result of the scattered and disparate beginnings of the faith. At the behest of [Root.GetTitledName], the '[Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] Bible' has been written and agred upon as canon by a council of Perfecti in [Root.Capital.GetName].

In order to continue the process of formalizing the Bogomilist faith, the scattered preachers and Perfecti will need to be gathered together in councils. They resist such efforts an organization, however, and the only way to see it done will be with coin -- for the poor, for shrines, for bribes, and for God.
If that is what it takes, so be it
I will not bribe my faith into reform

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the Bogomilist faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have been rewarded after an unprecedented agreement from Bogomilist leaders across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] to gather in permanent councils sponsored by the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle].
A good day for all Bogomilists

A Bogomilist Perfecti has approached you with an idea for continuing your efforts to formalize your faith: the construction of several seminary schools across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], each teaching a common and unified version of Bogomilism dogma to future preachers. It would be expensive, but the Perfecti says it would be a worthy achievement.
An excellent idea
Not right now

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the Bogomilist faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have advanced, with the construction of numerous seminary schools across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] that would each train new priests in a standardized form of dogma.

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the Bogomilist faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have been rewarded today after a prominent Perfecti in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] issued a proclamation of support. The [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] is a [Root.GetManWoman] of piety and faith, he says, and thus [Root.GetHerHis] desires should be heeded.

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the Bogomilist faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have advanced after the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] gave a speech in [Root.Capital.GetName] that has been widely-disseminated and complimented by pious scholars.

A recent treatise written by [Root.GetTitledName] [Root.GetHerHim]self on the vital importance of Bogomilism's continued reforms has spread far and wide across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], and received a lot of recognition from the faithful as being full of wisdom. Indeed, some are viewing the text as a new addition to Bogomilist canon.

Recently, a new sect of Bogomilist has been spreading in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], one that advocates a radically different version of the faith. Normally this would not be an issue, as the sect is not popular, but it has proven disruptive to your efforts to formalize Bogomilism, as their presence has prompted other sects to follow suit.
Leave them be
Quietly get rid of them

A recent revival of Bogomilist traditionalism has taken hold in [PrimaryTitle.GetName], with numerous preachers cropping up who actively deride your efforts to reform the faith as being exactly the same sort of tyrannical structure they rebelled against in the first place. Needless to say, this has not been helpful.

A prominent Perfecti in [demand_province.GetName] has publicly begged that you slow down, if not outright stop, the process of Bogomilist reform. The common folk are confused by these contradictions, he says, and continuing down this path too quickly will only bring down God's wrath. The Perfecti is too popular to be silenced, as doing so would turn him into a martyr for his cause.
Do as he asks, for now
Ignore him

A set of crop failures and other disasters that has fallen one of your provinces in recent months has stirred the ire of several fiery preaches in the area. They say that you are to blame, that your desire for reforms and general lack of piety is what has brought down God's wrath upon the people of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. Sadly, their words have taken hold amongst many.

A prominent Perfecti has recently taken issue with your desire to reform the Bogomilist faith, pointing out a number of flaws in your argument without ever actually saying outright that your intention is solely to grab power and force the faithful into compliance. To her, you are not a learned enough [Root.GetManWoman] to push such things forward, and there is no convincing her otherwise.

[Root.GetTitledName]'s recent victory against [From.GetTitledName] in [Root.Location.GetName] has been hailed as a major victory for Bogomilism, and has spread the notion that perhaps the continuing reforms of the faith have God's favor after all.

[Root.GetTitledName]'s recent staggering loss against [From.GetTitledName] in [Root.Location.GetName] has been hailed as a sign that the ongoing reforms of the Bogomilist faith do not have God's favor after all.
Bogomilist Faith Organized

In its inception, the Bogomilist faith was only loosely organized. It didn't believe in formal churches, and opposed any kind of formal hierarchy -- this has all changed with the leadership of [Root.GetTitledName], whose piety and status as a Perfecti has encouraged all members of [Root.GetHerHis] faith to reconsider their resistance to feudal structures. Bogomilists across the world are now more formally organized, though many still do not consider them a true religion, and they remain opposed to any kind of formal church that emulates the Orthodox priesthood. Even so, there are many that object to even these changes, saying that Bogomilism has betrayed its own roots at a powerful [Root.GetLordLady]'s behest.
A better day for us all
Bogomilist Faith Formalized

Though the faithful were hardly ready for it, Bogomilism has now been formalized as a structured religion thanks to the leadership of [Root.GetTitledName]. While many see [Root.GetHerHis] leadership and piety as being worthwhile to follow, there are many who claim [Root.GetSheHe] has dragged the faith too fast into something which too much resembles the very kind of tyrannical structures they once abandoned. Preachers throughout [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are questioning how far this will go, and whether the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] has not perhaps betrayed Bogomilism's principles for the sake of power. Whatever the case, Bogomilist priests are now unified under a common liturgy, a single sacred text, and operate out of temples -- far more than the disparate heretics from where they sprang.
This is how it must be
Are we truly ready for this?

After a long and arduous process of reform, the Bogomilist faith can now truly be considered a formal religion. Under the considered leadership and piety of [Root.GetTitledName], Bogomilist priests are now unified under a common liturgy, a single sacred text, and operate out of temples -- far more than the disparate heretics from where they sprang. While some question whether these reforms betray the principles upon which Bogomilism was founded, far more say they were agreed to by all and with due consideration. The faith is now ready to come into its own.
The Bogomilist Patriarchy

At the behest of [Root.GetTitledName], [new_bogomilist_patriarch.GetTitledName] has been elected as the head of the newly-founded Bogomilist Church, Bogomilism having completely transformed itself from an Orthodox heresy into a fully-formed religion in its own right. Christian leaders elsewhere have been forced to recognize this new faith as a force in its own right, and its inception as a schism from standard Christianity rather than a true heresy.
It appears we must accept this now
Heretics or not, they are still Christians

Construction has begun in Tyrnovo on the planned Church of St. Bogomil, a structure to rival St. Peter's Basilica or the Hagia Sophia. It will surely be a marvel of construction, and a bastion of faith for all Bogomilists across the world!
Let us hope I live to see it finished
The Church of St. Bogomil

As evidence of just how far the Bogomilist faith has come, the Church of St. Bogomil has completed construction in the city of Tyrnovo. A majestic structure to rival even the most potent Christian cathedrals, the church has become a bastion of faith for all Bogomilists across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and beyond.
St. Bogomil himself would be pleased
The Council of [council_location.GetName]

At the behest of [council_holder.GetTitledName], an ecumenical council is to take place at [council_location.GetName], one which many believe will end the Great Schism which has divided the western and eastern branches of Christianity once and for all. [target_religion.GetTitledName] is said to be arriving, as is a horde of priests, patriarchs, and senior members of both the [mender_religion.Religion.GetName] and [target_religion.Religion.GetName] faiths. Unlike previous councils, there is a feeling that the Great Schism may actually be resolved -- indeed, with the influence that [council_holder.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] holds amongst the faithful, it may very well be that the [target_religion.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] has no choice but to agree to the council's resolutions even if the result would turn [target_religion.GetHerHim] into a virtual heretic. [target_religion.Religion.GetName] rulers across the world are already considering whether they must submit to this new order of [mender_religion.Religion.GetName] dominance.
Let the council begin!
I will become [mender_religion.Religion.GetName]
No, I am [target_religion.Religion.GetName]!
This is of great concern...
A truly glorious day
This has nothing to do with us

After more than a month of heated deliberations, the Council of [council_location.GetName] has ended. The process began by [council_holder.GetTitledName] has ended with the [mender_religion.Religion.GetName] faith standing triumphant. What few members of the [target_religion.Religion.GetName] faith remain are now considered heretics, with most having already converted. The Great Schism is now officially ended.
May God watch over us all
It will break apart again, just watch
The Christians united? A frightening thought!

At the behest of [council_holder.GetTitledName], an ecumenical council is to take place at [council_location.GetName], one which seems ready to finally resolve the Council of Ephesus from the 5th Century -- that historic event which originally repudiated Nestorianism and caused the creation of the Church of the East. [target_religion.GetTitledName] is said to be arriving, as is a large number of priests, patriarchs, and senior members of both the [mender_religion.Religion.GetName] and [target_religion.Religion.GetName] faiths, almost too many for [council_location.GetName] to contain. With [council_holder.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s influence backing the council, it is believed the Nestorians will be brought into the [mender_religion.Religion.GetName] fold, something even the [target_religion.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] will likely have no choice but to agree to even if this will turn [target_religion.GetHerHim] into a virtual heretic. Already [target_religion.Religion.GetName] rulers across the world are considering whether they will heed the council's wishes and convert.

After more than a month of heated deliberations, the Council of [council_location.GetName] has ended. The process began by [council_holder.GetTitledName] has ended with the [mender_religion.Religion.GetName] faith standing triumphant. What few members of the [target_religion.Religion.GetName] faith remain are now considered heretics, with most having already converted. The original Council of Ephesus has been enforced, and Nestorianism is officially no more.
A few centuries late, I'd say
Victory over a dead religion? How grand

At the behest of [council_holder.GetTitledName], an ecumenical council is to take place at [council_location.GetName], one which seems ready to finally resolve the Council of Chalcedon from the 5th Century -- that historic event which originally repudiated 'monophysitism' and caused its believers to split from the Christian Church. Already [target_religion1.Religion.GetName]  and [target_religion2.Religion.GetName] rulers across the world are considering whether they will heed the council's wishes and convert.

[target_religion.GetTitledName] is said to be arriving, as are thousands of priests, patriarchs, and senior members of both the [mender_religion.Religion.GetName] and [target_religion.Religion.GetName] faiths, almost too many for [council_location.GetName] to contain.
