Now that you are the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], you must choose whether you follow the Greek or Latin rites of the Christian faith.
I shall follow the Latin rites
I shall follow the Greek rites

[rightful_relhead.GetTitledName] has contacted you, demanding that you switch to the Latin Rites. As [rightful_relhead.GetSheHe] has primacy within the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], it is within [rightful_relhead.GetHerHis] right to make such a demand...but it is also your right to refuse.

[rightful_relhead.GetTitledName] has contacted you, demanding that you switch to the Greek Rites. As [rightful_relhead.GetSheHe] has primacy within the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], it is within [rightful_relhead.GetHerHis] right to make such a demand...but it is also your right to refuse.
I will follow the traditions I always have
I bow before [rightful_relhead.GetHerHis] demand
Two Roman Emperors?

[Root.GetTitledName] has invoked the translatio imperii, and been given the blessing of Pope [current_roman_pope.GetFirstName] as the ruler of a Roman Empire reborn. This naturally does not sit well with [current_byzantine_emperor.GetTitledName], who maintains that the Pope does not have the right to bestow such a title. Indeed, the Pope doing so could imply either that [current_byzantine_emperor.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is not the *true* Roman [current_byzantine_emperor.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] or that [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has some manner of authority over [current_byzantine_emperor.GetHerHis] realm. Either way, Greek bishops throughout Europe are furious, seeing this as yet more evidence of the Pope's attempts to establish primacy despite the Council of Chalcedon having clearly placed Constantinople as the seat of Christianity's highest ecclesiastical court.
The Pope oversteps [current_roman_pope.GetHerHis] bounds
There were two Roman Empires before -- what is the problem?
More divisions amongst righteous Christians?
So the Christians bicker amongst themselves
The Erosion of Christianity

With the war currently ongoing between [Root.GetTitledName] and [papal_emperor.GetTitledName], questions have begun to rise about the unity of Chalcedonian Christianity. [papal_emperor.GetTitledFirstName] was crowned by the Pope, was [papal_emperor.GetSheHe] not? Does that not make [papal_emperor.GetHerHim] the Pope's champion? Yet here [papal_emperor.GetSheHe] stands, at war with the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] who stands at the center of the eastern Christian faith. Divisions between Latin and Greek Christians have been deepening for years, but this war brings into sharp focus just how bad things have become. More and more, bishops on both sides are talking about a coming schism that could rend Christianity in two.
The [papal_emperor.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] is clearly to blame for this
The [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] is clearly to blame for this
This bodes ill for us all
The coming schism is clearly inevitable
Adoption of the Filioque

'And in the Holy Spirit, the Lord, the giver of life,
who proceeds from the Father and the Son,
who with the Father and the Son is adored and glorified.'

The original Nicene Creed, established at the First Council of Nicaea in 325AD, did not have the phrase 'and the Son' added to 'who proceeds from the Father'. This is referred to as the Filioque, and by the decree of Pope [Root.GetFirstName] it has been added to the creed used by Latin bishops, to underline the importance of the Son in the Trinity...and reoundingly rejected by the vast majority of Greek bishops, who are furious that the Pope did so without calling an ecumenical council. To most, this is yet another example of the growing division between Greek and Latin Christianity.
The Pope oversteps [Root.GetHerHis] bounds once again!
Do they seriously reject the Son's true importance?
Surely some kind of compromise can be reached?
Papal Jurisdiction

A recent rare meeting between [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and [current_patriarch.GetTitledFirstName] in Constantinople to discuss the ecclesiastical jurisdiction over [jurisdiction_realm.PrimaryTitle.GetName] was said to end in near-chaos, with [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] storming out of the cathedral in a fury. The Pope claims that [jurisdiction_realm.PrimaryTitle.GetName] falls within [Root.GetHerHis] rightful domain, while [current_patriarch.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] claims [jurisdiction_realm.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has never been part of either ecclesiastical realm, and that this is yet another example of the Pope striving to assert primacy where it is not warranted. This latest conflict over papal jurisdiction has left both patriarchs almost unwilling to communicate at all, a fact which has left many of their bishops extremely worried.
[jurisdiction_realm.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is its own domain, clearly
So [jurisdiction_realm.PrimaryTitle.GetName] should be left without a proper Patriarch?
This bickering does no-one any good...
Conflict Over the Eucharist

A dispute between [Root.GetTitledName] and a number of [Root.GetHerHis] Latin priests has quickly spread to the highest reaches of Christian rule. [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], [Root.GetHerHim]self a follower of the Greek rites, took to task a number of priests in [Root.GetHerHis] realm who were using unleavened bread while administering the Eucharist, calling them 'azymites' and ultimately ordering their arrest. The priests complained, outraged, and their anger spread to other Latin realms, resulting in a series of sweeping edicts against several Greek practices. Greek bishops have responded in kind, and while leaders have allowed the matter to blow over, the simmering anger between both sides remains sharp and clear.

A dispute between [Root.GetTitledName] and a number of [Root.GetHerHis] Greek priests has quickly spread to the highest reaches of Christian rule. [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], [Root.GetHerHim]self a follower of the Latin rites, took to task a number of priests in [Root.GetHerHis] realm who were using leavened bread while administering the Eucharist, calling them 'prozymites' and ultimately ordering their arrest. The priests complained, outraged, and their anger spread to other Greek realms, resulting in a series of sweeping edicts against several Latin practices. Latin bishops have responded in kind, and while leaders have allowed the matter to blow over, the simmering anger between both sides remains sharp and clear.
The Eucharist uses leavened bread -- only!
The Eucharist uses unleavened bread -- only!
All this over bread? Seriously?
The Wicked [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]

The depredations of [Root.GetTitledName] are renowned throughout the Christian world, [Root.GetHerHis] wickedness having reached such infamy that [other_patriarch.GetTitledFirstName] has called for [Root.GetHerHis] removal from holy office. [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is said to have laughed at this, shocking [Root.GetHerHis] advisors by launching into a tirade over the [other_patriarch.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] within earshot of the [other_patriarch.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]'s envoys. The resulting chill between the Greek and Latin leaders has deepened the already-wide division in Christianity, once again raising the specter of a possible schism within the faith.
What was the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] thinking?
Call For Council Refused

Perhaps fearing the ever-growing rift between the Latin and Greek branches of Christianity, [Root.GetTitledName] issued a call for reconciliation with a new Ecumenical Council in [Root.Capital.GetName]...a call that has been met by [current_patriarch.GetTitledName] with little more than stony silence. For many, this was seen as a last chance to avert what they see as the coming schism. Now all such hope has been quenched, and it is thought to be only a matter of time before the division becomes official.
'Reconciliation', [Root.GetSheHe] calls it? Ha!
If it happens, it is on the Ecumenical Patriarch's head
I suppose we shall have to wait and see
Has it truly become so bad between them?
The Great Schism

The inevitable has finally occurred: a delivery of a bull of excommunication to [current_patriarch.GetTitledName] by [schism_pope.GetTitledName] has been responded to in kind. The mutual excommunication follows on the heels of what is reported to be a series of terse letters over Christian doctrine, each building on the growing divisions between Latin and Greek Christianity. While few are treating the event as noteworthy at the moment, the reality of the situation is that Rome and Constantinople have grown apart to the point where any hope of reconciliation has been completely lost. They have, in truth, become two separate faiths operating under their separate religious heads, despite the Pope's and the Ecumenical Patriarch's assurances to the contrary.
We follow the Bishop of Rome
We follow the Ecumenical Patriarch
This is of great concern...
So Christianity divides itself yet again
The Patriarch Supreme

Today Pope [Root.GetFirstName] ascends the steps of St. Peter's Basilica in Rome to become the Patriarch Supreme -- head of the Christian Church and undisputed leader of both the Greek and Latin versions of the faith. Thanks to the piety and power of [From.GetTitledName] backing [Root.GetHerHim], the divisions within the Church have now been healed...or, at least, the possibility of schism has been entirely removed. Christians can finally move forward, united in their common belief against the array of enemies who had been, up to this point, fervently praying for the Church to be rent asunder.

Hail to [Root.GetHerHisCap] Holiness!
So there will be no schism? How unexpected
This does not bode well...
Your vassal §Y[From.GetTitledName]§! was appointed as Cardinal by Pope [current_pope.GetFirstName].
§Y[From.GetTitledName]§! was appointed as Cardinal by Pope [current_pope.GetFirstName].

Sahidic culture has been present ever since Saint Mark introduced Christianity to Egypt shortly after Christ's ascension. We speak our own language and maintain our own traditions, as we have for centuries. To some, we are the only true Egyptians that remained once the Muslims took over most of North Africa. As I am a Christian myself, perhaps it is time I embrace that distinction from the Arabs around me?

Sahidic culture existed in Egypt long before the muslim conquest. We speak our own language and maintain our own traditions, as we have for centuries. To some, we are the only true Egyptians that remained once the Muslims took over most of North Africa. Perhaps it is time I embrace that distinction from the Arabs around me?
Yes, I am Sahidic
No, there is no point
The Coptic Arabs in [Root.GetName] have slowly begun to adopt the language and traditions of the Sahidic.
While I am in every way Sahidic, I am not Coptic, and it seems pointless to hold onto outdated ways that are so closely tied to the Coptic faith, does it not?
True, I am really an Egyptian
No, I am Sahidic and will remain thus
With the people in [Root.GetName] no longer clinging to the Coptic faith, their Sahidic traditions and language have begun to fall to the wayside.
The Journey of Nerthus

With [nerthus_top_liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] in a time of peace, [Root.GetTitledName] has declared that the time has come for the Journey of Nerthus. The fertility goddess will travel across the land in a covered chariot, with only [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] permitted to look upon her, her arrival in each hold calling for a time of feasting and celebration. It is one of the most holy of Germanic traditions, a period during which lords are not permitted to engage in war, at least until the goddess tires of her travels and retires to the sacred grove again.
We will celebrate with a great feast!
Excellent, I was already planning a feast
The celebrations will be kept to a minimum
Alas, I cannot afford a great feast
This will be a joyous time for all
Must we pay homage to a pagan sex goddess?

With the feasts throughout [nerthus_top_liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] now done, and the holy cart having completed its circuit throughout the land, the goddess Nerthus has apparently tired of her communications with mortal men and returned to the sacred grove in Castum. [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has declared the holy time at an end, with the fields now blessed and many married women now hoping to conceive in this most auspicious period following the journey's close.
Another journey has ended
It's over? What a relief

With the journey ended, you alone see to the purification of the holy cart used to convey the 'goddess'. It is carefully washed by slaves, who are then thrown into the lake and drowned--grateful for the honor they have been granted.
Until the next journey begins

The Journey of Nerthus has begun, and you hear many tales of fertility rites her priests can perform. Considering you are childless, perhaps it is worth seeking out the goddess's blessing upon your womb, dangerous as you hear those rites can be...
Perhaps Nerthus can help with my...problem
There is nothing wrong with me!
Irminsul Reborn

At no small expense, a new world tree has been planted in the sacred woods outside of Paderborn -- not far from the location where the previous Irminsul was destroyed. There have been months of careful rites performed, the ground consecrated with the blood of many slaves, and it has been determined that this time it will not be so easy for the tree to be violated as it was previously. A great wrong to the Germanic faith has now been undone.
Let the world tree grow large and strong
The Trade Guild for the Amber Road has been founded in [From.Location.GetName]
The Trade Guild for the Atlantic trade network has been founded in [From.Location.GetName]
The Trade Guild for the Balkan Road trade network has been founded in [From.Location.GetName]
The Trade Guild for the Baltic trade network has been founded in [From.Location.GetName]
The Trade Guild for the British trade network has been founded in [From.Location.GetName]
The Trade Guild for the French trade network has been founded in [From.Location.GetName]
The Trade Guild for the Iberian trade network has been founded in [From.Location.GetName]
The Trade Guild for the Mediterranean trade network has been founded in [From.Location.GetName]
The Trade Guild for the Salt Road trade network has been founded in [From.Location.GetName]
Interesting

More and more traders arrive in [Root.GetName] from far off [route_origin.GetName], and with them come their [route_origin.Religion.GetName] missionaries. Their following has grown much larger in recent years, convincing many of my people away from the old ways.
I will ask them to come to the palace
Not I -- the old ways are best
How odd this '[route_origin.Religion.GetHighGodName]' they worship...
The [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty is considered a §YDecadent Dynasty§! in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]
The [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty is considered a §YVery Decadent Dynasty§! in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]
The [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty is considered an §YExtremely Decadent Dynasty§! in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]

Things appear to be improving for the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. The number of openly decadent family members has fallen to the point where your subjects have begun to notice, and are commenting that perhaps the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]s are not doomed to corruption and heresy after all.
Of course we're not!

Thing have been getting worse for the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. More and more of your family members have become openly decadent, flouting Muslim tradition and propriety with their embracing of sin and wealth. Your subjects are beginning to comment that the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]s are facing the wrath of Allah if something is not done soon.
I'm sure it's not as bad as that

Your decadent [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], approaches you one evening in [Root.Location.GetName], intent on asking for coin: 'Surely you can spare some? You have so much, and I so little. My expenses are so great, alas...'
Well, [From.GetSheHe] *is* family...
More begging for coin? Get out!

Word of [new_martyr.GetFirstName]'s horrid death at the hands of the [martyr_killer.Religion.GetName], [martyr_killer.GetTitledName], has spread...and now you hear that [new_martyr.GetSheHe] has been declared a [new_martyr.Religion.GetName] martyr. [new_martyr.GetSheHeCap] died for [new_martyr.GetHerHis] faith, and so history shall record [new_martyr.GetHerHis] name and remember.
Our family is honored by [new_martyr.GetHerHis] sacrifice
The [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty is honored by [new_martyr.GetHerHis] sacrifice
The [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] is honored by [new_martyr.GetHerHis] sacrifice

Wonderful news! An envoy from [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has informed all members of the [new_saint.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty that the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] is to be formally declared a saint during a special ceremony in three months time. You have been invited to attend this solemn occasion.
[new_saint.GetSheHeCap] will be made a saint? Truly?
Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick]

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] generous nature and piety and declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] martyrdom and blessed sacrifice at the hands of [new_saint.Killer.Religion.GetName] infidels and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] strengthening of the [new_saint.Religion.GetName] faith and contributions to peace and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] tireless efforts to spread the [new_saint.Religion.GetName] faith amongst the heathens and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] conversion to the [new_saint.Religion.GetName] away from infidel beliefs and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] incredibly piety, so much so that [new_saint.GetSheHe] was spoken to by the Son of God Himself, and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] piety and the example [new_saint.GetSheHe] set as a true knight of Christendom, and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] leadership of the [new_saint.Religion.GetName] faithful as a true example of Christianity, and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].
Glory to God!

The path to becoming a paragon of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith is a difficult one, and will likely take years of dedication and patience before it is rewarded -- if, indeed, it is rewarded at all. There will be many setbacks along the way, and the purification of one's soul does not come without trial, but the truly faithful could perhaps see it through to the end.
I shall persevere!

With your wealth, it would not be difficult to build a [Root.Religion.GetName] church in [Root.Location.GetName], and the clergy would be very grateful. It would go a long way to showing your dedication to piety.
Yes, that's a wonderful idea
No, there are enough churches

The recent outbreak of a sickness in [Root.Location.GetName] brings to mind tales of saints who administered to the sick, doing whatever they can for the poor and helpless. Your advisors are alarmed, however, expressing their worry that exposing yourself to such illness is a very bad idea.
Of course I will help the sick
They are right -- it's too risky

Perhaps having heard of your efforts to treat the sick, a man riddled with disease has come to [Root.Location.GetName] asking that you lay on hands and pray to God that he be cured. One so faithful as yourself, he claims, is his best and only hope.
I will touch him and pray
No, healing doesn't work that way

You've heard rumors of a wise ascetic monk living in a remote part of [Root.Location.GetName]. Perhaps if you undertake a journey to visit the man, he could impart his wisdom upon you. It would be a difficult voyage, however, far more so since you feel you must go it alone.
I will go at once
No, it's not worth the risk
True dedication to the [Root.Religion.GetName] can not be done from a throne. If you are to be truly saintly, you must retreat to a monastery and take vows to serve God and only Him.
I will live my life in the service of God
No, I am meant for better things
There are whispers in your court that one who has so much wealth cannot truly be considered humble or charitable, and that such dedication to the material world is hardly the sign of the saintly.
Wealth is unimportant to me
What should I do? Give it all away?!

During your recent bout of illness, one of your maids is shocked to discover your hands bleeding -- as if you were suffering from the same wounds Jesus Christ suffered upon the cross. There is no evidence of the stigmata later, but the maid's tale has spread throughout [Root.Location.GetName] and many seem to believe it.
Perhaps I am truly blessed

You hear that [supporting_priest.GetBestName] has declared [supporting_priest.GetHerHis] support for your quest to attain saintly status. [supporting_priest.GetHerHisCap] last sermon was dedicated to lauding your virtues, and suggesting the [Root.Religion.GetName] faithful should emulate you.

You hear that [doubting_priest.GetBestName] has been openly doubting your quest for saintly status, suggesting it is proud that motivates you and not true dedication to God. The only thing that could possibly persuade [doubting_priest.GetHerHim] is to present yourself for testing -- but would it be performed fairly?
Allow [doubting_priest.GetHerHim] to test me
Let [doubting_priest.GetHerHim] doubt -- I do not care

After a thorough questioning, [doubting_priest.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is clearly convinced of your piety and that your quest for sainthood is genuine. [doubting_priest.GetSheHeCap] begs your forgiveness, and suggests [doubting_priest.GetSheHe] will do whatever [doubting_priest.GetSheHe] can to help you.

After a thorough questioning, [doubting_priest.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] declares that you are no paragon of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith and certainly no living saint. You are almost certain [doubting_priest.GetSheHe] had decided the outcome long before meeting you, and nothing you said could have persuaded [doubting_priest.GetHerHim] otherwise.
Which of us truly lacks faith, I wonder?

As you continue your quest for sainthood, there are those who compliment your extreme piety and dedication to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. Your name is constantly on the lips of the priests during their sermons, as they hold you up as an example to others.

As you continue your quest for sainthood, there are those who compliment your dedication to knowledge and learning. You are a true [Root.Religion.GetName] scholar, they say, and the priests hold you up as an example to all others.

As you continue your quest for sainthood, there are those who compliment your charisma and dedication to diplomacy. God has bestowed upon you a light that others admire, they say, and the priests hold you up as an example to all others.

As you continue your quest for sainthood, there are those who compliment your martial prowess against the infidels. You are a true [Root.Religion.GetName] warrior, they say, and the priests hold you up as an example to all others.

Your base lusts run contrary to everything a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should possess, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer them. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.
I shall make the attempt
No, this isn't worth it

Your gluttunous nature runs contrary to the ideal a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should aspire to, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer it. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.

Your greedy nature runs contrary to the ideal a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should aspire to, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer it. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.

Your slothful nature runs contrary to the ideal a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should aspire to, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer it. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.

Your envious nature runs contrary to the ideal a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should aspire to, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer it. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.

Your cruel nature runs contrary to the ideal a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should aspire to, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer it. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.

Your wrathful nature runs contrary to the ideal a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should aspire to, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer it. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.

Pride is the deadliest sin, as it is the source of all others. If you truly aspire to be a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith, you will need to conquer this belief that you deserve more than others. You must prostrate yourself before God and take what judgement He decrees.

Your deceitful nature runs contrary to the ideal a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should aspire to, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer it. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.

You will never truly be a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith until you conquer your ambition. It comes from a sense of pride, at seeking to raise yourself above others rather than to accept what God has given you. To forget one's ambitions, however, is not an easy task.

Your arbitrary sense of justice runs contrary to the ideal a proper [Root.GetManWoman] of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith should aspire to, and you will never achieve true sainthood until you conquer it. Attempting to do so, however, will be far from easy.

For weeks you have tried to forget your lusts, to focus on chasteful thoughts and nothing else...but it has been no use. Not thinking such things leads to thinking of little else, until you are nearly mad from the attempt. You are cursed, and it seems nothing you do will change it.

For weeks you have nearly starved yourself, attempting to force yourself to be temperate as a good [Root.Religion.GetName] [Root.GetManWoman] ought to be...but it is no use. After a late-night binge in the kitchens, you have to admit that your will has been defeated by your appetite.

For weeks you have been trying to be charitable, giving coins away to those in need and considering what possessions you ought to offer as gifts. Each time, however, thoughts of what you have lost dominate your mind until it nearly drives you mad. The last time a beggar asked for alms you kicked him. Sadly, it is no use.

For weeks you have tried to be diligent, forcing yourself to attend to every important duty no matter how minor. It has done nothing but make you irritable, and you slowly find yourself making every excuse to do anything else. All you want to do now is sleep, and forget you ever wanted to be saintly. It's so much work!

For weeks you have tried to be kind, forcing yourself to think well of others and not envy the things they have which you do not. It is all just a facade, however. The spite built up inside until you lashed out at everyone who crossed your path, and now you just feel awful.

For weeks you have tried to be gentle and kind to everyone who crossed your path. Your edicts have been merciful, your sentences have been brief...but it's no use. It's as if not thinking cruel thoughts has made them ALL you can focus on. You need some time in the dungeons before you truly go mad.

For weeks you have tried to control your temper. You have been patient with everyone, so patient that your courtiers frequently marvel at this change of heart. But you despise them for admiring what you know are false words. After beating a page near to death for spilling your wine, you have to admit defeat.

For weeks you have tried to show humility. You have complimented those who didn't truly deserve it, gave others an opportunity to act even when you knew better, tried not to be angry when things didn't go your way...but it's no use. You don't feel any different. Indeed, perhaps you're not sure *how* not to be proud.

For weeks you have tried to be scrupulously honest, even regarding things that one really shouldn't be honest about. You heart isn't truly in it, however, and sometimes you find yourself winding your way around the truth like a snake. It's time to admit defeat.

For weeks you have done nothing...almost literally. You've made no plans, made no attempts to work towards your goals, and indeed have tried to forget about your goals completely. Being content just feels so unnatural, however. You can't push the ambitions from your mind, and finally have to admit defeat. It isn't working.

For weeks you have tried to be just in the way everyone expects. You've made every attempt to care about what's right and what's wrong, listened to your advisors, but it just seems so...pointless. You don't think you truly have a sense of justice, no matter how much you try. It's time to admit defeat.
I will try again -- I must!

For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer and your duties, attempting to put all lustful thoughts aside...and, to your surprise, it has worked. Perhaps whatever needs such thoughts served has been replaced by your love of God. Whatever the case, you now feel you can move forward, pure in deed as well as mind.

For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer and temperance, eating lightly and avoiding excess...and, to your surprise, it has worked. Your appetite has been replaced by a love of God and, while you may never be truly temperate, you can at least rest assured your gluttonous nature has been defeated.

For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer and charity...and, to your surprise, it has worked. Giving to others actually feels *good*. You never thought it would, really. No-one will ever accuse you of being truly charitable, but your overwhelming desire to accumulate things for yourself seems to have passed.

For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer and your duties...and, to your surprise, it has worked. You have never felt so alive and full of energy. Granted, it's difficult and you are exhausted all the time, but you look back on the way you were and can only shake your head at all the years wasted doing nothing useful.

For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer and kind thoughts...and, to your surprise, it has worked. All the spite you used to feel just seems to take so much *energy*, you now can't imagine why you did it. Nobody will accuse you of being kind, perhaps, but a little of your love of God has now spread to others.

For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer and kind deeds...and, to your surprise, it has worked. Cruelty does not come quite so quickly as it used to, and it shocks you how good it feels to be generous from time to time. Perhaps such dark thoughts simply cannot survive in the light of God's love.

For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer and patience...and, to your surprise, it has worked. There have been no bouts of rage, no lashing out at anyone. When your old temper begins to rise, you think of God and it all seems to...melt away.

Humility does not come easy. For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer, and to thinking of others before yourself. To your surprise, doing so feels good. The way they smile is a reward in and of itself, even if you get nothing else out of it. Perhaps this is what God's love truly means.

For weeks you have been nothing but scrupulously honest, dedicating yourself to prayer and avoiding twisty thoughts of intrigue. To your surprise, it has worked. It has become easier and easier just to speak your heart, and you find yourself regretting the fact you ever felt the need to deceive others at all.

Putting aside your ambitions has not been easy. For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer and made no plans, and for a while it made you mad to feel so idle...and then, one morning, you just let it go. God shall provide, or shall not. Perhaps it truly is that simple.

For weeks you have dedicated yourself to prayer, and to dealing with supplicants in the fairest manner possible. It all seemed like such pointless work, and so aggravating, until one day you realize right and wrong isn't so complicated. God's love is justice, and knowing that makes it so much easier.
God has given me a gift, and I shall not squander it

There are those who question your mystic pursuits, wondering whether this is the act of a pious [Root.GetManWoman] of God or the dabblings of a pagan. You insist that it is the former, but perhaps not everyone will see it that way.
Am I not a good Christian?

There are those who question your more...violent...interests, wondering whether these are the efforts of a zealous [Root.GetManWoman] of God or the darker urges of a criminal. You insist that it is the former, but perhaps not everyone will see it that way.
I do what I do for God!

As you continue your search for God and saintly status, your chaste nature becomes better-known to those around you. Priests in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] mention you in their sermons, saying that others should take their example from you and put aside their own lustful thoughts.
All should strive for virtue

As you continue your search for God and saintly status, your vow of celibacy becomes better-known to those around you. Priests in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] mention you in their sermons, saying that others should take their example from you and put aside their own lustful thoughts.

As you continue your search for God and saintly status, your charitable nature becomes better-known to those around you. Priests in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] mention you in their sermons, saying that others should take their example from you and put aside their own greed and envy.

As you continue your search for God and saintly status, your kind nature becomes better-known to those around you. The people of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] consider you a generous ruler, untouched by the harsh world, and an example to others who seem to know only hate and cruelty.

As you continue your search for God and saintly status, your humility becomes better-known to those around you. Priests in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] mention you in their sermons, saying that others should take their example from you and put aside their own pride and concern for only themselves.

As you continue your search for God and saintly status, your honest nature becomes better-known to those around you. Indeed, you recently told the truth to a visiting courtier when a lie would have served you far better...and the man was so impressed he told the tale far and wide.

As you continue your search for God and saintly status, your sense of justice becomes better-known to those around you. The people of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] consider you a fair and wise ruler, trusting your edicts like they would almost no other, and an example to selfish rulers elsewhere.

As you continue your search for God and saintly status, your devotion to theology has gained you a great deal of admiration. '[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is a true Christian scholar,' they say, and many eagerly await copies of your studies on God and true faith.

There are those who have questioned the voice you claim to hear, suggesting it is not Jesus but a demon, or worse. Now it seems that tide has turned, and more people in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are realizing that perhaps you do have a connection to the Divine, that you have been touched by God Himself.
Jesus shall guide them, as he does me

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] now leads the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], but our allegiance was to the [former_khan.GetOnlyDynastyName] Clan and not to the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] Clan. Perhaps it is time for the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] to strike out on its own and seek its own fortunes...
We will not follow [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]!
No, [From.GetSheHe] is the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], at least for now

Dire news: [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has elected to split off from the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], citing that [From.GetHerHis] allegiance was to the [former_khan.GetOnlyDynastyName] Clan and not to your own.
[From.GetSheHeCap] shall soon learn the error of [From.GetHerHis] ways...
The Death of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

While [nomadic_first_heir.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is widely recognized as [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s chosen heir, there is also widespread support amongst the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] Clan for [nomadic_second_heir.GetFirstName]. With the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] having grown so large, some [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] warriors have declared they will follow him into a new clan.

While [nomadic_first_heir.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is widely recognized as [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s chosen heir, there is also widespread support amongst the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] Clan for [nomadic_second_heir.GetFirstName] and [nomadic_third_heir.GetFirstName]. With the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] having grown so large, some [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] warriors have declared they will follow them into new clans.

While [nomadic_first_heir.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is widely recognized as [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s chosen heir, there is also widespread support amongst the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] Clan for his other sons: [nomadic_second_heir.GetFirstName], [nomadic_third_heir.GetFirstName], and [nomadic_fourth_heir.GetFirstName]. With the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] having grown so large, some [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] warriors have declared they will follow them into new clans.
They would split [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] apart?
I will take my place as a new leader
Such is how it must be
Perhaps this will finally weaken them

Now that I am the head of my own clan, I must consider whether I wish to remain in the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] under the leadership of my brother. If I split off, it is possible that other clans might choose to join me...or I could be completely on my own.
I will forge my own destiny
I will remain in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], at least for now

To my liege and [GetFromRelation],
A number of clansmen from the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] Clan have joined my ranks, and I have decided to split off from the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] and forge my own destiny.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledName]

The [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] Clan has decided to split off from the [nomadic_first_heir.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], and since your lands border my own I invite you to join us in forging a new destiny.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledName]
Yes, we will join him
No, we will remain in [nomadic_first_heir.PrimaryTitle.GetName]

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle],
My clan has decided to join yours in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. Together we shall make our enemies tremble!

With respect,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle],
My clan has decided to follow [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] into the [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. We wish you well, and hope that [From.Religion.GetHighGodName] watches over us both.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle],
Your decision to leave the [nomadic_first_heir.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] is yours to make, but we will not join you.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledName]
With the province of [surrendered_county.GetName] cut off from the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], [liege_gaining.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s clan has moved in to assume control.
With the province of [surrendered_county.GetName] cut off from the [liege_losing.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], our clan has moved in to assume control.
With the lands of [surrendered_vassal.GetTitledName] cut off from the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], [liege_gaining.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has become [surrendered_vassal.GetHerHis] new liege.

With the lands of [surrendered_vassal.GetTitledName] cut off from the [liege_losing.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], [surrendered_vassal.GetSheHe] has fallen under the control of the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] Clan and is now your vassal.

By enacting this decision you will forever cause a rift between the latin and greek sides of Christendom or in other words causing the schism. Catholicism and Orthodoxy will wholly replace Chalcedonian over the course of the next few weeks.
Split Christendom
On second thought...
The Invasion of Neustria

A Viking warrior by the name of Rollo has collected a rather large band of followers over his years as a raider in the North Sea, and now rumor has it that he has set his sights on the northern coast of Neustria. Already citizens in the city of Rouen are panicking, fearing the imminent arrival of these barbarians.

A Viking warrior by the name of Rollo has collected a rather large band of followers over his years as a raider in the North Sea, and now he has landed upon the northern coast of Neustria and siezed several of its castles and cities. Many fear this Norseman will use Rouen as a base from which to launch further raids and thus terrorize the entirety of northern Francia.
Glory for the Gods!
They're coming *here*?!

Ruling in a strange land has been difficult, but the longer you remain in [Root.Capital.GetName] the more you hear about this Christian God and His ways. Considering that, more and more, your court is beginning to take on the language and mannerisms of the Franks, perhaps it would be easier to accept this new religion than fight against it?
I shall embrace this new God
Never! My faith in Odin is absolute!

The war is not going well. Those within your war council have uneasily advised that perhaps the best route would be to kneel before [christian_liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] and offer to accept the Christian faith. To not do so might mean the loss of everything you've attempted to build in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
I will bend knee before this [christian_liege.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]
Bend the knee? Never!

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I am not a fool. You will win this war in time, but I have a better solution: I offer my soldiers and my loyalty. I will bend the knee as your vassal and accept your [Root.Religion.GetName] faith as my own, if you will but spare my life and that of my court.

Signed,
[From.GetBestName]

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I am your prisoner, and you may do with me what you wish -- but I offer you a better solution: my soldiers and my loyalty. I will bend the knee as your vassal and accept your [Root.Religion.GetName] faith as my own, if you will but spare my life and that of my court.

Signed,
[From.GetBestName]
If he bends the knee, he may live
No -- the war continues
[Root.GetFirstName] Surrenders

Facing an ignominious loss in his war against the Christians, [Root.GetTitledName] has bent the knee to [From.GetTitledName] and converted to the Christian faith. In truth, there are many who say the Norsemen of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] have already taken on the language and customs of the Franks, and that this embracing of a new culture and liege was simply making official what was already in truth.
So be it
So long as he is loyal, I am pleased

There shall be no peace so long as you remain squatting on land where you do not belong.

Signed,
[From.GetBestName]

Now that you have converted, you are finally free to marry Poppa -- a consort captured at Bayeaux, and who you have been speaking with on matters of Christ for some time. Additionally, she has now born you a son and heir!

As you wander the markets you notice a new trend of religously themed kilim. Some are more vibrant in colours with fanciful shapes, while others are more simple.\n\nAfter wandering past the stalls for a while you wonder if perhaps you should buy one for yourself.
I'll take the finest one
A modest one is fine
The cheap one will do
Bah, I don't need a new kilim

It would seem some ill-advised bets you took in the past have come back to haunt you.\nYou ponder about making an even bigger bet to pay off your debt and seeking aid from Afri, the goddess of fortune.
I'll take the bet and make a sacrifice to Afri
I'll take that bet and pray for the best
No, this ends here
The gamble worked! You even gained more than you owed.
Praise Afri
Despite your pleas to Afri the gamble failed. Even worse your creditors demand the money immediately.
Afri has forsaken me
As you stroll through town you notice a young girl embracing her father. Having no children of your own, you wonder how nice it might be to become the target of such affection.
As you stroll through town you notice a young girl embracing her mother. Having no children of your own, you wonder how nice it might be to become the target of such affection.
I'll make an offering to Afri
I'll pray to Afri
If it's meant to be, it will happen
As you were trying to sneak out the guard captain caught you. It would seem the guards drunkenly revealed the whole plot.
My liege will not be pleased...
You've just recieved word that your lover was caught by the guard captain. It would seem your trust in those guards was misplaced.
She'll never escape now...
Your guard captain approaches you with noticable hurry. He informs you that [From.GetTitledFirstName] just attempted to elope.
They will both pay for this!

With the passing of [former_viceroy.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], [From.GetFirstName] has inherited the [viceroy_title.GetFullName]. Under the laws of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], [From.GetSheHe] may only retain the [viceroy_title.GetTier] with your assent.

News has reached [Root.Capital.GetName] that [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has taken the [viceroy_title.GetFullName] by force, and thus rules without imperial assent. You could grant [From.GetHerHim] that right, or your could deny [From.GetHerHim] victory...though doing so may mean rebellion.
[From.GetSheHeCap] may keep the title
No, [From.GetSheHe] may not hold the [viceroy_title.GetTier]

To my loyal subject,
I hereby grant imperial assent for you to hold the [viceroy_title.GetFullName]. Rule over it wisely, in my name and in the best interests of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].

Sincerely,
[From.GetBestName]
My thanks to the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]

To my loyal subject,
I am afraid I must inform you that I cannot provide imperial assent for you to hold the [viceroy_title.GetFullName]. My councillors will determine who in the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] is best suited to become [viceroy_title.GetRulerTitle].

Sincerely,
[From.GetBestName]
Accept [From.GetHerHis] decision
Offer [From.GetHerHim] a favor
Call in my favor
Offer [From.GetHerHim] a gift
[From.GetSheHeCap] can take the title from my cold, dead hands!

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA],
I hope there is a way I might retain rulership over the [viceroy_title.GetFullName], but I bow to your wisdom.

Sincerely,
[From.GetBestName]

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA],
I acknowledge that you have every right to deny me the [viceroy_title.GetFullName], but I hope that you will see the wisdom in reversing your decision. I am not without resources, after all, and would consider it a personal favor -- one you might have use of in the future.

Sincerely,
[From.GetBestName]
I will change my mind for a favor
I have no need of a favor from [From.GetHerHim]

To the [GetFromRootCompliment] [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
You are wiser than I supposed, and your offer of a favor in exchange for your retention of the [viceroy_title.GetFullName] is hereby accepted.

Sincerely,
[From.GetBestName]

To the [GetFromRootInsult] [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
I have no need of a favor from you. Either think of something better to offer, or accept my decision with a modicum of grace.

[From.GetBestName]

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA],
While I acknowledge your right to deny me the [viceroy_title.GetFullName], I am forced to remind you of the favor you owe me. I hereby call it in, in exchange for the right to continue to hold the title.

Sincerely,
[From.GetBestName]

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA],
I acknowledge that you have every right to deny me the [viceroy_title.GetFullName], but I hope that you will see the wisdom in reversing your decision. I am a [From.GetManWoman] with resources, resources that I am more than willing to share with a benevolent liege.

Sincerely,
[From.GetBestName]
Accept [From.GetHerHis] generous offer
I will not be bribed like a common bureaucrat

To the [GetFromRootCompliment] [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
You are wiser than I had supposed, and your offer of a gift in exchange for your retention of the [viceroy_title.GetFullName] is hereby accepted.

Sincerely,
[From.GetBestName]

To the [GetFromRootInsult] [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
I find your attempt at a bribe, like a was a common bureaucrat in need of having [From.GetHerHis] palm greased, to be insulting. If you have nothing more to say, than accept my decision with whatever grace you have left.

[From.GetBestName]

To the [GetFromRootInsult] [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
I will not have my titles ripped from me without a fight. I shall see you on the battlefield.

[From.GetBestName]

Your council deliberates for long hours before returning to you with their reluctant verdict: [current_viceroy.GetFirstName] is the only candidate they can agree on who is qualified to hold the [viceroy_title.GetFullName], and they suggest you reverse your decision and grant [current_viceroy.GetHerHim] the title.
Your council deliberates for long hours before returning to you with the name of the one [council_first_pick.GetManWoman] they feel is best suited to hold the [viceroy_title.GetFullName].
Your council deliberates for long hours before returning to you with the names of those they feel are most suited to hold the [viceroy_title.GetFullName]. It is not a long list.
I suppose I have no option but to accept
[current_viceroy.GetFirstName] shall keep the title after all
I choose [council_first_pick.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]
I choose [council_second_pick.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]
I choose [council_third_pick.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]
I will decide for myself who gets the title

To the [GetFromRootCompliment] [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
After no small amount of deliberation, my council and I have decided it is best if you keep the [viceroy_title.GetFullName] after all. Congradulations!

Sincerely,
[From.GetBestName]
I am most relieved to hear it

To the [GetFromRootCompliment] [Root.GetTitledFirstName],
After no small amount of deliberation, my council and I have decided that you are best suited to administer to the [viceroy_title.GetFullName] on behalf of myself and the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. This is an additional responsibility that I know you will approach with wisdom.

Sincerely,
[From.GetBestName]

Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], has approached you with a request: [From.GetSheHe] wants to travel to [Root.TopLiege.Capital.GetName] and spend time in the service of the empire. Even if nothing comes of it, [From.GetSheHe] hopes the experience will be of benefit, and promises to return.
Refuse [From.GetHerHis] request
Let [From.GetHerHim] go

To my [GetFromReverseRelation],
As it turns out, [From.Liege.Capital.GetName] has been good to me. [From.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has seen fit to provide me a position wherein I can serve all of [From.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName], so I don't think I'll be returning to [Root.Capital.GetName] soon...if at all.

May [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] be with you,
[From.GetBestName]
[From.GetTitledName] has returned home from [Root.TopLiege.Capital.GetName], though not quite in the condition [From.GetSheHe] left in.
[From.GetTitledName] has finally returned home from [Root.TopLiege.Capital.GetName], having received a fair amount of education while serving in [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s court.
[From.GetTitledName] has finally returned home from [Root.TopLiege.Capital.GetName], but it seems he's brought a souvenir from [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s court: a wife.

[From.GetTitledName] has finally returned home from [Root.TopLiege.Capital.GetName], but it seems he's brought a souvenir from [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s court: a bastard son who he claims is his own, though he refuses to speak of the mother.

[From.GetTitledName] has finally returned home from [Root.TopLiege.Capital.GetName], but it seems she's brought a souvenir from [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s court: a bastard son who she claims is her own, though she refuses to speak of the father.

[From.GetTitledName] has finally returned home from [Root.TopLiege.Capital.GetName], but whatever [From.GetSheHe] had hoped to find in [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s court it seems to have eluded [From.GetHerHim]. [From.GetSheHeCap] mostly remains in [From.GetHerHis] quarters since [From.GetHerHis] return, a black cloud of depression hanging over [From.GetHerHis] head.

[From.GetTitledName] has finally returned home from [Root.TopLiege.Capital.GetName], and it appears the duty and honor [From.GetSheHe] went looking for in [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s court was found at the bottom of a bottle.

[From.GetTitledName] has finally returned home from [Root.TopLiege.Capital.GetName], and it appears the time spent serving in [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s court has made [From.GetHerHim] a much more diligent [From.GetManWoman].

[From.GetTitledName] has finally returned home from [Root.TopLiege.Capital.GetName], and it appears [From.GetSheHe] did practically nothing during those years other than ply away the time in [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s court...an idleness that [From.GetSheHe] is now very much accustomed to.

[From.GetTitledName] has finally returned home from [Root.TopLiege.Capital.GetName], and it appears the majority of [From.GetHerHis] time was spent serving [From.Religion.GetHighGodName] rather than [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]. [From.GetSheHeCap] has become quite a zealous [From.GetManWoman].

[From.GetTitledName] has finally returned home from [Root.TopLiege.Capital.GetName], and it seems the time spent in [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s court has made [From.GetHerHim] into quite the cynic.

Your informants tell you that a golden opportunity to overthrow the [Root.PlotTarget.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has arisen. Luck will definitely be required in order to achieve victory.

Your informants tell you that a golden opportunity to overthrow the [Root.PlotTarget.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has arisen. Your informants tell you that a golden opportunity to overthrow the [Root.PlotTarget.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has arisen. [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstName] is in [Root.PlotTarget.Capital.GetName] and [Root.PlotTarget.GetHerHis] guard is down...and you have so many conspirators within the imperial palace victory seems almost assured. Strike now, while you can!

Your informants tell you that a golden opportunity to overthrow the [Root.PlotTarget.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has arisen. Your informants tell you that a golden opportunity to overthrow the [Root.PlotTarget.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has arisen. Tell everyone to prepare
No, this is not the time

Word has arrived from [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] that the moment to strike at [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is finally here. You have your doubts at the plan, however. If [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] fails at his coup, your involvement could be discovered.

Word has arrived from [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] that the moment to strike at [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is finally here. [From.GetSheHeCap] appears to have a decent chance at success, but you worry -- if [From.GetHerHis] plan fails, your involvement in the plot could be discovered.

Word has arrived from [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] that the moment to strike at [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is finally here. [From.GetHerHisCap] plan appears almost guaranteed to succeed, but still you worry -- if [From.GetHerHis] plan fails, your involvement in the plot could be discovered.

Word has arrived from [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]: [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is away from [From.PlotTarget.Capital.GetName], and thus the moment to strike is finally here. You have your doubts at the plan, however. If [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] fails at his coup, your involvement could be discovered.

Word has arrived from [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]: [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is away from [From.PlotTarget.Capital.GetName], and thus the moment to strike is finally here. [From.GetSheHeCap] appears to have a decent chance at success, but you worry -- if [From.GetHerHis] plan fails, your involvement in the plot could be discovered.

[From.GetHerHisCap] plan appears almost guaranteed to succeed, but still you worry -- if it fails, your involvement in the plot could be discovered.
I'm still in
No, this is too risky
I need to warn [From.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]
A bit of worrying news: [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] did not show up at a meeting to go over the plan. [From.GetSheHeCap] may have had second thoughts about taking part in the palace coup.

A bit of worrying news: [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] did not show up at a meeting to go over the plan. Not only that, your sources tell you [From.GetSheHe] may have informed [Root.PlotTarget.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] of the coming danger, though [From.GetSheHe] did not know enough to overly endanger you.

My liege,
While I cannot go into a great amount of detail, I feel I must inform you that you are in danger. There are those within the imperial palace who prepare to move against you and steal your throne.

Be very careful,
[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]
Someone's planning a coup, are they?
Everyone within the imperial palace is in place. While they are all nervous over their chances against the guard, they await your order to strike.
Everyone within the imperial palace is in place. It will be a risk for them all, but they appear to feel their chances are good and await your order to strike.
Everyone within the imperial palace is in place. The general feeling is that they are sure of victory, and await your order to strike.
Those who remain part of your plot are in place within the imperial palace, but everyone fears their chances are now poor. Even so, they await your order to strike.
Those who remain part of your plot are in place within the imperial palace, and despite the defections they appear to feel they still have a shot at victory. They await your order to strike.
Those who remain part of your plot are in place within the imperial palace, and seem certain that victory remains within easy grasp. They await your order to strike.
Give the order
No, we wait for a better moment
Abandon the plot -- it's not going to happen

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I thank you for your willingness to take part in my plot, but I fear now is not the moment to strike. Our time shall come again soon.

Sincerely,
[From.GetBestName]

As the hour grows dark in the [Root.TopLiege.Capital.GetName] imperial palace, suddenly there is shouting from the shadowy halls. You hear the sound of steel on steel, of men engaged in combat, and someone shouts 'Treachery!' A battle is underway!
Who is behind this?!

The fighting within the imperial palace is vicious, and while you do your best to avoid the worst of it you are still confronted by an imperial guard. After a brief struggle you manage to kill the man, but not before he stabs you in the side...
Just my luck!

The fighting within the imperial palace is vicious, and you almost don't know where to turn. You see what you think is an imperial guard and run towards him, but realize too late from the gleam in his eye that he is, in fact, one of the traitors...
Oh no!

Battles rage through the halls of the imperial palace, and just as [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] turns a corner [FromFrom.GetSheHe] is suddenly attacked by an imperial guard. Before the guard can impale [FromFrom.GetHerHim] with his sword, [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] barrels into him from behind and knocks him over, saving [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s life.
[FromFrom.GetSheHeCap]'s lucky I was there!
I'm lucky [From.GetSheHe] was there!

Battles rage through the halls of the imperial palace, and just as [coup_target.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] turns a corner [coup_target.GetSheHe] is suddenly attacked by a treacherous soldier. Before the soldier can impale [coup_target.GetHerHim] with his sword, [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] barrels into him from behind and knocks him over, saving the [coup_target.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]'s life.
[coup_target.GetSheHeCap]'s lucky I was there!
I'm lucky [From.GetSheHe] was there!

During the course of the battle in the palace, [coup_target.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] turns a corner and spots [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] down a long hall. Their eyes meet, and the [coup_target.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] knows right then that this [From.GetManWoman] is one of the traitors...
If I survive tonight...

Things are not going well. Already you see your forces scattering, routed, and just as you are about to give the order to retreat you are stabbed from behind by an imperial guard. He is cut down by several of your own men, but even so you feel blackness closing in on you...
Damn, I was so close!

Things are going well. Your guardsmen have the coup well in hand, and just before you declare the imperial palace retaken you feel a knife stabbing you from behind. The assassin is cut down by several of your own men, but even so you feel blackness closing in on you...
No, this cannot be!

You are in [Root.Location.GetName] when you receive word of a disturbance at the imperial palace back at [Root.Capital.GetName]. Someone attempted to engineer a coup while you were away, and while the details are still scarce the good news is that it seems their efforts will come to naught.
The perpretators will pay for this!

Things appear to be going well. You men have the imperial guard on the run, and most of the palace is already under your control. Just as the last holdouts begin surrendering and you prepare to declare the coup a success, you feel a knife stabbing you from behind. The soldier is cut down by several of your own, but even so you feel blackness closing in on you...

You are in [Root.Location.GetName] when you receive word of a disturbance at the imperial palace back at [Root.Capital.GetName]. Someone is attempting to engineer a coup while you are away, and while the details are still scarce it seems the worst may come to pass...they may actually succeed. You gather what men you can and start racing back to the capital, but it is likely far too late.
Who is behind this? They will pay!

Everywhere you turn there is a bloody battle. Worse, your imperial guardsmen appear to be losing! Just as the few men who remain at your side advise you to flee the imperial palace, you feel a knife stabbing into your back. The assassin is quickly cut down, but even so you feel blackness closing in on you...
Is this how it all ends?
Battle in the Palace!

Word is quickly spreading throughout the [coup_target.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] of an attempted coup in [coup_target.Capital.GetName]. Word is quickly spreading throughout the [coup_target.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] of an attempted coup in [coup_target.Capital.GetName]. A pitched battle took place in the imperial palace between forces led by [Root.GetBestName] and loyal guardsmen. Ultimately the plotters failed, and it is said that [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] was ultimately slain in the fighting before the evening ended.

Word is quickly spreading throughout the [coup_target.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] of an attempted coup in [coup_target.Capital.GetName]. A pitched battle took place in the imperial palace between forces led by [Root.GetBestName] and loyal guardsmen.
